text:
Aromat: z butelki piwnica i przyprawy, trochę banana z goździkiem na korzyść tego drugiego, ze szkła dochodzą przyjemne nuty białych owoców, jabłka, morele i winogrona
Wygląd: barwa złota, silne zmętnienie, piana wysoka, drobno- i grubopęcherzykowa, trwała, zostawia ładny lacing
Smak: lekko słodko-kwaśny, dosyć mocno piwniczny, ale potem już ładnie się tworzą smaki z aromatu, są przyprawy, są białe owoce, naprawdę delikatna słodowość, alkohol dobrze ukryty, goryczka niska, lekko ściągająca
Podniebienie: wysokie nagazowanie, raczej pełne, nawet pijalne, lekko taninowe
Podsumowanie: no i jest bardzo przyzwoicie, ale to nie mój styl raczej

i would pick this beer if i must drink same beer for whole life. hazy yellow color with strong head retention. aroma is lemon, pepper and barnyard from yeasts. slight phenolic esters are detectable. taste is slightly sour, then slightly bitter. medium bodied. acidic feeling with lively carbonation. dangerously drinkable and superb refresher.
On tap at New World Brewing. Pours a slightly hazy, straw color. Nose is light lemon and pear, taste is on the sweeter side, typical of a trippel. Very nice beer.

Clear with nice head. Aroma of green bottle - grass, mariju. From behind typical tripel accents like phenols, peach, caramel, fruits. Taste of caramel, fruits, spices - typical Belgian. Carbonation is high, alcohol is noticable. Expected more from this beer.
Aromat: kwiatowy, cytrusy Smak: cytrusy, slody, kwiaty bzu, ulozone alkohol

Barwa słomkowa, jasna, średnia piana. W aromacie słody, przyprawy, nuty kwiatowe. W smaku podobnie plus zioła, korzenność, nuty owocowe. Niewyczuwalny alkohol, fajna niska goryczka, wysokie nasycenie.

skunks, nawet przyjemny, brzoskwinie, przyprawy, w smaku dosyc kwaskowe, lekko przyprawowe, bije jednak ciagle skunksem w tle, koszona trawa, przez chwile myslalem, czy to nie dzikus, dalej wychodzi brzoskwinia z pieprzem, przyprawami
no niestety za dlugo na sloncu a jednak da sie pic

Colore giallo arancio, torbida, schiuma media persistente. Sentori di malto, frutta, spezie. Allassaggio albicocca, fiori di arancio, crosta di pane, pepe. Secca con un finale amaro con note acide, mediamente carbonara. Birra con un buon corpo ed un buon equilibrio.

(330 ml bottle) Aroma: Malty, yeasts for sure - fenols, also grapes and some fruits. 
Appearance: Pale, with yeasts particles floating, medium to big head, but short and without lacing.
Taste: Sweet, slightly bitter. In flavour mostly fenols and grapes (i really like that). Also some malts and other fruits. Quite complexed, no alc at all.
Palate: Light body, fizzy carbonation (for me its carbonated to much). Creamy, oval texture.
Overall: Quite nice beer. Fruity - mostly grapes and I like that - some fenols. Bitterness is palpable and quite nice. Also no alc palpable. For me, though, its too much carbonated and appearance is quite bad.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2017 Cloudy honey yellow with yeast particles drifting around. Big white dense head. The nose is fat pear, meadow flowers, nuts, yeast spices. Medium body. Medium dry taste. Not much malts. Spicy yeast. Some fruit. Nuts. Well hidden alcohol. Well done.

Bottle from Elysium. Aroma: Peach, esters, phenols, quince, herbs. Appearance: Golden hazy body, nice head. Taste: Lots of fruity esters and even more herbs and spices, yeasty, sourish, hay, some bitterness, maybe lightly acetonic. Palate: Medium body, medium carbonation, dry finish.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2017 Piwo klarowne, złocista barwa, piana niezbyt obfita, ale dość długo się utrzymuje. W aromacie przyprawy, trochę owoców, generalnie bez szału. W smaku wytrawne, korzenne, ale niewiele się tu dzieje. Średnie wysycenie, goryczka wyraźnie zaznaczona, alkohol dobrze ukryty.
Bottle. Hazy yellow/orange with a white head. Aroma is full of peach a long with spices, spicy yeast. Spicy with some caramel notes. A mild alcohol burn with some hop bitterness.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2017 Fris fruitig aroma met allerlei soorten fruit (perzik, ananas, citrus, gras). Bubbelogen schuimkraag en felle carbonatie. Warme bittere droge afdronk een mooie balans tussen zoet bitter en fruitig, prikkelende kruidige bitter

Według ratebeer, trzeci na świecie abbey tripel. Kupony w Carrefourze. Fajnie zmętnione. Aromat niezbyt intensywny. Drożdże, przyprawy i suszone owoce. Ciekawa wytrawność w smaku ściskająca po przełknięciu.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2017 A very dry and understated version of an otherwise usually unbridled style. Slight herbs in the background. Little bit of a saison tinge to it, perhaps unsurprisingly. However, I think I am more of a fan of the brasher beers in this style.
Piwo o barwie złotej z ładną, utrzymująca się pianą, mgliste. Aromat niezbyt intensywny, drozdże, estry, suszone owoce. W tle przyprawy, ale to minimalnie. W smaku podobnie.
Bottle from Saveur biere. Pours cloudy orange with bubbly white head which thins out. Banana, spice, pepper, funk, coriander. Flavour follows nose with a hint of alcohol on finish.

Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. Aroma is strong yeast, malts, flowers, spices, coriander, nice funk. Body is medium, spicy, softly carbonated, with a smooth texture and a lingering bitterness. Great drinkability, super tasty.

A 375ml corked and caged bottle, 2016 cork, with a best before date of October 2021. Poured into a Lost Abbey teku glass. It was a hazy golden straw orange colour with a just under two finger white head that had pretty good retention and left nice lacing. Aromas of peach, honey, lemon, banana and clove with some pepper and herbally notes. Tastes of honey, lemon, banana, clove, grass, pepper spice and yeast. Medium bodied with moderate to high carbonation. Overall a very nice cross between a Saison and a Tripel. Its got the nice classic Belgian beer characteristics and the 9.5% ABV is surprisingly well hidden.
Hazy golden colour. White bread with some cloves and orange. High carbonation with lingering feeling in the mouth.

Milda jästaromer i en mycket elegant om än något svag doftpalett. Svagt blommiga och gräsaktiga toner. 
Gyllengul färg och ett champagneartat skum med förvånansvärt lång halveringstid. 
Smakkompositionen är något obalanserad där skarpheten i beskan tyvärr tar över syran och eventuell maltsötma. 
Medelfyllig kropp och en mjuk textur. Tämligen hög kolsyrehalt.
Eftersmaken är lång och syrlig.

Piwo metne w kolorze jasny pomaranczowy z obfita sredniopecherzykowa piana ktora szybko sie dziurawi. W aromacie niezbyt intensywnie ale poprawnie. Drozdze i estry z domieszka suszonych owocow. W smaku w dodatku czuc przyprawy i lekki cytrus. Minimalna goryczka i wysycenie na wysokim poziomie, alkohol nie wyczuwalny.

light malts, yeasty notes, spices, citruses in aroma; golden orange, hazy, big long lasting off-white foam; medium+ bitterness and sweetness, light+ sourness; quite light body, moderately thick feel, quite lively carbonation, long bitter dry finish

Świetny, klasyczny Tripel. Co ważne - nie szastający dodatkami, albo kolendrową mydlanością. Jest klasycznie, lekko fenolowo i estrowo. Brzoskwinie i mirabelki w pieprzu to pierwsze skojarzenie. Do tego lekko goryczkowy finisz i nieźle ukryty alkohol. Klasa.
True classic. Refreshing, lots of light estery aromas and a slight wine-ish, bublegum-ey flavour. Some warming alcohol.
Peach, apricot, herbal hops and spices, no sense of alcohol, only some warmth on slightly bitter finish. Perfect look. Classic.

750ml. Milky rose gold pour, thin white fluffy head. Big sweet aroma of orange, apple, lemon, straw, lightly hopped. Taste is sweet, light, grassy, wet, orange, citrus, creamy & bubbly - quite refreshing. Its like drinking a Saison Milkshake.

the aroma is fruity and herbal with hints of sweet orange, tangerine, dry wine, yeast and spicy herbs... the taste is fruity and malty with notes of orange, grapefruit, dry wine, yeast and lemon peel... sweet, bitter and dry aftertaste...
Bottle 0,75. Pours hazy orange with large white head, nice lacing. Yeast, honey, citrus, floral, hay. Medium body and average carbonation.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Slightly hazy, light orange with lasting white head. Floral aroma with yeast, honey and some light spices. Taste is slightly bitter herbal with hay, bubble gum, spices and honey. Solid.
Floral honey yeasty notes. Mellows out during the drink. Kind of medical tasting flavours. Taste of Brett as well.
0,375l Flasche. Goldenes Bier mit kleiner Schaumkrone. Geruch nach Kräutern und Frucht. Schmeckt nach Hefe, Heu...
Bottle. Golden color with white head. Aroma has fruits, yeast, spices and apricot. Taste is fruity with quite long aftertaste. Flavors of apricot, yeast, spices and malt.
Sprankelend aroma met gist. Hoppige fruitige smaak met gedroogd fruit en veel gist. Complexe afdronk.

Caged and cork bottle. Pours a hazy golden colour with heavy carbonation making the tiny particles go all-over. The head is white, foamy, big, with good retention and soapy lacing. Aromas of hops and yeast with medicinal hints. These are more present in the taste unfortunately. Seems closer to a Saison than a Tripel. Still, overall pretty decent.

Butelka. Barwa złota. lekko mętna. Piana biała trwała. W aromacie drożdże, słód, winogrona, brzoskwinie. W smaku podobnie słodowo-estrowe. Goryczka średnia, wysycenie średnie. Dają o sobie znać klimaty wina białego - musującego.
Poca espuma y con restos de levadura flotando que le dan un aspecto interesante. Aroma licoroso. En boca es densa, recuerda a cava. Muy buena.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2017 Muffiger Heuduft, belgische Gartenparty und getreidiges Fanta Mango Feeling lassen einen frischen Kräutertrunk mit vanilligen Weißbierflair zu. A good one, but a Tripel !? Definitiv auch stolzer Farmhouser...375ml Bottle from BEYOND BEER HH. 3!?

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2017 Draught. Pours a lightly hazy gold-yellow with a large white head. Aroma is yeast, peach, spice, honey, and dough. Taste is yeast, grass, honey, pepper, almond, banana, and clove. Fairly bitter and relatively sweet.  Medium body. Soft carbonation. Sticky, creamy mouthfeel.

Hazy orange colour with quickly shrinking huge soapy white head. Aroma: Floral and candy sugar with matured cheesey notes from the yeast. Taste: Sweet start with a serious and surprisingly bitter mouthfeel for the style. Has some fruity tone too and a light champagne-like caracter. Elegant beer. The alcohol is well hidden. Medium/full body with fizzy carbonation. Long, very pleasent finish. A sophisticated tripel with a bitter tone and without big surprises.

Bottle 0,375.
Light yellow color, hazy, big head. Aroma: spicy & fruity. Taste: bitter, sweet notes, spices. Well balanced, ABV hidden.

Aroma is light tropical banana. Flavor is thin and body is thin. But was an older beer. Not my thing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bouteille LCBO. Couleur jaune-orangé, légèrement voilée avec une mousse blanche qui couronne le tout. Au nez, des effluves de houblons, de levures poivrées et un peu de fruits. En bouche, assez pleine en bouche, un peu dagrumes, fruit, levure belges.Assez sèche comme finale. Cest très bon !!
Mild peachy nose. Hazy yellow, mild carbonation. Light body for the alchool. Mild fruit bread tast. Not very interesting. Well balance but boring.

Cloudy blonde pour with a finger of fluffy head. Nose complex yeasty nose of soft malt and passion fruit. Taste lots of sweet malt, yeast, fruit juiciness that lingers , with a mild bitterness making an appearance at the end. Very nice.

Draft at Ma Che Siete Venuti A Fa Roma, Italy. 17.12.2016. Ciaone Luca and Alberto. Pour it almost clear golden color with big white head. Aroma Belgian yeasty, spices, clove. Taste nice sweet apricot, lemony, little bit sourish, spices, smooth creamy yeasty, slightly dry at the end, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, slick feel, fizzy, long pleasent finish. Perfection.

Butelka 375 ml, z korkiem ;) Bardzo dobry tripel, nawet nie spodziewałem się że tak znany i ceniony. Dość znaczny woltaż, takież wysycenie, dobra cierpkość na języku. Barwa miedziana, długo utrzymująca się i zdobiąca szkło piana. Porządne i godne polecenia.

Corked bottle LCBO: orange golden cloudy with small head. Nose is hoppy, herbal, yeasty with a citrus twist. The taste has layers of tropical fruits, pepper, yeast, and some smoked flavour. Full bodied and complex with a nice dryness. It was a little premature of me to uncork it without allowing it to bottle ferment longer in order to mellow out and harmonize its nuances. Still an exquisite Belgian.
Bottle from atourist shop in Bruges. Hazy blond with a frothy white head. Yeasty aroma with hay and citrus. The taste is spicy with more yeast, citrus and hay. A little funk. Nice.

Bottle. Clear effervescent golden body, medium fluffy white head with decent retention and plenty of lacing. Aroma of spices, confectioner sugar, peppercorn, dried fruits and some yeasts. Taste of sugary malts, some booze bitterness, spices, herbs, grapes and green apples. Great warming effect.

2016 est mort...vive 2017! Je souhaite à tous les amateurs de bière une excellente année houblonnée et espère que ceux qui ne sont pas encore amateurs le deviendront en 2017 et viendront agrandir la tribu des ratebeeriens. Et quoi de mieux pour fêter la nouvelle année que de débuter par la brasserie Dupont "Avec les Bons Voeux" qui pour ceux qui ne le savent pas encore étaient une bière traditionnellement offerte en début dannée par la brasserie pour remercier leurs bons clients. Bon client je le suis assurément. Cest dailleurs un de mes premiers coup de cur brassicole qui après des années passées dans le côté obscur du vin, me montra le bon côté de la force. Mais ressentir la force nest rien si guidé par un maître Jedi vous nêtes pas. Et 2016 fut pour moi riche dune grande rencontre, brassicole tout dabord et qui me permet actuellement dapprofondir cet art, mais avant tout une rencontre humaine, car cest la force de la bière que de pouvoir faire naître des amitiés. Mais revenons à nos Bons Vux. Quoi de mieux pour débuter lannée de façon enlevée pour une année Rockn Roll. Car cette bière est Rockn Roll : racée, puissante avec ce brin dexcentricité qui font les grands groupes ou musiciens. En verre, on sent lhabit des grands : costume blond doré taillé pour la scène. De lénergie à revendre avec une forte effervescence, une multitude de petites bulles et la grande classe avec sa mousse blanche de deux centimètres dépaisseur. Dans les gradins, lambiance se fait déjà ressentir...électrique...dans latmosphère on peut déjà ressentir à la fois de la puissance avec lalcool mais également de la classe avec des arômes floraux, dagrumes sur un fond de céréales et candi. Que le concert commence! avec une introduction basse et clavier : une attaque sur une une mélodie légèrement suave parée de céréales, dagrumes et candi. Entrent alors en scène guitare et batterie pour enlever tout cela et donner de la puissance à notre composition : lamertume et lalcool vont crescendo, lenvolée est exceptionnelle, avec un vibrato de nuances époustouflant. Les basses et le clavier toujours présents, marquent tout juste leur présence pour une arrière bouche sur des notes de céréales et de candi afin daccompagner lensemble. Léquilibre est parfait, et tel un solo dun grand guitariste, les variations sont sans limites, mais toujours dans le respect de la mélodie et du rythme. Le final finira par un riff sur les épices et les fruits confits terminant en beauté le concert....Le 5 nest pas même suffisant. 500?! Cela me paraît plus raisonnable, surtout pour ma 100 ème bière belge. Je pourrai vous recommander de la déguster sur une cassolette de fruits de mer, mais jai plutôt envie de vous conseiller de la déguster en écoutant les Kaiser Chiefs, et surtout de la déguster entre amis. De mon côté je la dégusta avec un grand ami belge, présent par lesprit. Avec mes bons voeux!

From the corked, caged 2016 750 ml. bottle. It pours a cloudy amber-orange beneath a long lasting white foamy head. I see some sediment. The aroma really highlights the breaded, yeasty, herbal, and spicy characters of the style. But also I find a touch of grape or other juicy fruit under it all and there is no alcohol scent for 9.5%. Medium or better body. There is a more spicy flavor with a little bit of grape or citrus twisting underneath. Same as the aroma - no booze in the taste. The peppery bite at the end is quite extraordinary. Very nice.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2016 On tap at Beerlovers Bar, Antwerpen. Nose is sourish fruity, wheat malty, Belgian yeasty. Body is hazy yellow peach, head is medium, offwhite, creamy, average lasting, excellent lacing. Aroma is peach, tropical fruits, honey, spices. Medium sweet, light bitter, medium fruity sour. Finish is medium lasting fruity chemical medium sourish, light hoppy bitter, light alcohol warmth. Full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Quite easy fruity beer, very interesting, not my style though, nice one.
Hazy orange in appearance. Aromas of earthy, spicy with flavors of pepper and citrus.
Deep golden pour, foamy white head. Aroma of bacon, smoke, barnyard, yeast. Taste follows, with more ham, and peppery notes. Strange for a trip but good.

Pours cloudy apricot with a medium frothy white head. Aromas of citrus, lemongrass, farmhouse, slight smoky notes, green apples. Taste is floral and herbal with fruity notes. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.
Hazy golden yellow liquid, small head. Weak aroma of yeast. Medium body, strong carbonation. Taste is weak, sour, bitter.
Hazy straw colored with thin white head. Light peppery and grainy. Mild sweetness. Finishes smooth and dry. Excellent clean crisp saison.
Bottle from LCBO. Spicy aroma. Dry and spicy taste with some white wine notes. Slight boozy burn in the finish.

Orange colour, hazy but still slightly transparent. Big frothy white head, scarce retention but good lacing. Aroma is estery/fruity with orange, pear, maybe lemon and slight spiciness plus a strong herbal/grassy presence. Nice and quite intense. On a crackery malts base, taste is medium sweet with medium to high bitterness, finish is dry and on the bitter side. A warming alcohol feel can be detected. Medium to high body with pretty high carbonation, definitely a full beer. Overall a pretty intense strong saison. ...(for the record, its very much a pumped up version of the saison dupont, which keeps its taste notes but kind of loses its great drinkability and simplicity, while not adding anything thats quite worth. Still a good beer, but kinda feeling like not as good as).
Golden pour, huge white head with sturdy lace. Nose is pears and hops, splash of yeast. Leans bitter. Middle is warm malt syrup, hints of spice, more hard fruit. Finish is dry and warm .
Pours a blonde colour. Taste is spicy and yeasty with an alcohol kick on the palate
Ocena przepisana z aplikacji untappd celem uzupełnienia profilu na ratebeer.
I love Duponts saison, and when I saw this I was excited. But after drinking it I was disappointed. It was not aromatic, hoppy or full of body. I was left with nasty taste from the alcohol.
Bottled. Raisin colored body, orange. Tiny white head. The aroma is sweet and full, flowery. The taste is great with raisins and flowers. Very complex.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2016 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Pours hazy golden with lazing offwhite head. Aroma has light malt, is slightly sweet and fruity with biscuit and spices like coriander and pepper. Taste is light malty with biscuit and some fruit yet spicy with coriander and white pepper and banana hints in the back. Quite bitter and dry finish with orange notes. A classic!

Great looking pour with a nice pillow of white capping the hazy golden liquid. Aromas are many with citrus rind and some clove taking the forefront. Favor is different, with some sour notes and white wine coming through. its that wine/champagne flavor that gets me down. Otherwise nice and malty, though pretty dry and slightly bitter finish.
Bottle. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of Grass and honey. Taste also has notes of honey.

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2016  375 ml bottle from Systembolaget. APPEARANCE: hazy golden with a large white head. NOSE: strong yeasy aroma of fruits, floral, spices, banana; bread and hay. TASTE: moderatly sweet, not as yeasty as the aroma. MOUTH: medium body, dry textre.
(bottle) hazy, bright orange colour with a tall white head; aroma of noble hops, then lilies; balanced flavour with a long, medium bitter finish

On draft. Fantastic malt and yeast aroma as soon as you get near the glass. This is "balanced" in the sense that the big malt sweetness, hop bitterness, and yeast spiciness are all nicely in proportion to each other. Delicious, elegant beer.

0,375l bottle. Hazy orange colour with quickly shrinking huge soapy white head. Aroma: Floral and candy sugar with matured cheesey notes from the yeast. Taste: Sweet start with a serious and surprisingly bitter mouthfeel for the style. Has some fruity tone too and a light champagne-like caracter. Elegant beer. The alcohol is well hidden. Medium/full body with fizzy carbonation. Long, very pleasent finish. A sophisticated tripel with a bitter tone and without big surprises.

Couleur jaune/or pale au teinte rouillé semi-transparente, une mousse blanche qui resemble étrangement à de la crème foueté, le col est très compact,
les bulles sont quasi inexistante dans la mousse. Une légère effervescence avec un grand rassemblement de lie dans le verre. 

Au nez, levure belge facilement détectable, pain frais, épices, sucre, poivre. Des traces de houblons sortent des vapeurs. Avec un zeste de citron frais et de levure fuité et sauvage. Un foin légèrement humide nous monte au nez avec un petit parfum caramelisé. Funky à fond!

En ouverture, cest sec avec un pétillant qui cache joliement lalcool! Saveur pleine, riche et somptueux. Un goût damande, de miel avec des notes de sucre caramélisé avec un bon coté herbacé vient débuté cette complexité. Une bouche sèche de par ses épices mélangés avec un bon zeste de citron et de foin qui proviennent du houblon. Des noisettes pleins la tête (ou la bouche), avec
un joyeux mix dagrume, de foin, de fromage, de banane et de vanille.

Une finale sèche, amer sur des notes non subtile de poivres, de banane et dune belle chaleur enflammé qui descend doucement!
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2016 0,375 bottle. Big thanks to my colleague who brought it back from Tokyo.
Appearance: Pours a cloudy light golden colour with foamy white head. Fair bit of carbonation and lacingAroma: Banana, biscuit malt and caramel malt. Some spice, bubblegum and cloves and Belgian yeast.Taste: Similar to aroma with yeasty, mild earthy and herbal bitterness.Palate: Highly carbonated as expected. Dry finish with floral, biscuit malt and earthy aftertaste. Medium body.Overall: A nice brew once again from Brasserie Dupont. Like the dry and floral finish a lot.

330 ml bottle. Cloudy pale golden body, rich frothy white head. Aroma is skunky, with notes of herbs, banana and clove. Taste is heavy sweet, medium to high bitter; malty, intensely herbal, yeasty. Medium body, slick texture, high carbonation.

Une 375 ml inhabituelle en Belgique. Belle bière dorée presque limpide, mousse blanche abondante, fines et moyennes bulles. Carbonatation vive. Subtils arômes de houblon, épices, fruits (banane ?). Goût malté, doux mais épicé, légèrement sucré mais fruité, moyenne mais longue amertume. Vraiment une très bonne bière équilibrée mais complexe. Mais, ... on sent assez lalcool.
Cloudy gold with nice white head, smells and tastes very yeasty, good spicy belgian flavour with a rich medium-full body, creamy yeast mouthfeel, ready, very delicious. Yum!

375ml bottle from LCBO. 9.5% alc./vol. Pours an opaque deep gold colour with one finger of white head that reduces into a ring. Aromas of hops, bread, and some citrus and banana. Taste matches the aroma with a dry and hoppy finish. Medium bodied with high carbonation. Mildly creamy mouthfeel.

Barely chilled this to enjoy the nice texture - supple & silky. Wheres the 9.5 ABV?? The flavors are very matured (its aged a long time) with some bold signature yeast underpinning the soft gently sweet pale fruits. The citrus and spice is all so integrated. Total win. This is more than best wishes, this is some actual love from Dupont.

Hazy, yellow, huge head, high carbonation (although not too much). Aroma: malt, caramel, bubblegum, esters, yeast and spices, after warming also dry fruits. Medium body, medium sweetness. Fruity flavour, yeast and hops. Finish is dry and bitter (medium intense), great hidden alcohol. Overall very classic, maybe more hoppy.

It pours hazy gold with lie floating about; the head is cream coloured and mousse-like. The palate has notes of: alcohol, orange-brandy, pepper, and fermenting grains. The taste is lightly sweet that finishes medium bitter and dry. The palate is medium-heavy bodied, with heavy large carbonation; it has a medium grainy finish. Overall, tasty - but a little boozy.

0,375l bottle from Beergium. Pours hazy yellow colour with moderate head. Aroma of yeast, caramel, malts, some spices, citrus, alcohol, hops. Soft carbonation, medium body, warm and a bit alcoholy aftertaste, slightly sparkling winy feeling.

19.10.2016 - Farewell gift from Thomas/Bierhandlung. Thanks a lot! Yeasty decent alcoholic smell. Full bodied pale malt with a little sweet fruity belgian strong beer character. Pleasant dry bitter hop note. Bons Vux back to Freiburg!
Bottle from Dranken Geers. Hazy golden body with a medium white head. Yeast, fruity, hops, ripe fruit, light alcohol.

Couleur dorée, un peu trouble, légère mousse. Nez très houblonné, alcool, note fruitée et levures. Gout houblonné, herbeux, note fruitée citronnée, alcool, avec amertume levurée assez seche en fin de bouche. Pas exceptionelle ni complexe.

Best before 04/2020. Aroma is Belgian yeast, fruit, booze, slight dank. Appearance is a hazy off yellow, pours a finger of foam that retains well. A constant bubbling from the glass causes a swell of foam in the middle. Nice sticky legs. Taste is white pepper, lemon, Carmel, booze, bread, skunk. Palate is medium bodied with some alcohol heat and warmth finishes dry. Overall- a very good triple that is complex and drinkable. Maybe a little hot.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2016 From the top of my head the alcohol taste was way too present.
Need to try it again maybe...

37,5cl-fles van bij Tabac&Co - Palais des bières te Dottignies. U: Wazig goudblonde met een grote witte schuimkraag. G: Kruiden, gist, fruitig en ook wat citrus. S: Floraal, kruiden, alcohol en fruitig. Bittere afdronk. M: Stevige carbonatie en volle body.

offert par Nutjes ! Bouteilles de 37,5cl.
Couleur blonde translucide avec un beau col de mousse bien epaix!
Au nez cest prennent je trouve lalcool "agresse" trop ! Malté et citronné ! 
En bouche , malté , carbonnisation bien faite , mais présence de cette note alcoolique trop importante. 
Un ensemble qui nest pas mes attentes.

2014 edition. Cloudy orange color, huge frothy white head. Belgian yeast nose, fruity, light candi sugar, almonds, marzipan. Sweet taste, light candi sugar, fruity, marzipan, hint of grass, dry finish, well balanced, hidden alcohol. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, creamy texture.
Bottle. Unclear golden color. Aroma: malt, pears, apples, a little alcohol, diacetyl, yeast. Taste: soft, malty, a pear, a little white porto, fruit, yeast.

Bottle. Lovely hazy amber pour with dense lasting offwhite head. Aroma has citrus and grass. Lots of yeasty notes. Taste is somewhat sour. Not very balanced. Lots of complex notes and the ABV gives some warmth. Medium carbonation

F: huge, white, very good retention.
C: gold, hazy, a lot of yeast particles floating in.
A: malty, citrusy, orange, coriander, dusty, hint of basement, straw, yeasty, peach, peppery.
T: malty, orange peels, coriander, peppery, dusty, earthy, bready, yeasty, fruity, grapefruit, medium full body, good carbonation, oily mouthfeel, very good to excellent beer, worth to try, good for cellaring, bottled 09/2015, 0,375l bottle from Prik&Tik /Quali-drinks/ in Brussels.
Donkergeel bier met veel stevig schuim. Smaak is friszuur en bitter hoppig met iets van citrus en ananas. Een heel bijzonder tripel bier dat wel.
Mooi goudgeel bier, met een matige schuimkraag. Wat fruitige smaak met duidelijk hoptoets.

375ml bottle picked up at Jumbo Supermarket in Amsterdam and opened on 12-Aug-2016, and poured into a long stemmed tulip glass. Hazy orange amber colour with a thick white head. Aroma of Belgian yeast, spices, sweet fruit and citrus. Medium body and carbonation. Slightly sweet, with lots of yeast and slightly spicy.  Tastes like a cross between a blonde triple and a saison - some champagne notes. Interesting, tastes better as it warms in the glass, but could do with a little more flavour.

Mętne. Piana średnio wysoka, dość trwała. Po otwarciu butelki roznosi się po otoczeniu wyraźny aromat skunksa. Na szczęście ze szkła nie jest już tak intensywny, choć wciąż wyczuwalny. Dochodzą do niego subtelne owocki w postaci brzoskwiń. W smaku ma nieco drożdżowy wydźwięk. Poza tym mocno fenolowe, przyprawowe z mocno wytrawnym, wręcz wrzynającym się w podniebienie finiszem. Nasycenie oczywiście wysokie. Alkohol nawet spoko ukryty.

Bottle at home. Hazy orange pour with a tall white head with excellent retention. Floral aroma, with additional notes of honey, light tropical fruit, bananas, peaches, caramel, flowers. The taste follows the same notes, well-balanced between bitter and sweet, a hint of salt and farmhouse funk. Medium body, medium to high carbonation and a bitter-sweet aftertaste.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2016 750ml. Bottle shared with Krabbe @unibar. Light orange, medium white head. Aroma of flowers, wheat fresh. High carbonation. Taste has a aftertaste of alchohol, not that bitter. Taste of bread, white bread. Roasted toast bread.
UPDATED: JUL 30, 2016 Bottle shared with Thorlundski. Aroma is flowers and ice cream desserts. Taste is soap. Not my kind og beer, but probably popular.
Mooi hoppig biertje! Bier met goed veel smaak. Fris en sterk hoppig. Mooie aanrader!
Bottle from 2015. Aromas of yeast funk, barn, fresh cut grass. Cloudy orange with huge head. Very refreshing with a nice firm bitterness. Exceptional.

Light orange color, a bit hazy. Yeast aroma with spice and a hint of citrus. Sweet taste, yeast and alcohol. A bit thin. Was expecting more since it had high ratings. Sometimes its better to just taste the beer without checking its score first.

Pours deep, yellow to orange colour with a small head and some little stuff floating aimlessly near the bottom of the glass. The nose brings bubblegum, peach, some banana, apples, sweet white fruits, champagne, flowers and just a whiff of spice. The complexity exceeds the intensity and it is worth mentioning that the latter is at really satisfactory level. The omnipresent sweetness in the taste is counterbalanced with nice herbal bitterness and a touch of sourness which results in an unexpected dry finish. As for the flavours on the palate - champagne notes and spices rule supreme. A bit warming.. thats it as long as alcohol is concerned. Extremely drinkable, treacherous classic style belgian Triple.

Hazy orange color. Highly carbonated. Drank from a pint glass, so had little aromatics, but I got some funky and fruity notes. Quite sweet to start. Low bitterness, a cutting acidity. Very malty with some clear spicy hops just poking through. Lots of esters. Bubblegum, oranges. Only complaint is a sticking alcohol flavor. Delicious beer.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2017 Aromat mocno owocowy, estrowy, w tle nieco chmielu, wyraźnie czuć drożdże. W wyglądzie słomkowa barwa, mętne, spora biała piana. W smaku dość słodko, owocowo - białe owoce, winogrona, jabłka, gruszki. W tle czuć nieco fenoli, drożdży, nieco przypomina lambica, przywodzi też na myśl szampana. Przyjemnie rozgrzewa, stosunkowo pijalne. Bardzo przyjemne piwo.

0.375 bottle.   A hazy, cloudy, honey-colored liquid with a large, white head. Aroma is yeasty, spicy, fruity, and bears notes of fermentation. A well-balanced taste with roughly even levels of bitter, sweet, and sour flavors - all in moderation; other than that it features spices and malts. A medium body, a creamy texture, and a lively carbonation.A short and tasteless finish. Overall the beer is rather disappointing - by no means bad, and hides alcohol well, but does not impress either.

Pours hazy, lots of sediments, Amber in color. White head, high and stable. In aroma yeasts, white fruits, flowers. In mouth quite dry and bittery, mostly from 9%. Mid body, high carbonation, little bit sticky. Feels light.

750 ml bottle from Hawthorne cellars. Pours dark orange with white head. Aroma of fruit and yeast. Flavours of hops, yeast, fruit, and spices. I love the fermentation on this beer. Dry finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aromat: Delikatny, drożdżowy z nutami cytrusowo-pieprznymi.
Wygląd: Złoty, opalizujący, z drobną, cienką powłoką piany + wyraźny osad drożdżowy.
Smak: Wyraźnie wytrawne z nutą owocowej (dojrzałej) słodyczy wraz z przyprawowością, która gra pierwsze skrzypce. Goryczka ukazana jest w formie trawiastej (lub jak kto woli - pestki brzoskwini). Mimo woltażu, alkoholu nie czuć (jedynie jako rozgrzewanie w przełyku), zaś samo piwo sprawia wrażenie dość lekkiego.

375ml bottle from private import. Aroma: awesome aroma of melon, spices, ripped papaya and quite floral and even funky. Really like it. App: hazy peach, huge off white head, good retention, good big bubbles all around the glass. Taste and palate: medium to full body, high carbonation, medium sweetness, fluffy, light bitter finish. Overall: honestly I took this bottle out of the cellar but had not clue it was a 99 overall and after smelling it I knew it deserves its rating. Really really good. Really like the mouthfeel. Its sweet but not too sweet. Its bitter but not too much. And its so fluffy which makes me want more after each big sip. Belgium breweries really know their stuff. Will sure buy some again. A perfect beer for a rainy day.

Robe trouble blonde-orange pâle. Arômes forts se dégage de la bouteille avec le bouchon. Carbonatation moyenne. Mousse abondante, beau col de mousse qui saère rapidement et retombe. Nez épicé, malté et floral, légèrement fruité. Très gourmand. Goût complexe, plusieurs notes se succèdent, fruits (melon, poire, papaye), moelleux du miel. Belle base maltée. Esters épicés, levuré qui marque la triple belge. Sécheresse nette en fin de bouche. Corps moyen. Alcool très bien intégré (9,5 !). Triple parfaite particulièrement complexe et équilibrée.

Bottle: Color: bright orange, foam white and tiny. Aroma: yeast, spices, ripe fruit, oranges, gently aroma of white wine, some funky too. Taste: fruity, sweet taste of ripe fruit, herbal bitterness. Palate: full, smooth. Excellent beer.

Unclear orange gold. Frothy lasting off white head. Great yeast character - prominent but not overstated. Plenty of spice/pepper but not sharp. Mild to moderate fruitiness. Alcohol is well hidden. Very nice.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 wlasnie sie zdziwilem, ze nie mam wbitej tu recenzji... no to dobra okazja, bo powtarzam sobie :) butelka, dosc swieza. fajowa, wysoka, bielutka piana. aromaty owocowe (jasno acz roznorodno, sa i cytryny i brzoskwinie i jakies insze blizej niesprecyzowane... jablko?), troche przyprawowosci (pieprz bialy), troche jakichs trawiasto-roslinnych nutek, troche dzikosci, troche a la biale wino mlode. w ustach lekkie, wysoko wysycone, drozdzowe, rzeskie. ma jednoznaczna, roslinna goryczke. ryli cacy. z plusem. Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

On tap. This is a style of beer I adore! Hints of wheat and fruit in the nose and on the tongue; wonderful. Very smooth, no harshness. I have been drinking IPAs and APAs recently; little did I know I was missing a beer like this! Stunning in all regards.

75 cl. Lotto 14258C, best before settembre 2019, aperta il 14 maggio 2016.
Dorata leggermente pallida, velata dai lieviti, schiuma bianca appiccicosa e pannosa di ottima persistenza.
Aroma erbaceo e paglierino accompagnato da note dolci di lievito belga e miele in secondo piano, pepata.
Al palato stesse caratteristiche con coda amaricante erbacea e paglierina mista a piccante etilico.
Corpo pieno, molto carbonata.

Bottle from Beltramos in Menlo Park, CA. Aroma of slight funk, hay, summery fruits, some earthy effervescence. Taste is light fruit, some cereal, a little earthy and peppery. This is classic and straightforward.

375 corked green bottle from Beervana. Pours a cloudy pale orange color with a massive white head that diminishes faster than expected and laces irregularly. Intensely aromatic mixture of floral and fruity character with some nice yeast profile. Highly complex combination of notes: papaya, prickly pear, mellon, flowers, honey, intense pale fruity esters, strong spices like pepper and clove. Note after note it unfolds slowly. Rich and wonderful. Taste is quite dry, spicy and fruity as a Tripel should be, although a bit different and... "Saisony". Flavors of cereals, mellon-pear, lemon, dry honey, pepper. Fruit and dryness. Sweetness, tartness and spiciness, intermingled in an almost sublime embrace. Medium body, soft carbonation. Brewed to near perfection. Almost no Funk so more Tripel like than Saison like to me. If I had to guess I would have guessed an ABV of around 6% ABV. Unbelievable integration of alcohol. Great aftertaste. A highly-complex, balanced and lovely Tripel by Dupont. A slight twist on the style and one of the best Tripel specimens in the world.

Bottle. Golden, medium hazy with medium, white, semi-densed head. Poor lacing, medicore head retention. Nice, fresh, yeasty, bready, hay and spicey (season-like) aromas - mostly peppery and notes. Interesting clear vinous profile. Taste is medium bitter - empowered by spicey notes, balanced with high malty sweetness. Light to medium body, high carbonation, creamy texture. FInish is yeasty, hay and fruity.spicey. In overall unconditional, interesting and balanced tripel. very refeshing and drinkable.

Bottle enjoyed at home
Orange hazy, big frothy white head. Smell of fruity yeast esters, cardemomme, a distinct unexpected berry aroma, hints of funk, light malts, spices, grass, complex and inviting. Medium sweet, yeast fruityness, alot of spicy flavors, cardemomme, pepper, cinnamon, clove, quite complex. Quite dry, very enjoyable. Moderate bitter, grassy tail. A fantastic beer, and it adds new dimentions to the tripel style as well

Hazy light copper body, medium lasting head. Aroma of Belgian yeast, yellow fruits, spicies, black peper, alcohol. Flavours starts floral, then belgian yeast, black pepper, spicies, fruits, bisctuit, alcohol, verry complex. The bitter backbone is felt. Long warm floral, sweet finish, ends dry and slightly tart.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Une des plus belles blonde que jai vu. Elle est dorée comme le blé, voilée et possède une belle mousse persistante. Elle est sublime en arômes. Cest floral, cest épicé, cest resté et cest poivré. En bouche, cest un équilibre exemplaire. Leffervescence nest pas extravagante. Cest subtilement fruité. Tout est bien dosé. Cest soyeux. Cest crémeux. Cest très bon. (1777-200316)

Aroma: Hefe, Getreide. Antrunk dito, guter Körper und balancierte Restsüße. Gut.
Mooie uitgebalanceerde tripel. Geel troebel bier. Geuren van mout, gist. Smaken van mout, gist, kruiden, lichte citrustonen, prettige licht bittere nasmaak. Mooie tripel!

Clear golden body with quite large white head that laces the glass excellently before ending up as a fully covering film. Sweet and strong aroma of Belgian yeast, sweet fruits and spices, with a touch of vanilla in the back. Strong flavour of Belgian yeast, fruits, spices (including black pepper), with fainter notes of alcohol and vanilla. Moderate sweet taste with a long-lasting moderate bitter finish. Close to full body, almost syrupy texture, moderate carbonation, but it nevertheless dries up a bit in the aftertaste. A wonderful tripel! 
[75 cl bottle shared with Svensenga smak & behag, enjoyed 3 years before BB date, from Vinmonopolet online]
A solid tripel. Not unlike Tripel Karmeliet or Allagash. Lot of body, no real funk, very drinkable.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2016 Bottle at eleszto importer. Hazy yellow colour with a medium white head. Nose is fresh, hay like saisony sourness. Taste is medium bitterness with very low sourness present. Mouthfeel a little bit sticky. Nice, but the nose suggested dryer and sourer beer.
Bouteille 37,5 cl- couleur oranger, goût dagrumes et dépices, très agréable en bouche, légérement sucrée, une très bonne bière

Tap / Tirador.
@ Irreale, Madrid, España.
A: Hazy amber / Ambar turbio.
T/S: Yeast, sweet, fruity, citrusy, grapefruit / Levadura, dulce, afrutado, citrico, a uva.

Ámbar turbio y espuma blanca compacta. Aromas de manzana verde, uva blanca, pan, floral. Cuerpo medio - alto con carbonatación abundante. Sabor de fruta verde, ciruela, uva y final seco equilibrado con regusto ligeramente ácido.

Gylden klar skum luftig lang 
Gær blomst humle stald citrus 
Bitter moderate sød lidt 
Tør livlig
@døe

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fruity aroma, with peaches being the dominant note. A little bit of spices. Also smells kinda like champagne.
Pale, hazy, with persistent white head.
Tastes great, with very well balanced bitterness and sweetness. Flavor is mostly fruity, mainly with peaches and grapes. Spicey in the aftertaste with mostly pepper and some cloves.
Very good, especially for its price.

Alaranjada, média turbidez, espuma amarelada de boa formação e persistência irregular. Aroma alaranjado, fermento, leve acidez e dulçor, convidativa. Paladar de dulçor médio, leve acidez, quase sem amargor. Corpo médio e alta carbonatação. Final citrico alaranjado, fruta amarela madura, doce, viva no paladar, excepcional.

5 finger white head, yellow-amber body. Nose: Yeast, white bread, hay, clove , alcohol and barnyard. Aroma: Yeast, hay, banana, alcohol, clove, cereal, white bread, and barnyard notes. 
Long dry ending with bitterness.

Bottle at Chez Moeder Lambic Saint-Gilles, march 15th 2015. Hazy golden body, white head. Aroma of stram, pepper, choriander and lemon. Taste is sweet and fruity, oranges, clove, with a dry spicy finish. Pretty good!

Aroma of citrus, stone fruit and yellow fruit on the basis of massive phenolic spicy flavors from the yeast. Very clear pale yellow color which becomes hazy as the yeast on the bottom of the bottle unavoidably gets into the glass. Less carbonated than its champagne cap makes me imagine. Very attenuated and dry but in a really pleasant way. The high alcohol percentage is properly hidden. Ladies and gentlemen, this IS the tripel. It should be studied at school.

Gialla chiara, velata, schiuma abbondante e cremosa.
Odore fruttato, pesca, caramellato, luppolo erbaceo, leggero vinoso. Molto frizzante in bocca, sapore dolce, leggero caramello, erbaceo, molto secco nel finale. Bellequilibrio tra i sapori. Ottima tripel.

750ml bottle. 8/12/14 bottle date. Appearance: Light copper and slightly hazy, with a thick white head that lingers with nice lacing. 
Aroma: Earthy, grassy, peppery, citrus rind, and a white vinous character. Prototypical saison yeast characteristics with some bready malt undertones. 
Taste: High malt sweetness with clove and pear. Just a hint of spice and a moderate bitterness. Taste profile is very much like a tripel. 
Mouthfeel: Light/medium body with high carbonation and some alcohol warmth. 
Finish: Frutiness (pear) remains with some light breadiness. 
Overall: Feels like Im drinking two different beers. The aroma is very much a saison, with spicy, peppery, earthy notes. When you taste the beer a lot of those characteristics disappear and a tripel emerges, with pear and clove 
prominent. Doesnt have the typical pepper and dryness of a saison. Overall a very good beer.....whatever it is
Bottle @ Importer Budapest. // Pale yellow with very lively white head. Aromas of straw and lemon. Similar flavours. Quite a lovely beer.

Pours copper/golden color, slightly haze with stable creamy white head. Viully medium to high carbonation. Aroma: pevails hop aroma, with fruity notes like peaches, melon, grape, supported with malt aroma, with notes of biscuit...
Flavor is similar as aroma: intense hop flavors, with fruity esters, which takes on grape, peaches, grapefruit, melon, apple...malt flavors are in second plan, but still very well balanced with hop bitterness. Malt flavors takes on biscuit, with hint of candy sugar; malt sweetness is moderate medium, hop bitterness medium and lingers thorough finish into aftertaste. Alcohol warmth is noticeable, but gentle and discrete.
Body is moderate medium, texture is soft, carbonation medium.
Abbey tripel with character of saison.

Draught at Comme La Gueuze. 2015 version. Nice bready mouthfeel, apricot, tart apple, wild honey, lemon zest, floral and peppery notes, dry finish. Always looking forward to this super saison release, yummy!
The beer is soft bitter, but also sweet (like honey), a bit spicy, some nutty/peanut aromas and a some farmy smell. Good mouthfeel. Definitely a great beer.

2014 vintage , Strong yeast and barnyard aromas. some cheese, citrus fruit. A lot of grain, crackers, some green bitterness, fresh grass, a little presence of sweet fruits. A good one, but i prefer the standard saison Dupont.

Bottle, 75cl. Hazy golden/amber with visible sediment and a creamy offwhite head. Strong yeast and barnyard aromas, with hints of banana, clove, citrus, vanilla. Medium bodied with moderate to fizzy carbonation. Dry, with a sweet fruity character and a subtle hoppy bitterness into a creamy, complex and well balanced fruity and alcohol finish. Top class Belgian ale.

Bottle, 750ml. A golden beer with a medium size white head and a lot of gas. Aroma is of Belgian yeast, green grapes, green apples and alcohol. Taste is bitter with a somewhat sweet finish that has a hint of alcohol. Medium bodied with considerable carbonation. Dry and with a well-balanced Belgian character.
From cervezasespeciales. In Teku glass. Watching Sons of Anarchy 6x12. Tartness in nose and the beginning of the sip but then it becomes deliciously fruity, lemony, sugary.
Onderste uit de kan, dus vies troebel. Ruikt zurig. Smaakt ook niet lekker, erg alcoholisch.
Heldere gouden kleur en een goede kraag. Ruikt kruidig, citrus, koriander. Smaakt fruitig, kruiden, citrus.
Goud oranje helder bier met een goede witte schuim kraag. Ruikt kruidig, fruitig, citroen, koriander. Smaakt kruidig, fruitig, koriander. Meh.

0.375l bottle. Slightly hazy orange body, thin white head. Aroma of hay, bread, cheese, apricot and earthy hops. Taste of hay, cheese, earthy hops and orange zest. Dry, bitter and very carbonated. Very nice beer.

Caña en el Lupulo 06..02..2016. Color amarillento con espuma blanca. Aromas y sabores maltosos con bastante gas. Sabores suaves bastante bien combinados con cítricos y maltas. Aparenta menos alcohol del que tiene con un cuerpo medio, facil de beber. Buenos recuerdos belgas.

Pale, hazy yellow colour. Nice white medium head. Spicy, salty aroma. Hints of sour pears and caramel. A bit of hay even. Flowery and fruity beginning. Spicy in the middle. Bit sweet aftertaste. Hints of caramel and some sourness. Light bodied, medium carbonated, very well drinkable farmhouse. Would have another one as soon as possible.

Un colore dorato carico con un velo di riflessi aranciati sotto una morbida e compatta schiuma bianca. I sentori rustici spiccano al naso seguiti da essenze agrumate e di frutta a polpa gialla non ancora matura. Al sorso le percezioni olfattive di confermano accompagnate da un buon corpo ed una discreta carbonazione che uniti in modo mirabile ottenebrano l'alcol dichiarato rendendo semplice ed ingannevole la bevuta. Non c'è mai un calore alcolico, ma sul finale una sensazione lunga e pungente ne svela la forza.

UPDATED: SEP 25, 2016 Typical belgian tripel notes in aroma - some peaches, bit of biscuits, rather sweet, but still quite crisp and fresh, not heavy and overwhelming. In taste exactly how you would expect. Similar to aroma - some fruity and bread notes, cookies, bit of spices. In the back end tiny but very pleasant bitterness. Smooth mouth feel, was expecting something bigger and heavier. Perfectly well covered alcohol, just a touch of it, but it makes it even more pleasant. Super solid, decent beer, good style representant.

Saison beer it is to me. Clear and simple with light peppery yeast qualities, simple malt bill. Not bold as trippel, not sweet or sugary/syrup. Farmhouse aromas too. Just a simple summer beer with some sour touch. Medium body.

Lovely, a bit dusty aroma. Taste is a bit spicy in a way. Slightly bitter maybe, but fruity. Strong body. Excellent and elegant. Has the fine belgian vibe. Not too sophisticated, but still shows some intelligence (like beer usually does!).

Tap into a shaker showing moderately filtered orange peel with a finger of white foam. 

The nose shows light notes of sour brett. 

The palate shows high carbonation and a medium body. Flavors of clean malts and non-sour bretty funky. Once again a foamy and luxurious mouthfeel.

Bottle. Cloudy light orange with a generous lasting foamy white head. Aroma of orange, clove, brown sugar, bread. Taste is of oranges, clove, ginger, caramel, bread. Smooth oily to foamy mouthfeel, medium carbonation.
Hazy orange with a fluffy head. Bread, lemon zest, hops. Sweetness dominated by the bitters. Long bitter finish

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2016 Malty aroma with a citrus and some unnamed notes. Hazy gold color with a medium white head. Taste is sweet, with notice of hops in the finish. Full body, oily or creamy ttexture.

Pours hazy pale yellow with a thick white head. Nose is citrus (lime) and caramel. Aromas are sweet malts, fruits (banana, peach...), some candy notes. Average carbonation, thick texture. Long sweet finish. Reminds of a Belgian tripel... and a very good one!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
At biercab, bcn. Fruity esters at smell. Complex flavor, fruity an sweet but quite bitter at end. Really balanced. Awesome.
Butelka. Aromat piwniczny, chmielowy, przypraw, drożdże. W smaku lekko kwaśne, goryczka lekka.

Bottle. Aroma of spicy yeast, grassy hops and pilsner malt. Complex yeasty taste.The flavours starts light sweet and sour but finish light bitter. The body is light and the texture is oily. Average carbonation.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2016 
Aroma:

Slight/medium aroma of malts, Belgian yeast, grain, spices and hops.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque golden/amber beer with medium/heavy yeast and with a medium white/off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Moderate sweet, slightly bitter and dry with malts, Belgian yeast, grain, spices and hops.

Overall:

This beer has a good balance between Belgian yeast, malts, hops and spices. Could be more interesting for me, but the balance is what makes this beer.

Bomber. Thanks to Paul! Big estery, yeasty, honeyish nose. Hazy medium amber color. Full fruit initial, mid has moderate and very pleasant sweet stone fruit, some candi sugar, and a smooth silky finish. Medium body, with perfect carbonation. Superb balance, and flavors develop gently and gradually throughout the palate.
Zu viel Kohlensäure, zudem viel Alkohol im Geschmack. Grüner Apfel, muffig, Alkohol. Etwas enttäuschen.

2015/01/01 - Pours a hazy straw colour, with a large, fluffy, off white head that slowly reduces and leaves moderate lacing. Aroma is yeast, dough, banana, apricot, bazooka joe bubblegum, spices (clove, coriander) and honey. Taste is sweet honey, banana, yeasty dough, spicy hops, coriander and a hint of alcohol. Starts sweet and ends spicy. Mouthfeel is medium and silky with biting carbonation and a long, drying, slightly warming finish. A great holiday beer that is both delicious and complex.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This beer when I, which rarely happens, keep me and I hope to take it to me on special occasions. A complex beer with flavors amazing, fantastic tasting in the mouth, weight and balance of a result of a working brewery with great craft.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2016 W aromacie przewijają się nuty skunksowe charakterystyczne dla zielonych butelek. Ponadto duża przyprawowość z goździkami i bananem. Bujna czapa piany, pięknie oblepia szkło i utrzymuje się przez cały czas degustacji. Kolor mętno słomkowy. W smaku wysoka podbudowa drożdżowa z przyprawami. Nagazowanie wysokie, lecz w finiszu idealnie przechodzi w bardzo pijalne. Bardzo dobre piwo dla entuzjastów stylu.
Magnum bottle from LCBO. Aged for a year. Pale yellow with very lively white head. Aromas of straw and lemon. Similar flavours. Quite a lovely beer.

375 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy golden, medium size, white head, good lacing. Yeast and peppery aroma, apple, clove, coriander and banana. Mildly carbonated, silky mouthfeel. Fruity taste, orange, apples, pears, banana. High presence of yeast. Peppery notes coriander and white pepper. Dry chalky finish.
SB beställning, flaska. Tjock fin eldig fyllig fruktig med metall långt bak. Värdig nyårsdryck.

Shared bottle. Pours is clear golden with big foamy white head. Aroma of malts, cheesy yeast, spices, fruity and floral notes, bread and toast. Taste is light bitter, light sweet, solid malty base, lot of yeast on tongue. Heavy body, oily to creamy texture, lively carbonation, dry, bitter finish, well hidden alcohol.

375 bottle at home.
App: Slight hazy golden with a two finger soapy bubbly white head.
Aroma: Oranges, apples and banana with spritzy carbonation and spicy saison yeast with some doughy bread and honey.
Taste: Similar fruits in the flavour but with more bready/hayish malts and spicy peppery yeast with a white pepper dry and slight alcohol warming finish.
Palate: Bigger body with spritzy carbonation and oily texture. A bit spicy and and boozy aggressive.
Overall: Very good. But also surprisingly spicy, dry and sharp finish.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Sola. Pours clear glowing golden with a very big creamy white head. Good interesting and complex aroma, lemons, yeast, weak acidic friuits and berries. Slick mouthfeel. Low carbonation. Taste is light sweet, grapes and some marzipan, also providing some bitterness together with the alcohol, moderate warming long finish.

375ml bottle. Clear golden with two finger fluffy white head. Yeasty aroma with fruity and flowery notes as well as citrus, banana and alcohol. Taste has a soft flowery bitterness as well as sweeter yeasty notes with citrus, apricot, banana, more general fruitiness and noticeable alcohol. Medium mouthfeel, low but prickly carbonation and a warming finnish with yeastiness and moderate bitterness.

Shared with benny at his home at Christmas Eve party. Hazy blond colored beer with small white head and no carbonation visible. Spicy hopped aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is hopped bitter spiced dry.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2015 Hazy blonde beer with a sizeable white head. Nose is mainly yeast, weaker notes of cake and caramel. Yeasty and fruity taste at first, phenollic and alcoholic finish. Creamy, sparkly body like that of a wheat beer.

Draft pour to a schooner at Elliott bay pizza. Pours a clear bright golden color with a thin fizz head. Champagne yeast like aroma with a soft apple. Flavor is a bright apple throughout, with a constant Belgian yeast, soft banana and citrus, and a semi dry finish. Enjoy the dominant apple for sure. Pretty good.
Flaska från SB. Disig orange med vitt fingerhögt skum. Kryddig doft med saisonjäst, söt banan och pilsner. Stor och fyllig kropp. Smaken nära doften. Bra beska, alkoholen märkbar. Trevlig!

Tap at the Delirium Cafe, Brussels. Poured a murky straw colour with a frothy white head and lots of clingy lace. The aroma is yeast, some citrus, light toffee caramel. The flavour is moderate sweet with a smooth yeast, alcohol bitter palate. The alcohol and yeast are dominating this beer and the aftertaste is not pleasant. I really dont get the high ratings here. Its an average tripel, nothing more.

On tap at Macche in Rome-Italy. Pours cloudy golden color, incredible white cap with retention. Nose: orange zest, coriander, spices, it is Christmas! Mouth: easy but complex, spicy character, super dry and clean end. Just great!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fles thuis. Mooi donkerblond met fris witte kraag. Ruikt een beetje kelderachtig. Zoete mout, zacht kruidenpalet van koriander, basilicum, munt. Sinaasappel en limoenrasp. Fruitig, deegachtig, bijna melkachtig, verfrissend. Soepel met zachte bruis. Erg lekker bier! Mooie fles ook.

Bottle from beerhive. Lightly hazed golden, big craggy white head. Spicy and yeasty nose, light fruit. Medium-full body, good fizz. Stoned fruit and spices, nuts and faint lemon. Dry finish. Hides alcohol very well. Very very balanced and I'm tempted to get another to keep for awhile.

Keg at Moeder Lambic, Brussels as Dupont Avec les Bons Voeux. Hazy vibrant orange, small foamy white head, light lacing. Aroma is wafer, tangerine, paper, powdery, vanilla. Body is medium, smooth, tingly carbonation. Taste is vanilla biscuit, apple, spice, dry finish with a touch of alcohol. Nice stuff.

Light and soft this yeasty and dry biscuity brew has a long bitter yet juicy juniper quality about it and is almost reminiscent of low carb champagne. Suave,sophisticated and long on complexity and flavour.
Dit bier heeft alles wat nodig is voor een goede tripel: mooie goudgele kleur, enorme schuimkraag en in de smaak een goede balans tussen bitter en fruitig.
Very nice tripel that is very soft on the palate yet lingers to keep you interested. The Belgian influence is there but masked by the flavours.

From tap. Pours cloudy yellow. Aroma is aggressively yeasty. The taste is not just flowery, but directly yeasty. Again, it strikes me as a bombshell... The shrapnels hops :) Its nice, but I feel like swelling from the yeast alone. With the alcohol volume taken into consideration, its not for tøsedrenge!

37.5cl bottle, served in Trappist glass. Pours hazy golden with medium white frothy head. Aroma is banana, yeast, cereals and candy. Taste is pretty much the same, very balanced, and the alcohol is not as present as expected. Quite effervescent, moderately sweet and slightly hoppy. Medium/full body, good carbonation. Great Trippel.
Sample c4. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of yeast, light spice, light hops, light citrus. Taste is quite yeasty, light banan, fruity, light hops.

750 ml bottle. Unclear golden body with a big, lacing white head. Aroma of citric fruit, Saison spices, oranges, and alcohol. Flavor is sweet malt, citric fruit, spices, white sugar, hint of caramel and a bit sharp alcohol. Fine body and medium aftertaste. Its a decent triple with elements from Saison with some complexity, still I have some problem see the greatness from a 99 point score here.
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar Aarhus. Pours hazy yellow with a big white head. Aromas of esters, floral notes, spicy, caramel, citrus. Taste has citrus, esters, floral, spice, yeast.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2017 Tap @ mikkeller, Aarhus. Aroma of spices, sweetness, pepper. Hazy golden with white head, mostly diminishing. Moderat+ sweetness, light bitterness. Full body, oily feel, soft carb., spicy sweet finish.

Butelka 0,375l Kolor złoty, mętnawy, piana średnia szybko znika. Aromat drożdżowy, winny i nieokreślone rześkie aromaty. Smak winny i ciasta ,nasycenie średnie. Goryczka średnia ale zabita przez aromaty owocowe.

37,5cl bottle from SIP veini- ja õllepood, Tallinn. Pours slightly hazy golden with a fairly large, white head. Fruity and slightly citrusy with yeasty notes, malt, spices and herbs. Moderate to medium sweet with complex, fruity, yeasty and hoppy flavours and a surprisingly bitterness. Certainly a tasty brew, alcohol very well integrated and quite easy to drink. Nice one!
Yeasty, fruity, boozy. Opaque orange colour with a thick head that just never disappears. Savoury, herbal finish.

DuPont Avec Les Bons Voeux 9.5%

Picked up this Winter Seasonal Belgian Tripel last winter in Rome but it is widely available in Japan at all fine retailers with a better than average belgian beer selection.

Pouring a dense orange-honey hold with a big aroma: tart, fruits(peach & pear), white pepper and a rich wine like character. 

Fairly full bodied, it has a raspy round carbonation but finished very dry.



The taste is plums, stone fruits, nuts (maybe almonds?) & some spiciness. Remarkably light flavor for a 9.5% beer. You don't taste it but you definitely get that warmth radiating from your happy stomach. Really nice stuff.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
0,75 Bottle, Vinmonopolet. Aroma is yeast, alcohol and fruity. Taste is well balanced between malt, fruits and alcohol. This is a very nice beer.

Keg at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, 20/11/15.
Hazed golden orange with a decent off white covering. 
Nose is fruit cake, caramel, orange rind, light bread, yeast, trace of spice.
Taste comprises bitter orange, candied fruit peel, straw, fruit loaf, caramel, light vanilla essence. 
Medium + bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with warming alcohol. 
Solid well balanced affair as opposed to the usual sugary boost jus.
Deserves its place at the top of the triple tree.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Lovely aroma of hops and heavy yeasty scent. Fluffy foamy head on a hazy golden yellow. Immediately tart, fresh floral and slightly bitter hops, strong yeast presence, spices like black pepper. At once simple in that you get an exemplary tripel, but also quite complex in its mixture of this doughy and spicy yeast character. Really cool. Dupont knows whats up.
Bright orange with white fluffy head. Poured from draft as part of a flight at Compass in Chicago. Tropical and banana lemon and grassy flavor. Usually don't love this style, but I love this beer

Bottle. Aroma is peaches, bread doug, hints of citrus zest and spice. Golden, hazy, nice medium head. Medium sweet, medium bitter, taste is sugar, citrus zest, hints of marzipan and hops, some alcohol. Medium body medium+ carbonation, nice mouthfeel, some warming from alcohol, long bitter aftertaste. Very nice!

Nel bicchiere si presenta di un bel color dorato carico velato, con sfumature arancio; generosa la schiuma, biancastra, fine e cremosa e dalla discreta persistenza. Il naso è splendidamente raffinato: luppolo, lievito speziato, lieve nota rustica; miele darancio, albicocca disidratata e frutta candita (pesca, arancio). In bocca troviamo note di crosta di pane, di miele, di frutta gialla (pesca ed albicocca) e di arancia; la dolcezza è molto ben bilanciata da una lieve acidità (lattica) che riesce a rendere la Bon Vux molto scorrevole e quasi rinfrescante al palato. Porta in dote una pulizia ed un equilibrio pressoché da manuale, ed è solamente alla fine, nel retrogusto ricco di frutta sotto spirito, che lalcool si manifesta con un morbido tepore. Stupisce per il modo in cui lalcool viene nascosto (9,5%); il corpo è medio, discreta la carbonazione per un risultato finale molto gradevole e morbido.

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2016 Goudblond bier met lichte oranje gloed. Mooie witte schuimkraag die goed aan het glas blijft plakken. Zurig fris aroma. Granny Smith appels, beetje azijn. Goed doordrinkbaar ondanks de 9,5 % abv. Lekkere warme afdronk in de keel die goed blijft hangen. Droog en beetje plakkerig gevoel in de mond na elke slok zodat je eigenlijk niks anders kunt doen dan nog een slok te nemen. Lekker !!

Hazy orange color with fluffy white head. Aroma is barnyard, yeasty, fruit-estery, heavy wheat, bananas, vanilla, a bit citrusy. Taste is a complex flavour explosion: Fermented apples, a touch of vinegar, lemons, wheat, spicy yeasts, heavy mouthfeel, not too sweet, warming boozy finish, high carbonation. Best Triple Ive ever had. I respect Triples, although its not my favourite style, but this one completely overwhelmed me. Probably because I like yeast-forward stuff and this has barnyard and vinegar flavours and is very Saison-y.

Bottle. Hazy orange, airy white froth. Sweet malt aroma, some spice and yeast, appropriate amounts of glue later on. Flavour is sweet, malty with notes of banana candy and whiffs of alcohol. Finish is cornflakes, very malty. Soft and creamy mouthfeel with nice bitter bite.
