Aroma and taste is fruity and light malty, with notes of yeast, some zesty citric lemon, minerals, some nice spices, fruity to dry finish. Very nice.

---Sent via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at Fairbar. Hazy amber body. Sour, fruity aroma. Medium sweet taste with light bitterness and medium acidity. Light body with average carbonation. Tasty and refreshing tripel.

Hazy golden with a generous creamy head. Saison like aroma of yeast, apples, straw, barnyard, funk. Medium to low sweetness, with a dry and light to average bitter finish. AVerage carbonation, medium to full bodied, creamy mouthfeel. Is it a stronger version of their gorgeous saison or the best tripel available? Alcohol is hard to notice but it can give you a very nice nightcap, beware!
750 ml bottle pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of yeast, spices, malts and fruit. Taste is nice yeast, fruit and malts.

Bottle 0.375 at home, Nivala. Vintage 2014. BBE 05/2019. Colour is cloudy golden with small large white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, citrus, orange,orange peel, hops, spices, Belgian yeast and malts. Little bit of too carbonated but overall enjoyable.

Spotkanie z legendą i niestety lekkie rozczarowanie. W aromacie przede wszystkim drożdże, oprócz tego białe winogrono, brzoskwinie. W smaku estrowość, delikatna owocowość, minimalna goryczka, dość wytrawne. Dosyć wysokie nagazowanie.

37.5cl bottle. Slightly hazy golden colour with a nice white head. Wheat, spices and fruits, citrus in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is lightly sweet with spice and floral notes towards the finish. Overall, a very good beer.

Aroma: ether, hay, spicy herbs.
Taste: dry, spicy and ether bitterness.
Flavour: prominent alcohol, wormwood, dry vermuth.
Spicy bitterness in the aftertaste.

Good one, but too prominent alcohol.

(375ml 2014 bottle from Systembolaget, cellared ~1yr) Pours a lightly hazy medium gold with a pillowy, lasting white head and lots of lace. Aroma has a core of lightly sweet malt with a bunch of wheat character and a little fruitiness, coriander, wet grass, citrus peels, peppery/lemongrass sort of hop/phenolic mix. Palate is light to moderate sweet to start with a touch of caramel, orange, peach, wheat, transitioning into a more dry and bitter middle with coriander, dry grass, citrus peels, fairly aggressive spicy phenolics. Phenolic, herbal bite lingers into the finish, which has a bit of bread/biscuit and dustier yeast notes as well, some hop bitterness, alcohol heat, and grass in the aftertaste. Medium bodied with high effervescent champagne-style carbonation. A good phenolic rather than estery tripel with a hop bite, but also too much alcohol present, even after a years ageing. Perhaps this takes even more time to settle down?

la Bons Voeux est une bière belge à la robe blonde cuivrée, trouble et à la mousse blanche crémeuse. Le nez présente de beaux arômes de houblons et d'épices, notamment sur la coriandre. En bouche, le léger moelleux en attaque laisse peu à peu place à de belles notes maltées avant un final amer.
Golden with huge fluffy head. Citrus, Belgian yeast and pepper. Sweet, alcohol spice and floral finish. Overall: Nice. Champagne like.

Bottle. Golden, hazy, average and mostly diminishing head. Moderate malty  some wheat and lightly sweetish - sweetish aroma, light caramel and fruitiness with faint citrus and spiciness (coriander), light hoppyness and alcohol. Body is medium, malty  lightly wheaty and lightly sweetish flavor, faint caramel and light fruitiness with faint citrus, light spiciness and hoppynes, light - some alcohol. Finish is average, malty -lightly wheaty and lightly sweetish, faint fruitiness and citrus, light hoppyness, some alcohol. Way too much alcohol considering the body.

Bottle. Almost clear golden color, white head. Aroma has floral and citrus notes, some malts and sweet notes. Sweet malty body, some citrus notes, some hops at the end. Hint of sweet fruits. Its getting better in glass.
Clear golden color with enourmous head. Aroma is yeast, fruity. Flavor is malt, bitter, dry. Bit too heavy.
750ml->tulip from State Line Liquors. Hazy gold with huge frothy white head. A: citrus, spice, Belgian yeast, lemongrass. T: citrus, yeast, grains, grass. Bittersweet. Decent, but expected more.
Bottle. Clear, golden with large, frothy head. In aroma fruity - peach, citrus and spicy. Similar in taste, medium bodied, long earthy bitterness. Strong carbonation, alcohol present.

Nez: Malté, citron, pin, floral
Bouche: Maltée, citron, épicée, herbacée, pin
Bel attaque fruitée avec une amertume moyenne longue en fin de bouche et une légère astringence.
Une triple fruitée bien réussie dans laquelle on ne sent pas trop les 9.5 degrés dalcool en bouche.

0.375 l bottle from Drankenservice Francoise, bottled in september 2014 (almost a year old). Clear, golden yellow with a medium large, frothy, almost stable, white head. Weak, fruity-yeasty aroma of peach, citrus and straw. Slightly bitter, fruity-yeasty taste of peach, citrus and straw, followed by a medium long, rather bitter, slightly peppery and earthy finish with notes of grapefruit. Medium body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. I expected way more than such an ordinary, almost tasteless and quite bitter beer. Still enjoyable but maybe I need to try a fresh example of this. Tegenvaller!
1/24/2008 1:42:26 PM Bottle from Cracked Kettle. Wheaty orange. Big head. Sour nose. Nice bite. Sweet. Tangy. Orange and mango flavour. High alcohol content and taste. Tart. Nice body.

Golden with a big long lasting white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, caramel, butter, spice and alcohol. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter and light acidic, really well balanced. Body is medium, texture is creamy and carbonation is soft.

Nice light maltiness, pleasant fruitiness, citrus, spicy, somewhat wheaty, bit yeasty, light grassy hops. Moderate sweetness with quite long moderate bittersweet finish.
Nothing extraordinary, but quite lovely brew.
Aroma: Old apple wine, rubber, wild yeast. Taste: quite plane, sweet lemon water with fresh bitterness. But overall, not for my likeing

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2016 Nel bicchiere appare dorata, molto velata, e con una schiuma cremosa, bianca, abbondante e lungamente persistente. Note speziate e fruttate, di pane  accompagnano le note amare ed erbacee. Lalcol però è predominante. Al palato è ben carbonata, ma il corpo è più che strutturato per sostenerne lalcol. In bocca è molto più fresca, con le note fruttate (anche un po di note citriche sono presenti) ma anche speziate che ne accompagnano la bevuta, verso un finale amaro (erbaceo) di buona persistenza e durata.
Hazy gold,white head.Nose ia sweet,spicy & fruity.Gassy palate,spicy yeast,orange zest, light malt. Medium hop bitterness in finish

Aroma: belgian yeast, yellow fruits, white wine, light toffee and wild notes. Taste: yellow fruits, yeast cake, white grapes and light spices. Nice white head, great lacing and medium to high carbonation.

Taste is grain, a little alcoholic kick, some mild spice, and a bit of that German beer flavor. Admittedly, I kinda assumed this was a saison when I bought it, and Im a bit disappointed that it isnt. Not bad for what it is though.
Color is between blond and amber, accompagnied by a big white head. Floral and barnyard aromas, with a hint of apple. Its mildly bitter, which makes it very enjoyable to drink. Loved it.
Fantastisch biertje. Fris, licht zoet en ook een beetje bitter. Het schuim drinkt heerlijk. Mooie matgele klaverhoning kleur. Hoe meer ik drink hoe dieper de smaak is.

1.5 litre bottle from the LCBO. Pours a clear clear golden copper. Very carbonated, massive white head that dissipates quickly, not too much lace to speak of. Nose is A typical Belgian, sweet, quite a bit of booze. Tastes rather hot, dry, a little crisp biscuity malt and hop bitterness.
375 ml systembolaget. Doftar mycket jäst. Smakar tort, och bitter och en hel del jäst.
Bottle, 375 ml from Magic Beer Room, Zagreb. Pours unclear yellow, white head. Yeast particles floating inside. Spicy, malty, light citrus, quite yeasty. Not bad, but expected a way more.

Orange slightly hazy beer with big white cloudy head leaving lacing. Aroma is yeasty, pale malty, tart and toffeey sweet. Flavor is yeasty, fruity and malty. Palate is full and foaming in the mouth. Finishes with mild bitterness, maltiness, yeast and alcohol. Pouring in the yeast makes the beer hazy and adds peppery yeastiness. Perhaps not in the freshest possible form, the maltiness is quite harsh and almost cardboardy.

37.5cl Bottle pours a light golden colour with a white head
 Aroma mild grain with pepper and bit of fruit
 Taste is bitterish with sweet grainy tones and a long dry finish
 another nice beer from Dupont

Bottle from Tanakaya. Poured into a Duvel glass. Pours a hazy golden color with a huge soapy mountain of a head that dissipates but never fully disappears. Very nice saison nose with Dupont yeast, cinnamon, nutmeg, peach, apple and booze all present on the nose. Taste is fairly similar with peach really standing out along with some muscat as it warms up. Medium to slight full body with average carbonation. Finish has strong notes of honey and is slightly warming with the booze quite noticeable in a christmas/new years seasonal beer kind of way. Finish is fruit-forward but dry with some sweetness from the honey and some lingering bitterness.

Piana biała drobno, średnio i grubo pęcherzykowa, dość trwała jak na tak wysoki alkohol, barwa złota, opalizująca. Aromat niezbyt intensywny, dominują drożdże, ciasto drożdżowe, w głębi białe winogrona, brzoskwinie, białe wino. Smak dość wytrawny jak na tripla, delikatna owocowość, estrowość i słodowość kontrowana jest sporą jak na ten styl goryczką, pestkową i fajnie maskującą wysoki alkohol, który praktycznie tylko rozgrzewa w przełyku pozostając idealnie ukrytym w smaku. Nagazowanie średnie do wysokiego. 
Charakterystyczny, zdecydowanie półwytrawny i nie słodki Tripel, bardzo pijalny i chmielowy, ze zdecydowaną goryczką, przypominającą pestki brzoskwini czy moreli. Piwo, przy dużym podobieństwie do białego wina musującego, zachowało jednak swój belgijski charakter.

Bottle. Hazy golden color with a medium thick foamy white head. Aroma of grain, pilsner malt and yeast. Slightly sour and bitter malty taste. A bit sour finish. Medium body.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Pours slightly hazy pale straw with two fingers of rocky white head, excellent retention and lacing. (5/5) Nose is complex: floral and herbal, lemon, pine, dank, cheese, vinous notes. (8/10) Taste is mild to moderate sweet, mild bitter and tart. (8/10) Medium body, lively carbonation, medium duration finish with a little lingering alcohol warming. (4/5)

Quite happy to get my hands on a relatively limited release beer like this for my 1000th unique on Untappd. Interesting and complex, with a flavour profile that compares to wilds or spontanales, but the strong Dupont yeast character keeps things in line. The vinous notes make it seem like champagne to toast my (dubious) accomplishment. Cheers! (16/20)

Hazy gold color, big head! Aroma is floral and herbal, yeast, sweet fruits, clove, banana. Taste is quite dry, bitter balanced by moderate sweetness. Falvor is spicy, herbal, fruits. Aftertaste dry with hint of alcohol. Medium tl full body, strong carbonation. Great stuff.

Bottle, 2012. Pours hazy orange, large puffy off-white head that dissipates slowly and laces well. Thousands of floaties of all sizes; I have never seen a dirtier beer in my life. Aroma is Belgian yeast, honey, bread, hay, grass. Flavor is medium sweet and light plus bitter, fruity and sticky. Medium body, super-hot from ABV, very highly carbonated - let it sit a while. Tripel is not my thing in general, and this one is no different.

75cl in teku. Pours a very abundant white frothy and rocky head, long lasting; nice deep yellow to golden colour, hazy and with some little yeast particles. Smells huge (belgian) yeast, fruity, banana, spicy (clove/vanilla), some sweet yellow citrus, sparkling white vinous notes. Tastes fruity with apple, great yeast profile with some light cheesy funkiness, citrus, spices, straw, cereals, light and pleasant alcohol notes as a tripel should have; almost medium level but short sweetness, medium + bitterness coming from a various hop background. Yeasty, hoppy and dry finish, slight tart. Lively/high carbonation, medium body, fizzy. The beer that resembles most the adjectives tripel and belgian, yeast is a key element. Complex, refined, a true classic

Bière partagée avec Bruno B. et Mademoiselle Irina en accompagnement de poivrons farcis préparés selon une recette Roumaine. La Bons Voeux de Dupont correspond parfaitement à limage que je me fais dune bière Belge forte (de type triple). La bière est dorée, légèrement trouble et dominée par une tête des plus généreuses te mousseuses qui soient! Des grosses bulles flottent à la surface tandis que dautres émanent avec énergie du fond de mon verre. La mousse est infinie et présente, comme la plupart des bières Belges du même type, une architecture digne des oeuvres de Gaudi. La bière affiche des arômes quelques peu vineux, citronnés et boisés. Bien entendu, les incontournables notes levurées Belges sont parfaitement balancées. Le nez est complexe et fort plaisant. Léquilibre est aussi parfait en bouche avec cette fois, une magnifique carbonisation qui pique légèrement la langue, juste assez pour être rafraichissante à souhait, sans toutefois gêner le palais. Une douce alcool est présente. Le mariage est parfait entre ce joli houblon Belge et laneth qui se trouve dans mon assiette et qui parfume tant les poivrons que la finale houblonnée de la bière. Magnifique dégustation!

May 15, 2015. Bottle at home, best before october 2019. 
Clear golden with a large frothy, quickly dissipating, white head. Aroma is hay, white pepper, grass, sweet grain, lemon. Taste is medium sweet malty with slight almond, citrus, hay, medium bitter with a dry bitter lasting finish, slight alcohol warmth in the finish along with a sweet maltiness. Medium bodied, soft carbonation.

375cc bottle. Pours orange almost with thin white champagne like head. Floral, fruity and spice. In the mouth is crispy and dry for a 9,5%. Very nicely balanced sweet/bitter. Aftertaste is fruity. Great beer.

Very refreshing aroma, not that overwhelming. First sip is very welcoming, a little fruitiness, a little sweet and a little bitter. In the aftertaste a little peach and apple after the bitterness fades away. A wonderful brew, really remarkable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy (iOs)
0,7l cork and caged, flavor is slightly bitter than expected, but also refreshingly citrusy. Tingling spicy, almost wild. Really brut. Relatively thin body, high carbonation. Nice sample

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2015 375ml bottle. Refreshing aroma welcomes you the minute the cork pops off: gentle blend of pine, tobacco, hay. Hint of lemon. At this point I haven't even poured it into the glass (!). Beautiful golden honey pour with bubbly lasting head. Pine dominates the aroma now, it is borderline marihuana. Cheese aroma also permeates, alongside a distinct yeasty basement funk. A little boozy as well. The taste is very distinct, and quite boozy. The taste development goes from a pine infused Duvel taste towards white wine (limoncello maybe even), and ends with a bitter aftertaste that reveals blue cheese, pine and a hint of seaweed. Definitely interesting.

@ Havregatan 150502. Bottle (375 ml) from Systembolaget. Fruity and yeasty with spicy and grassy notes, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter and fruity with yeasty and spicy notes.

0,375 l 
barnyard, cereal, citrus, herbs, golden, hazy, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, lively, long finish,
Bottle.Hazy golden colour with large white fluffy head.Aroma is sweet and flowery with taste of citrus and slight coriander even yeast and hops.well balanced and complex type of beer.

Blonde voilé. Belle mousse dense et onctueuse. Céréale. Très levuré "Saison". Légère astringence. Un peu citronné. Épicé. Chaleur d'alcool. Blé. Légèrement fruité. Trace de levure sauvage (brett). Finale sèche et un peu âcre. Très bien.

375ml bottle at home. Somewhat hazy golden with a medium white soapy head. Medium to full body with fizzy carbonation. First taste is sour, then fruity sweetness with some bitter tones. Apple, grape, citrus, hay, grass, flowers and herbs. A very tasty tripel.

Bouteille 375ml, gracieuseté de tom10101, merci Tommy! Couleur dorée légèrement voilée, mousse blanche crémeuse laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme de levure, pain frais, gâteau des anges. Goût de levure, un peu sucré, malt pâle, gâteau des anges, légère amertume en fin de bouche. Carbonatation élevée, corps moyen.

04-APR-2015, draft @Øl & Brød, with Christina, Morten, Marianne.
Hazy godlen with high, lasting, creamy, yellow head.
Banana, clove, yest, spice, straw, sweet fruit. Very tripelish.
Full body, lively carbonation. Very nice.
375ml bottle at BePLUS, Xiamen on 18 March. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of Belgian yeast and spice with orange peel. Bittersweet finish. For a 9.5% beer not really doing it for me.
Nice clean saison. No tasting notes for this one, had it as part of the Mikkeller Ol Og Brod six course tasting menu in Copenhagen
Bottle shared by Kevin. Pours a transparent golden with a thick layer of creamy off white head. Aroma is yeasty with some spice and malts. Taste of yeast and spice.

Hazy, golden colored beer with a one finger high, white, head. 

Nose: Green apple, Belgian yeast, banana, vinegar, citrus, orange, pear and herbs.
Taste: Fresh, complex taste of apples, pears, banana, citrus, hops, marzipan, white bread, melon and coriander.
Body: Full body with high carbonation. Beatiful, balanced, bitterness. Dry earthy ending. 

This is great Saison, one of the best Ive had!

A hazy dull orange color with tons of fluffy white head. Smells of funky barnyard, perm, some citrus, apple, pineapples, a little floral, vinegar. Taste is a funky spicy flavor up front with sweet fruit, vanilla that gives way to some spicy hop flavors to finish. Plenty of carbonation, bubbly on the tongue. Alcohol well hidden. Well done and labeled a triple on here even though it says saison on the bottle. I'd agree with that, and say it's my favorite triple thus far. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bread, hay, citrus, basement aromas, golden, clear, white foam, medium sweetness, bitter, medium body, long finish, taste of banana, nice!

2013 bottle. Semi-clear golden with a massive white foam, dissipates slowly leaving lots of lacings. Complex and refreshing aroma of honey, herbs, spices, citrus, elder-flower, a slight funkiness with floral notes. Taste is wonderfully balanced, great malty backbone of honey and bread combined with the most refreshing hops, melon vibes, green apples, giving a slight bitter, rustic character. Despite its rich character there is a great smoothness and crispiness to it. Alcohol is no where to be detected. Medium to big body, low carbo. I think these bottles should be saved a year, that way they get a bit calmed down and the result is about as good as it gets. Just stunned by this.

Bottle. Nose is alkali, slight cheese, slightly floral , funk, slight melon, belgian yeast, honey, slight emerging citrus. Taste is funky, yeast, dough, honey, grass, hay, floral hops, candy sugar, slight strawberry. On the next sip there is more of the soured notes, of green apple, berry emerging. The next sip brings through more of the dough melon and honey.

A very delicious beer which is much more of a super charged saison for me, while exceptionally balanced and very smooth, it retains the tastes and notes of the farm yard and orchard. Delicious.

Pale, rich golden with visible carbonation and a sticky looking ringed head. Nose is chalky and creamy melon, treacley and minerals. Initial taste is bright sweaty melon, washed coins and couples itself nicely into a sweetness that rings out as the beer goes on. Gummy grass, cooled steel and an ivory ping if bitterness as it turns for the home straight. Silky carbonation - arresting up front for the shortest moment and then an enveloping sticky booze cloy. Finish is more of that clean fleshy fruit crunch, sweetness over bitter, with lightly spiced herbs and caramelised onions. Linger is the first real hit of booze, dusky vanilla and scraped banana peel with a brassy tang. It took a wee while to settle into this, perhaps a degree or two cooler than ideal, but really sung with the herby sweetness and uncluttered mouthfeel for such an ABV. A real on real fencer for style with uncompromising substance.Bottle, 2011 Vintage, Appellation Wines, Edinburgh

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2016 Hazy orange with plenty of yeast sediments, nice velvety head on wide glass. Aroma also has yeast and spices and malts, citrus, wheat. Taste is spicy with yeast, fruits, light tart but still sweetish. It also has orange and quite some fruits. Mouthfeel is creamy and carbonation is soft although there is plenty of it. Slightly boozy.

Unique Tripel.
37,cl bottle - good size
Aroma: grass, citrus and yeast. 
Appearance: deep honey cloudy golden with good head, nice retention and light lacing in a nice way. 
The taste: Light sour, with Citrus hoppy and acidic tones some grass and light yeast tones and bitter dry after taste. 
ABV nicely hidden,Very refined taste which is not dull.
Slightly below Medium body,average carbonation

One of the best Triples I had in a long time.
Bionda leggermente velata con una schiuma fresca e poco persistente. Particolare aroma, lievito in evidenza. Sapore leggermente acido. Triple con alcol molto ben strutturato.

Bottle from Total Wine. 2012. Opened at home with a chalice. Pours a hazy yellow deep gold with significant head. Nice lacing. Aroma is nice fruits...lemon, orange, coriander, white pepper, biscuit, herbs. Taste is similar with the fruits up front and then the herbs and spices. Lively carbonation, dry finish. Love the Belgium yeasts and the full flavors of a true saison. Light body, grassy ending.

average frothy white head. fair lacing. mostly diminishing. hazy small-particled thick dark orange body. aroma: light hoppy, flowers, citrus orange, dough, honey and alcohol. if: moderate sweet. ff: moderate sweet bitter; long duration. palate: medium body, watery/oily texture, lively carbonation, metallic heavy alcoholic finish. Ao olha-la contra a luz, vê-se a distribuição por todo o copo dos sedimentos presentes no fundo da garrafa, mesmo sem agita-la. Dulçor alcoólico de laranja. Muito bem trabalhada, acima da média do padrão belga. Amargor escalante e gredoso de casca de fruta balanceia bem o dulçor, sem ser desagradável. Ótimo exemplar do estilo e de uma cerveja especial em geral. Mais encorpada que a média. Apresenta o background de mel das outras Dupont. O final com forte aquecimento alcoólico acrescido ao amargor de casca de fruta lembra o destilado Campari. Baixa drinkability. LEVES caráter condimentado e maltado, típicos do estilo, segundo o BJCP. 160 s

Tap at Ashleys. Clear gold pour with a small fizzy head that quickly fades away to pretty much nothing. Aroma is dominated by banana bread. Hints of hay, grass, cheese, and orange peel come through too. Big banana taste too but its more balanced. Also get nice flavors of apple, grass, orange peel, bubblegum, and honey. Light sweetness throughout. Medium body. When it warms, it becomes more grainy with a light boozy finish. Interesting stuff but it wore on my by the end o the glass.

Botella de 375. Color amarillo anaranjado apagado. Espumota blanca densa y con brillo de buena formación y buena retención, q deja esos puntitos blancos de lavadura y poso en el fondo. Es una cerveza compleja. Aromas donde predominan los frutales, manzana verde, dulces y a levadura...algo cítrico, embriaga,...tb se nota el alcohol, herbal. En boca es bastante cremosa y con carbonatacion viva. Los sabores muy equilibrados entre el dulce y el amargo... se nota la malta, el lúpulo y la levadura. Frutal, dulce, refrescante y algo alcohólica, en un principio para pasar a un amargor medio herbal y terminar con cierta astringencia donde la levadura aparece junto con los lúpulos q venían de antes y el alcohol q calienta la garganta. Sin duda para tenerla en casa siempre jajaja. Birrote. Cerveza compleja, fácil de beber y q puede gustar a mucha gente. Con la comida adecuada puede ser la bomba...creo q algún carne fuerte, rollo caza con un dulce de frutas, pej manzana puede ser la bomba. Recuerda a la Saison Dupont, pero en versión compleja...

When I first encountered this beer, from tap somewhere in a beer pub in Ghent, it was still a seasonal rarity, but it became so succesful that nowadays it is easily available throughout Belgium and beyond the whole year; it has gained a wide following too, making it far from evident to rate it objectively... I bought a 75 cl bottle for this rating, but unfortunately the drinks center hasnt kept it in optimal circumstances. Anyway: hazy, deep golden blonde beer with a mist of small yeast bits, under a very sticky and lacing, dense, snow white head, hops-enhanced and remaining remarkably stable in relation to the ABV, a feature often seen in the Dupont saison family. The aroma is unfortunately suffering from the dreaded lightstruck effect (ammonia-like stench from hops degeneration under the influence of light) at first, but I have Lady Luck on my side today, as it vanishes after the second pour from the bottle. I otherwise get rural hints of apple peel, Poire William, horse, wet hay, unripe peach, freshly cut grass, old cheese, jenever, dust, white pepper, lime, soap, prosecco. Taste begins with a vivid yet dryish fruitiness (apple, redcurrant, green plum) accompanied by a residual white candi sugar sweetishness, sharp citrussy fraîcheur and a strong, sourish, minerally carbonation - the palate is immediately awakened. Then a bready, honeyish, full pale malt sweetness follows, with a tingling spicy, almost wild and somewhat funky yeastiness on top of it; the sourishness paired with the strong fizz have a drying, brut effect on the mouth cavity, but still leaving room for a noble, fruity sweetness. More minerals, yeastiness and lingering pale malts in the finish, where a grassy, herbal and earthy hop bitterness takes over, along with warming jenever-like alcohol, resulting in a long, dry, appetizing ending in which bitter and sweet are in perfect harmony, as in most good tripel beers. This is undoubtedly a great apéritif and the perfect missing link between saison and tripel - as which Dupont intended it back in the seventies. Too bad for the lightstruck effect due to below optimal storage conditions in this particular bottle, but I had this beer dozens of times and I wont take it into account for this rating. Differs a bit from batch to batch, like many of the classic artisanal Belgian saisons; this sample is quite sweet and fruity, others tend to be more bittering and sourish - making this beer all the more interesting. Has great ageing potential too but I havent yet had the patience to mature a couple of bottles in the cellar for more than a year. This has justly become a classic in the Belgian beer landscape, as Moinettes big brother. Still love it, like most of Duponts beers and certainly all of their saison style beers. Always a pleasure to revisit this one - and Ive been as objective as I could...

Flasche (375 ml) von Hopfen & Malz, Berlin. - Sattgelb, trüb. - In der Nase erdig-zitrusfruchtige Herbe, schwere Kandissüße, scharfe Gewürze, ein wenig Moder und die unverkennbare Dupont-Hefe. - Im Antrunk herb-fruchtig und kandissüß mit bitteren Kräutern. Noten von Heu, Erde, Laub, Leder und kandierter Zitronenschale. Brotiges Malz wie bei einem Weizenbier (laut Etikett wird aber nur Gerstenmalz verbraut). Mild rezent, vollmundig und schwer. Erdig herber, weinig schwerer Abgang. - Zweifellos ein außerordentliches Bier, nur will es mir nicht recht schmecken. Zu rauh und unharmonisch sind hier fast unvereinbare Aromen zusammengeworfen. Müßte vielleicht noch einige Jahre reifen, bevor es genießbar wird.

Rated from beer log from 2009 Belgian Trip.... Light citrusy aroma, light yellow gold in color, slightly cloudy... Flavor is slightly bitter than most trippels, but also refreshingly citrusy... Slight bitterness on palate... Delicious beer

Very Sweet Tripel
Pours cloudy gold, with lush large white head.
Strong yeast, light, bread, apple, smell, no hint of alcohol, an achievement for a 9.5% beer.
Beautiful bodily malt complexity.
Finishes sweet with light bitterness.
Very Good

750ml bottle 2014 vinage pours hazy pale toasted orange yellow wirh a finger of head. Nose has spicy grain and yeast, some tangy orange peel and soft field grain. Taste is similar with balanced belgian spice character, supporting malt grains, a touch of honey grain and citrus sweetness, big but not boozy. Finishes mostly dry with classic yeast spice, light bitter orange and grain.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy, light amber with a medium, white head. Aroma is very yeasty with fresh hops, wheat, banana, sweeter grain notes and some ripe pear. Taste is more bitter, but is still really fruity, and has some more acidic stuff. Lots of pear again. Slightly boozy. Crisp body despite the alcohol, and a high carbonation.
Flaska från Saveur-biere. Ljusgul med hög tjock skumkrona. Doft av jäst och citrus. Lite spritig med en del jäst och lite maltsötma.

Drinking blind from a 75cl bottle. 
In the aroma alcohol, liquorice and nail polish. 
The clear pale yellow beer has a small white head. 
In the taste hop, bitter, yeast and wry.
Medium carbonated.
Probably the best beer I have ever tasted. Fruity, bitter, sweet yet fresh.

Flaska systembolaget. Grumlig gul vätska med stort tjockt vitt skum. 
Brödig och fuktig doft med nyslaget hö, unga äpplen och jäst.
En ganska rå smak med hög bitterhet och bra strävhet. Torr och fin i gommen. Bröd, örter och viss fruktighet. Rejält kolsyrad med en värmande alkoholtouch

Bottle from Beergusto web shop. hazy orange golden color with huge white head. Sweet malty aroma with oranges, caramel, nutty notes, herbs, spices. Taste, sweet malt, candies, yeast, some fruit, spices, herbs. Tasty.

bière blonde de la brasserie dupont
Couleur orangée, très pétillante et non filtrée
Une sorte de Moinette dhiver.
Bière à partager.
légèrement épicée et houblonnée

Blonde trouble / forte carbo / Houblon bien présent mais en arrière plan, lattaque est dominé par lacidité citronnée ... ça parait simple, mais il y a une complexité assez fine. Cest peut-être un peu trop sec pour moi, mais ça reste très équilibré et ça me gagne au final .... Tout ça pour dire quà priori cest pas pour moi, mais en fait si ...

Bottle from systembolaget. Pours yellow with a rich white head. Smells of fruits and farmhouse yeast. Taste is very fruity, some nuts and almonds. Palate is complex and full. Overall a really nice beer, would recommend.
On tap at Biercab. Golden-orange colour with white head. Malt, honey, yeast aroma. Sweet, honey, yeast, malt, fruity taste. Medium body.
Mycket dimmig, gul med vitt, stort skum. Doft: Belgo, sommar äng. Frisk, enkel, god doft. Smak: Belgo, ljus pizza kant, halm, alkohol, färsk örter, te, något fruktig typ.

Bière non filtrée dun doré-orangé, mousse épaisse et tenace. Le citron se présente de suite avec les céréales (blé, avoine, seigle), de pain, de pavot. Le Houblon est subtil et agréable, légères touche dorge et de résine aussi. Ça sannonce bien! Il y a ce je ne sais quoi de terreux, de viennoiseries aussi qui remontent les narines. Nez fin et complexe. La bouche est riche et ample, une touche crèmeuse, pas trop amère et sèche. Lalcool est présent mais pas désagréable, tout en équilibre avec le malt. Des pointes de pain aux bananes reviennent de temps en temps. Cest pas mal ce que je mattends dune belge. Top.
Ljusgul grumlig med stort vit skum. Doftar och smakar belgiskt kryddigt och jästigt. Mycket god!
Arômes de citron, de blé, de sucre candy et dalcool. En bouche saveurs semblables au nez appuyées par une forte effervescence. Très bon

Flaska från SB. Klar gyllengul färg med generös skumkrona. Mkt bubblor efter upphällning i glaset. Frisk doft av vitt vin och gröna äpplen. Söt och torr kropp. Smak av jäst, banan, citrus, vitt vin och gröna äpplen. Bitter torr eftersmak.

The aroma is light and I expected more. The appearance is a cloudy honey with a decent white head, also some things floating in the beer, (unfiltered). The taste was light and thin and again I expected more. Easy to drink, but overall not as good as I was expecting.
Beer on tap in Malesicky mikropivovar, strong beer ideal for welcome New year.. It gets you up fast
Gran cerveza, con alto grado alcohólico y fuerte sabor y mejor apariencia, muy recomendable
Birra molto interessante che ben si presta allinvecchiamento in cantina, molto alcolica

This tripel has a strong hoppy aroma, which distinguishes it from many other ales in the class. Hoppy aroma is not my favorite, and initially gives the impression of a cheaper beer. The appearance however is excellent- a deep honey cloudy golden with good head retention, carbonation, and lacing that makes it appealing. The taste is surprisingly refreshing, with a strong citrus fruity tone and bitter dry after taste. The palate is nice, creamy and smooth without any alcohol bite making this 9.5%abv quite accomplished. 
Overall its above average, but not my favorite tripel, especially with the hoppy aroma.
75 cl bottle of gold colored and white creamy head. Spicy and fruit aroma and some acid notes. Amazing Tripel!!
Delicate flower and yeasty, spicy aroma. Golden, hazy with very small and weak head. Spicy taste, with bitterness in the middle. Good tripel.

Une superbe bière à la robe blonde aux reflets ambrés et au nez qui exprime de superbes notes de houblon, de levure et dépices douces. La bouche allie ampleur, amertume, bulle crémeuse, longueur et persistance. Un délice.
75 cl bottle. Gold colour with white creamy head. Sweet malty yeast and fruity aroma, sweet taste, acidic notes. Soft carbonation

Bottle. Beermerchants.com. Slow gusher. Hazy gold. Thin, dense, lasting, sticky, white head. Toasty, sweet, lemon curd malts. Quite grainy. A little Belgian yeast character. Taste is fairly sweet, with a little dryness. Moderately bitter, lemon zest close. Fairly rich palate, albeit nicely zingy, and fresh. Doesnt feel the ABV. Finishes lemon zest bitter. Some sweet in the close.

Doftar lite stall, men inte mycket. Även lite frukt och citrus. Ordentligt kolsyrad, medelfyllig. Syrlig smak, men lätt beska. Mycket välbalanserad och läskande öl. Farligt lättdrucken men ändå karaktärsfull.
Well balanced, beautiful to look at and with a really sweet and powerful aroma. A perfect beer.

1.5 L bottle from LCBO. Pours a hazy yellow with white head. Nose is funky, fruity (peaches), herbal. Lively carbonation. Taste is sweet with funky Belgian yeast with a bitter-sour finish. Very interesting and complex.

duft. malt hvede citrus. ikke den store duft
smag citrus lidt sød lidt vin agtig i duftem. meget fyldig øl
Litt tåkete gul farge med luftig hvitt skum. Lukter gjær, alkohol og noe syrlig. Alkoholen også litt fremtredende i smak. Det ødelgger litt. Syrlig i smak og også i avslutning.
Uklar gulbrun med høyt tykt skum. Kornete lukt med noe blomster. Syrlig litt besk blomsteraktig smak. Oljete. Lang besk ettersmak

Pours a hazy to cloudy light golden with a thick, tall rocky off-white head that hangs out a while and leaves a big soapy wall of lace on the glass. Nose is mesmerizing and involves sweet honey nectar, pungent zesty peppery tart spice, sourdough, grassy and spicy noble hops, peach, apricot, and pear. Fairly sweet, fairly tart, and fairly bitter: incredibly well-balanced. Medium to light bodied, actively carbed, oily, sprite on the tongue, with a long, glorious, and bright finish. One of the most elegant and beautiful beers Ive ever had the pleasure of drinking. Fantastic.
Great saison. Stinky. Brewed like a tripel. Great beer for Christmas. You can share it if you want. I didnt.
From bottle, Seattle. Yeasty, huge head. Bright tasty beer, sweet full body. Nice drinker.

Bottle from systembolaget.
Bought two bottles, one now and the second bottle in a couple of years

(Dupont Avec les Bons Voeux) Bottle 375 ml, corked and caged, thanks to ElManana! Served into a tulip, ABV 9.5%
Pours a bright golden yellow beer, only a tad hazy with lazy activity in the glass. Tall white head sitting on top, with very good retention, leaving medium lacing on the glass.
Aroma is light yeasty,perfume, fruity and floral notes.
Nice fruity taste too, some sugar, alcohol is notable, wood, apricots. 
Medium body with good carbonation. 
Very good, nice and quite complex.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange golden with big thick white head, some sediment from the yeast. Aroma is canned pears! Sweet breadth wheat, clove, subtle bubblegum and fruity esters and Belgian yeast. Taste is dangerously light and crisp carbonation with a nice creamy full body. Wheat and some lemon. Only a slight hint of booze in finish along with some spices. One of my favorites!

375ml bottle at the Barley Cargo, Athens. Hazy yellow color with white head. Aroma is yeasty, fruity citrusy, dusty, malty spicy. Sweet and light bitter taste, citrusy fruity and yeasty. Medium oily body with average carbonation.

375ml 2014 years vintage green corked and caged bottle, poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is cloudy orange with a large beige frothy head , that settled fast leaving some lacing. Aroma of lemon zest, orange peels, grass, herbs and spices. Flavours of lemon zest, herbs, spices and bread. Taste is medium light sweet and medium bitter. Palate is medium bodied, smooth texture and lively carbonation. Dupont Avec Les Bons Voeux is a great Abbey Tripel.

Sampled @ O.B.E.R. Kerstbierfestival 2014, Essen.

Leicht trübes goldenes Bier mit einer ordentlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr malzig, hefig, fruchtig, Gewürze. Geschmack kräftig malzig, fruchtig, hefig, würzig, leicht alkoholisch.

Tap. Very light blond with thick froth. Detectable alcohol in aroma, a bit disturbing as it appears also in the taste. Generally smooth, quite drinkable and overall enjoyable but not as great as I expected it to be.
@ Kristoffers väg 12/12-14. Bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma: Fruity, spicy, clove, yeasty, malty. Taste: Fruity, spicy, clove, yeasty. Body is medium, the finish is dry and spicy.
Bottle at home shared with a friend. Pours hazy light orange. Smells of spices, yeast and hay. High carbonation, dry and slightly sour. Medium bitterness. This was really pleasant. My kind of beer!

75 cl bottle at home. Pours like a tripel and looks like one - what more can I say? Powerful aroma of pungent hop, earthy vegetable and spice. Taste is firm malty sweetness and some fruit, mango and pinapple: soon becoming very bitter. A light sourness, but in a good way. Rich and satisfying, you can tell there is a lot of alcohol in this, but it wears it lightly. Long, bitter and dry finish. Truly great, Dupont brew some excellent beer and I think this is the pinnacle.

Bottle, bb 9-2019. Pours hazy yellow (poured with yeast) with a white head. Aroma: fruit (white grapes), spices, blue cheese, vanilla. Taste: lemon, white grapes, spices, pear, banana, grass, somewhat earthy. Nice balance of sweet, bitter and sour, medium body, soft carbonation, creamy mouthfeel. Nice bitter and light sour finish. Lovely balance, complex brew. Everythings just right.

Looks like a urine sample of someone with a medical problem. Hazy yellow with no head or lacing. Nice Belgium yeast, wine, banana aroma. Tastes of a true Belgium that is well hopped and a little alcohol. A complex beer.

Fin saison med hö inslag & humle.
Gammal bondedryck. Fin öl! Mycket bra!kört hårt dupont

750ml bottle. Pours a hazy yellowy orange with a large, thick, white head. Aroma is fermented fruit, lemon, white grape, minerals. Taste is fermented fruit, dried fruit, lemon, some breadiness, some spice. Dry. Fairly full, fairly strong carbonation.

Servida en vaso cerámico maredsous tipo grial. AROMA a levadura típica belga cítrico miel, al paladar se difumina muy bien el alcohol con la carbonatacion media que presenta, cerveza muy condimentada y compleja , el sabor es fresco cítrico y refrescante, exquisita como postre o como acompañamiento. la recomiendo y esta dentro de mis top 10.

Drunk on draught at moer de lambic in Brussels. Unusual hoppy slightly sour beer.

Aroma is yeast, clove, lemon grass, honey, and citrus. Taste is a crisp sweet maltiness that is quote light. The body is a clear straw colour witha pearl white head that retains very well.

750 ml bottle. 2010 vintage. From some webshop some years ago.
Hazy orange golden colour with a mid-size dense white head. 
Spices, malt, yeast, alcohol and some fruitiness in the aroma. Balanced. 
The flavour is alcohol, yeast, mild bitterness, dry malt, some fruitiness and some spices. Balanced.

Le goût de lalcool est prédominant. Il ny a pas beaucoup dautres goût. Forte odeur de maïs. Goût et arrière goût similaire.

Bottle thanks to sarkynortherner. Golden lots of bubbles good white head. Aroma is fruity. Taste is fruity yeast caramel sweetness good hoppy bitter finish no sign of alcohol well balanced. Medium body.

Hazy yellow with a medium persistent head. Aromas of Saison yeast, Belgium Triple yeast, spices, candy sugar, aromatic. Flavours: aromatic, apricot, sugar, Belgian Triple and Belgian Saison yeast, a little bit of alcohol. Jaune trouble, beau col de mousse persistant, Arômes de levure de saison, levure de tripple belge, épices, sucre candi, aromatique. Saveurs: aromatique, abricot, sucre, levure de triple belge et saison belge, un peu alcool.
UPDATED: FEB 21, 2015 Its a very unique and brilliant beer. It has the hoppiness and fruityness of a good Tripel and the liveliness and bitterness of champaign. Quite an extraordinary experience!
Bottle 75cl. Big white foamy head. Hazy apple juice color. Aroma is hay, yeast, apples. Taste is sour, yeast, hay.
Bottle at Hermans. Cloudy orange with a solid head. Aroma is light fruit, pear. Flavour is grassy hop, yeast and coriander, spicy tart finish.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 375ml bottle poured in a Duvel tulip.
A: Pours a cloudy orange to beige color. A big bubbled and aired head is formed when its poured. Retention is medium to low and only some lacings are left
S: Nose is sweet, fruity and spicy. Reminds pears mainly. Also honey and candy sugar. Some hints of orange zeast, grassy hops and alcohol
T: The best part. Very tasty beer. Quite fruity, spicy and hoppy. Malts and Belgian yeasts (oh yeah!). A mild sweet upfront with a dry and bitter aftertaste. Pepper and the citrus-earthy hops are really a must
M: Medium to heavy body. Reasonable carbonation. Sweet ufront followed by a grass hoppy aftertaste. Hints of alcohol can be felt but well hidden
O: Very drinkable despite the 9.5%ABV. Absolutely great beer
[ BA Review @ 2/5/2012 ]

Bottle @ home. Pours cloudy orange with a nice white head. Sweet and pepperspicy aroma with apple, pear, almonds, and some banana. and a perfectly balanced barnyard funk character. Sweet with balacing sugar, hay and bread. Dry crisp palate with high carbonation. Pepperly taste with apples, sweet oranges, some funk, yeast, almonds, cloves, toast and some caramel. Distinct lasting bitterness and lemon, oranges and pepper in the aftertaste. Perfect balance, nice funk.

Kran 0.33L
Wygląd: Złote, opalizujące. Biała piana, bardzo trwała.
Aromat: Dojrzałe, soczyste jabłko, może nawet starte jabłko, brzoskwinia i gruszka. Jabłko bardzo intensywne i świetnie wyróżnia się od innych tripli. Dodatkowo estrowo-fenolowe aromaty typowe dla drożdży belgijskich, lekko dzikie. Alkoholu nie czuć.
Smak: W smaku już bardziej klasyczne jak strong belgian ale, palona opona, owoce jak w aromacie, lekko przyprawowe-pieprzowe i dość mocno alkoholowe. Goryczka niska+, ziołowo-alkoholowa.
Odczucie: Wysokie nasycenie CO2, ciało niskie+.
Całość: Genialny aromat, w smaku za dużo alkoholu i za bardzo wysycone. Ogólnie bardzo dobre, warto spróbować jeśli lubi się belgijskie klimaty.
"fruit, barnyard, dry...overall a very nice saison, good year-round. very earthy with some spices as well. very complex - a little tart a little fruity. id get again for sure. "

Bár azt nem állítanám, hogy a tripel, mint stílus áll hozzám a legközelebb az összes típus közül, ez a darab teljes mértékben levett a lábamról tökéletességének bájával. Méz színben pompázik, krémes habot gerjeszt, fenséges szegfűszeges, vaníliás illatokkal ajándékoz meg gabonás aromája; igazán karakteres, valóban lenyűgöző megtestesülése egy már unalomig ismert stílusnak. Bár csípősen élénk, pezsgően szénsavas, nem túl terpeszkedő, szerethető a karakter, amely teret enged az élesztő cifrázta, selymesen malátás, tejszínesen krémes ízvilágnak. Számomra ilyen a tökéletes tripel.

750 ML corked and caged

Clear orange straw color, bright white head. Lovely retention to it. 
Nose is malt. Apple and pear. Sift and subtle.
Taste is also subtle red apple and pear. Little bit of candy cane. 
Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Pretty simple beer but very well made. Flavors linger a long time.

Bottle 37.5 cl from Barleywine in Copenhagen. Cloudy orange with a slightly frothy white head. Funky, apples, slight tartness. Orange peel, some bitterness, some light maltyness. Medium body, medium carbonation, bitter finish. Quite a lot of components that I cannot identify.
Funky cellar like tartness, red apples. Taste is malty and more sweet than tart. Although lots of maltiness it is not overly sweet due to good balance with the sweetness.

9/2/14. 750 ml bottle. Pours hazy orange (rolled before opening). Nice light Belgian funk nose with some biscuit and fruit. Tight champagne like carbonation. Nice light sharpness to the finish but only a hint of hops. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Blonde dorée, petite carbo. Collet fin mais belle dentelle.
Aromes complexes mêlé dépices de poivre de fruits et une pointe âpre. 
Superbement équilibrée. Du fruit sur lattaque, un final amère avec toujours cette petite pointe apre que je narrive pas à identifier. Bonne longueur.

Bottle @ home 20140814. Clear golden, fluffy white head with insane head retention for the abv. Aroma is spicy and peppery, with notes of banana and figs. Taste is similar, with a complex fruitiness that goes very well with the rounded body. A nice hop bite. Mouthfeel is very smooth, almost creamy. Very very refreshing, not often I feel that about a beer this strong. Wow.

Appearance- orangey golden. Hazy. Plenty of lumps of yeast come out with the pour. One finger pure brilliant white head. Aroma is full- yeasty, candied fruits, lots of spices, banana, bready malt. Taste- starts with sweetness, juicy fruit, especially orange. Raisin, hint of banana, malt backbone, bitterness comes through in a long finish. Sweetness, spice and bitterness all come together very nicely. Quite a full mouthfeel with the perfect amount of carbonation. Really good.
Bottle. Dark golden pour with a huge firm head. Nose has grapes, yeast and cereal. Taste is sweet, yeasty, some white grapes and some biscuity sweetness.
Een zeer lekker biertje. Een beetje zurig maar op een goede manier. Ik ga dit zeker nog drinken
37,5cl bottle thanks to ruigo. Dark gold. Medium head. Smooth body. Nice light sweet and medium sour taste. Aroma is malt, brett, citrus, herb.

Aroma: fruity, malt
Appearance: white foam, clear
Taste: medium bitter, slightly sour
Palate: almost creamy
Overall: fantastic, alcohol not even noticeable palate perfect
Flavour is lots of fruits, Belgian yeast, some spices, a little funk. Flavour is fruity and yeasty, with a nice hoppy bitterness in the finish. More like a Saison than a Tripel. Excellent beer.
75cl. Hazy golden, nice white head. Will have to rerate it because the alcohol taste was overpowering and I hope this is not intended.

Bottle from Cornelius. Hazy golden body with a thick white head. Lively carbonation. Great lacing. Aroma of sea salt, blue cheese, yeast, underripe banana and lemon rind. Flavour of lemons, grass, spice and a hint of white sugar. Dry finish. Tastes like a cross between a Tripel and a Saison. Medium body with an oily texture. Soft fizz. Drinks very easily for 9.5% ABV. The flavour lasts long after each sip - delicious.

Kaatuu tulppaaniin kullankeltaisena ja sameana, sekä todella runsaalla vaahdolla. Iso pullo täytti kaksi lasia ennen kuin vaahtoaminen rauhottui. Tuoksu on tyypillistä saisonia, mutta intensiivisempi. Karviainen vahvimpana, mutta reilusti on myös maamaisuutta, yrttisyyttä, marjapensaisuutta, kukkaisuutta ja viinimarjaa. Maussa vahvimpana on karviainen ja viinimarja, mutta mukana on myös maamasuutta, hiivan mausteisuutta, yrttisyyttä ja tummempaa hedelmää. Suutuntuma on hiilihappoinen, suht hyvin humaloitu, täyteläinen ja melko kuiva. Upea saison potenssiin kaksi, jossa monipuolisuutta ja intensiivisyyttä löytyy reilusti. Ainoa miinus älyttömästä vaahtoamisesta.

375ml. Bottle. 
Pours hazy yellow with white head. 
Aroma citrus, yeast, sweet, vanilla, spice, apple. 
Taste vanilla sugar sweet, bitters, sour. 
Mouthfeel creamy. 
Great complex tripel.

Roughly 2008 bottle thanks to mcbackus. Hazy yellow to light orange pour. Light sweet, fruity, pear, apple, light spicy yeast phenols in aroma. Light, syrupy, fruity, sweet, yeasty, more fruity pear, apple.

75 cl, flaske, 9,5 % ABV, købt hos Søren i Den Belgiske Ølbutik i Vanløse, 30. juni 2014.
Meget smuk gylden honningfarvet Triple med kraftig eftergæring på flasken, som både lægger sig i glasset som små fiskeæg, hvor andre "danser" rundt og lever sit eget liv - et fantastisk syn. Stor offwhite-farvet skumkrone på 4-5 cm, som danner et flot skumlandskab. 
Aromaen er knap så tydelig, men noter af den frigivne gær er til stede. En anelse frugt fornemmes ligeså.
Smagen er sødlig, bitter og moderat krydret. Meget overvældende. Man bydes først på lidt diskret sødme, som senere ledsages af lidt bitterhed, og dernæst træder krydderierne ind og lægger en dyne over det hele. Dette ledsages af en fint perlende kuldioxid, som kæler for ganen mens brygget nydes. Et indhold på knap under medium. 
Lang god eftersmag med masser af krydderier.
Solid og spændende Triple, som ønsker én det bedste (jvf. titlen "Bons Væux").

0.75 l bottle from 2012. Amber, hazy body, with a massive, frothy, white head, that leaves a lot of lacing. Aroma of yeast, ester, banana, sour apple, lemongrass, spices, some creamy vanilla. Taste is dry, bitter and sour, with the same aromas. Mouthfeel is medium to full, creamy, with a lively carbonation and it finishes dry, bitter, sour-fruity, yeasty and alcohol warming. Very good! Complex, heavy, but still quaffable and refreshing. The balance between all those different dry, bitter, sour and sweet notes is pretty good!

Bottle shared by my brother. Clear, but chunky amber color with a thick off-white head. Aroma of skunk, malt and Belgian esters. Sweet malt flavor with slight banana esters before a boozy and slightly bitter finish.

Ottimo esempio di Tripel. Laroma è inebriante. In bocca si percepisce da subito un netto maltato e un forte sentore alcolico, per poi lasciar spazio ad un buon amaro dissetante. Accompagna cene importanti. Da non perdere!

Love. Amazing on draft. Got the end of the keg, so a bit yeasty, but still delicious. Would love to find one of these bottles and cellar it for awhile. 

- pixels sent via Beer Buddy on iOS

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.
Draught at Belgian Beer Weekend. Clear pale gold. Big yeast aroma with a super bitter finish.

Pale, golden-yellow color, with a decent head, which leaves a fine, long staying lacing. Aromas are of an interesting melange, containing wheat, straw, yeast and tart Brettanomyces, also hints of pepper, spices and lemon zest are recognizable. 

Taste reveals an unbelievable smooth mouthfeel, due to a huge amount of Belgian yeast, which puts a pillow on the palate. On top of that, warm stingy spices amongst black pepper build up a fascinating complexity, which results in a medium dry finish, with subtle vanilla notes. Very easy to drink, alcohol is present at no point at all, very intriguing, well balanced beer. Bretts among metallic, lively carbonation are responsible for a supporting sour- and dryness, which underlines the slick. spicy yeast impression just perfect. As I am drinking a young bottle, bretts are recognizable only for a short period of time, mingled together with copper flavor. When those leave the palate, dough malts and supersmooth mouthfeel do become even more present.
Nice bready and wheaty tripel. Orange pour with white head. Fruit, grain, and funk in the aroma. Pale malt and yeast dominate taste. More fruit and spice in the taste. Excellent.

Draft at Belmont Station. Spritzy, bready, fruity, finishes dry and slightly bitter. Strong, balanced, artisanal. Pay attention, American craft brewers! Not one single herb or flavor sticks out. Balanced!
Backlog. On tap at Maltes Öltipspromenad 2013. Dominated by wheat, citrus, orange zest and banana.

golden straw colour, slightly hazy which took on a green hue due to the christmas lights at my pub. clean foamy head. many different tastes - a complex beer. my notes include oranges, yeast, bananas, cloves, wheat grass. unlike other beers , it maintains its tastes and does not mellow after a few sips.
Poured a beautiful orange color with a fluffy white head. Nose of oranges and spice. Flavor is exceptional with the alcohol expertly hidden.
Bottle. This is a very nice tripel with all of the stylistic elements nailed perfectly.

Hazy golden orange color with about an inch of well-sustained white foam. Syrupy aromas of tropical fruit, mango, apricot, funky blankets, some skunk and grain. The taste is sweet and biscuity with notes of apricot, lemon, pine bark... has a fairly creamy full palate, holds up well as it warms. I think its absolutely delicious, a touch sweeter than average saison, some nice fruit and caramel, orange danish notes. Good stuff.

Orange slightly hazy beer with big white cloudy head leaving lacing. Aroma is yeasty, pale malty, tart and toffeey sweet. Flavor is yeasty, fruity and malty. Palate is full and foaming in the mouth. Finishes with mild bitterness, maltiness, yeast and alcohol. Pouring in the yeast makes the beer hazy and adds peppery yeastiness. Perhaps not in the freshest possible form, the maltiness is quite harsh and almost cardboardy. Should be more refreshing.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2014 Hazy golden looks with pretty and bold head on top. Aroma has fresh fruits, sourness and belgian yeast with spicy notes. Taste is a little sour, fruity, yeasty but turning into not that fresh towards the end. Full and bubbly palate. I?m not that convinced of the greatness behind this, and was a bit disappointed but still 4/5 is a great beer. Second time drinking and I enjoyed this a bit more now than on the first try. So from 4- to 4 is some upgrade, nice beer.

On draft at Pizzeria Paradiso Dupont in DC, this is hands-down one of my favorite saisons. An excellent example of the style: beautifully fruity, excellent spice notes. Even at 9.5% it's complexity shines through, just a world-class beer.

Très bon produit de Dupont. Acide et légèrement fruitée au nez. En bouche, un bon pétillant et un goût complexe de fruits/acidité. Bon produit

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottiglia da 375 ml. Color oro con riflessi arancioni, schiuma media, bianca non molto persistente. Al naso frutta matura, al palato inizio fruttato che lascia subito spazio ad un amaro molto intenso e di lunga durata, leggermente astringente. buona la bilanciatura che non lascia sentire lalta gradazione alcolica.

Bottled, aged for a year. Hazy orange beer, rocky white head, loads of lace. Intense and complex aroma, loads or fresh fruit nectars (pineapple), sour apricots, grassy hops, perfumy fermentation notes, strawberries, Brett, earthy notes... So complex! Strong flavor has dry maltiness, sweet alcoholic notes, perfumy phenols, slight acidity, medium bitterness. Slightly alcoholic and sugary aftertaste with narrow hop bite. Medium body, soft and slightly yeasty mouthfeel. Very good.

A really good Belgian one. The taste is clearly Belgium but not as extreme as most of them.
Quote soft on taste and palate. Have to taste again for more detail, but really good overall in the meantime!!

Straw hued with delicate white head that dissipated to a thin ring. Aroma is lactic, green apple, straw, farmhouse funk, slightly acetic, pear. Mouthfeel is smooth with a light body and soft carbonation. Taste is super dry with a tart astringentness in the following with a slightly ethanol finish. Overall this is a super interesting brew. It feels as if it almost evaporates in your mouth.

Flaska. Dimmigt guldfärgad med krämigt vitt skum. Dofter av örter, apelsin, vitpeppar, hö, äpplecider och jäst. Mycket inbjudande. Jäst, äpplen, hö, karamell och örter i smaken, där alkoholen gör sig gällande på ett inte alltför positivt sätt.

Jaune brumeux avec une mousse blanche moyenne. Larôme du levure belge, un peu aigre avec quelques épices. Le goût est un peu aigre avec un peu du malt au début et un très peu damertume dans la finale.

(backlog 2013-14) Repeated 37,5cl bottles and on tap post-BBF 2014 at Brugs Beertje. The abv brawn of a Belgian triple rained in by the brain of the omnipotent Dupont saison strain. Very BE-hop forward: grass, young spring meadow, dandelion. More typically tripel-like white pepper spice, clove, grass, ripe apple esters are allowed to briefly surface, but are then kept at dry bay by the dominant saison yeast blanket, making this near-refreshing at a walloping 9,5% and still very much a (n amped-up) saison. Creamier and more easy-going on tap, more hop-austere and near-metallic bottled. No doubt an all-time classic in its own genre-defining league, and always an experience - its just not a personal favourite. Will keep revisiting nevertheless...

La confrérie des Tastebières de labbaye dAulps, assemblée en son chapitre de printemps le 5 avril 2014 a confronté lOrval, la Zundert, la Rince-Cochon et la Avec les bons voeux de la brasserie Dupont. 
"Avec les bons voeux..." a reçu la note totale de 3,2 décernée par les 17 confrères présents ce soir là. Elle se classe en deuxième position après la Zundert. Ainsi soit-il.

Slightly hazy golden with small white head. Sweet grains, big citrus sourness with citrus peel bitter. Some funk, yeast and spices. Medium bodied, slightly dry finish. Alcohol really well hidden. Very good.

375ml bottle from Les Crepes de Sophie, Shrewsbury. Is it a tripel, or a strong saison? Who knows. It is a great beer though, a pretty ruddy good beer actually. Beautiful floral aroma with a touch of vanilla icing. The vanilla continues very subtly into the taste with a smooth yeast character and great mouthfeel. Very nice indeed. I can imagine my Mum liking this.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2015 Creamy yellow/golden, thick head. Aroma is of bubblegum, very fruity, not banana, more towards tangerine. Taste is upfront a bit flowery, but the aftertaste and towards the end is so much better, a lot of bubblegum, belgian yeast a bit spicy and a bit of a herb feeling to it, very complex, and really drinkable. Feels more like a 6% than a 9.5%

29.03.2014, 0,375l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly fruity, yeast, hay, light malts, flowers, dough, hints of dried fruits and citrus peel. Taste is kind of floral and boozy, flowers, yeast, hay, alcohol, weeds, dough, citrus peel, light malts, grass. Medium bitterness, kind of a harsh floral mouthfeel. Fair enough.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Stas place. Thanks Stas, Vova and Ariel T. Clear white gold with a foamy white head. A little sour, vinegar and hints of fruit aroma, sweet and very mildly sour taste. Light body, soft carbonation, a little sour finish.

Hazy golden colour, foamy white head. Herbal aroma, hoppy and citrus fruits. Flavourwise, malty and hoppy bitterness have the overtone and linger. As its longer out of the bottle, it gets more rounded with some sweet honey-like tones. Firm body, medium-high carbonated.

375ml fles. Niet op de kaart. Goudgele kleur. Volle witte schuimkraag. Eerste smaakimpressie: wauw! Lichte koffie smaak, lichte chocolade, lichte koolzuur. Perfect biertje! Ruikt wel een beetje naar wiet?!?

Non so quanto si possa aggiungere a questa splendida birra. Bevuta in una piovoso giornata di primavera è sempre splendida. Colore biondo chiaro, leggermente velata, bellissima schiuma bianca e pannosa. Profumi di spezie e lievito. Corpo medio, sentori di lievito e fruttati. Ottima.

Prachtig goudkleurig troebel bier met een mooie witte schuimlaag.
Beetje zurig, citrusachtige smaak met een bittere hoppige nasmaak.
Mooi,complex bier.

100th rating !!! Bottle, 75cL. Home. A bubbly yellow brown beer with a huge white foam. Good persistence. Fruity aroma, herbs, spices, bread, caramel. Medium sweet ; bitter waves slighty over and under. Good balance. Medium body and texture. Lasting refreshing bitterness, with a warming note. Overall, a good spicy refreshing ale. Cheers my friends !

Bottle. Cork came off with a loud pop and some light gushing action followed. When poured the beer is hazy yellow and produces a very large frothy white head. Wonderful nose with a mix of grassy hops and fruity yeast. Flavor has the same mix with some honey, kiwi, melon, white grapes, bergamot, white pepper and grassy hops. The carbonation is pretty high which lifts the sweetness and alcohol making the beer quite light and easy to drink. No rough alcohol, but its warming. Light dry finish with lingering fruity notes. Fantastic. Dupont makes me happy.
On tap at apex. Hazy yellow. Aroma of cheese, lemon, wood. Taste is tart and bitter. Quite dry. Medium carbonation.

Bottle. Pours cloudy gold, white head. Nose is deep cheese funk, phenol spice, sweet malt. Flavour is lemon/orange hops, sweet malt, pepper, funk and bitterness at the end. Alright, I like the funk, but nowhere near as good as their saison, the sweetness detracts from sophistication.

Golden color with a carbonate white head. Aroma is citrusy with some yeasty and spices. Flavor is rather sour but also malty with some lemons, tangerines, spices, and whipped cream. Aftertaste is a bit yeasty. Overall good beer.
bought a bottle a while back at a belgium beer store. poured a bit of a hazy yellow colour with a white head. yeast, banana, peach, apricot, bit of a bitterness, grass and bits of citrus, nice

750 ml. 2013 vintage. Pours hazy golden with tiny bubbles streaming up to support a quarter inch of creamy meringue on top. Nose has peppery wood, musty white wine, bubblegum, citrus zest and earthy honey. Tastes of lemon honey, resin, funky white grape, citrus pith, white pepper and wood. Medium body is a little bit frothy for my tastes, but remains mostly smooth and is nicely balanced from many angles. A slight warming in the gullet provides the only hint of the 9.5% abv.

Hazy golden color, big white head. Dry aroma of malt, grass, spice, tart and yeast. Taste is sweet and has similar notes as aroma. Medium body and fizzy carbonation. Some unusual notes for a tripel, but still quite good one.
Citrus, apples, yeast, pepper, grass. Light bitterness, just a little bit sweet upfront, ends dry. Very well hidden alcohol. Lively carbonation.

On tap at the Choc Brewery. A bit sour for what I was prepared for. Meh. Not very impressed. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Uma ótima tripel. Boa persistência de espuma e nível alcoólico elevado. Sabores de açúcar, especiarias e frutas secas.

Appearance: Hazy amber with 3 finger thick white head.
Aroma: Brett, leather, earthy, bandaid, barnyard, peppery, fruity.
Taste: Medium/high sourness, medium bitterness and low sweetness.
Palate: Thick grainy texture, light/medium body, average carbonation, savoury (baked bean?), bitter, sour, malty finish.
Comments: Lovely and glass lace. Probably not for everyone though.

750 ml corked and crowned bottle. Pours a cloudy honey gold color topped by a large rocky white head. Complex yeasty lemon citrus malt aroma. Bitter citrus malt flavor, notes of lemon peel and white peppercorns. Mid taste is dry and bitter with a creamy mouthfeel. Finish is dry and bitter, very long on the palate. Noticeable alcohol comes through. Outstanding! Got this in a Craft Beer Variety pack at Laurentis ShopRite Liquors in Mercerville, NJ. What a nice surprise.

Appearance: slight hazy golden color, pours with a huge off white head, takes a while to pour this beer down

Aroma: yeast, lemon, alcohol, creamy, butter, fruity

Taste: hints of sourness, lemon, some bitterness towards the finish, alcohol, very faint sweetness compliments the bitterness

Palate: light mouthfeel, bitter aftertaste, lively carbonation

Overall: a good beer but not one of my favorites, strong alcohol, the bitterness in this beer just rubs me wrong

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from the tap. Slightly hazy golden yellow with minimal white head. Aroma is bready, yeasty, mild citrusy sourness, sweet malt. Taste of sweet malt, yeast, coriander, citrus. Alcohol hidden. Very balanced. Medium body.
Flaska från Ölbutikken i Köpenhamn. Ljust halmgul vätska med kritvitt högt skum. Kryddig, pepprig doft. Smak av gröna ärtor, gröna örter. Medelfyllig. Kort eftersmak.

Pours a hazy amber with a thick, foamy, white head. Nose is barnyard potpourri with horse blanket and hay. Taste is nicely balanced fruity sweetness and hoppy bitter notes. Full bodied, lively carbonation. Very interesting beer. Quite nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle pours golden with big carb. Aroma is bready and spicy yeast, taste is light crisp with a sharp pepper bite

330ml bottle. Cloudy amber color. Medium size, white-yellow head, stays. Fresh minty hops, yeast and some grains in aroma. Dry yeast, fruity, juicy, fresh, hops in taste. So full of flavor and taste. Alcohol is very well hidden. Everything is in nice balance. Very well done!
UPDATED: SEP 11, 2015 Fruitée, rafraichissante, amertume moyenne mais persistante. Alcool peu présent en bouche. Une vraie réussite.

Small bottle. Aroma is tart, fruity, malt, and yeast. Pours slightly hazy golden, the head disappears quickly but thin white line remains. Taste is fruity, sweet, tart, apples, yeast, and some bitterness. Alcohol is noticeable, but not unpleasant. Finish is at the same time sour, bitter and sweet. Overall: this beer took me by surprise. Its definitely not a classic triple. Aroma and appearance were disappointing, but I liked everything else. Goes down really well for a almost 10 ABV beer.

Bottle shared by martjoobolut. Hazy yellow, white head, filmy retention. Nose is spice, yeast, very fruity, toasty. Flavour is spice notes, caramel, yeast, toasty malt, some sweetness. Finish has some mild bitterness with mild alcohol warmth, it pretty tripel-y. Very nice balance.
Aroma was very sour almost like a sour ale, but was very bready with a yeast component. Low alcohol taste for a 9.5 % beer but fairly bitter, lively carbonation.
Mycket kraftigt och hållbart skum. Spännande smak med viss syra, samtidigt det finns en viss efterbeska. God!

Small corked bottle. Hazy golden body, medium head. Aroma has damp lagery yeast, rice and sourish dishrag. Yeasty and grainy taste with Strong Pale Lager qualities. Fruity and yeasty finish with a lemony touch. No Abbey Tripel dryness or sparkly carbonation, no refinement. Not resembling the classic Abbey Tripels at all - this is closer to Saison and even as that its has failed.

Bons Vux (Good Wishes) is a blond high fermentation beer , re-fermented in the bottle. Founded in 1970 , this beer was offered earlier this year to the most loyal customers of our brewery ( hence the name "With the best wishes of the brewery Dupont "). The success this beer earned lead to it being made commercially, while retaining its original name. Although very popular, it was brewed in limited quantities, the bottles reserved many months in advance. A coppery blond beer with aromas of hops for the Bon Voeux is a beer tasting combining mellow bitterness and fruity. Our selection of yeasts and a long maturation phase with hopping gives it flavor and a characteristic and complex taste. The true fermentation in the bottle , which can be extended very long in your cellar, resulting in a balanced and harmonious beer, surprising and complex aromas .

BOTTLE 37,5CL.

Look: amber hazy with a huge white creamy-to-frothy head with good retention. 
Aroma: dry, spicy (peppery and herbal), some yeast (french baguette crust), solvent.
Taste: herbal spiciness, dry, just a bit of fruitiness, light bitterness with a slight harsh/alcoholic edge (no actual ethanol taste).

Its beefed up, but still a saison with its spicy herbal and drinkable character.
Great. It has all the things there are to like in a strong Belgian. Subtle flavor with malts spices yeast some alcohol and a nice dry long bitter finish. For me one of thw best in the style.
Aroma is grains/malts, a hint of sweetness and slight skunk from the green bottle. The flavor is malts/grains, spices, some funk, mild/medium sweetness and a long and tart/sour finish.

375 ml bottle. Hazy golden with big white head. Aroma of malt, barnyard, alcohol, spice and some peppery wood notes. Taste is alcoholic and peppery mainly, sweet malt, spice, pepper and barnyard with a slightly astringent finish. Pleasant and nice and should age well

A nice tripel but Im not sure it beats out a few of the other top contenders in the category. Huge perfume head on this - smells and initially tastes like a basket of potpourri. Pours blonde with ok head and lacing. Very well-balanced, which definitely puts this into the superior beer category. Finishes with light sweetness and some perfume. Average carbonation. Bottle at Bistro LAutre Oeil.
Hazy blond colour. Aroma is very yeasty and spicy. Flavour has plenty of yeast, spicy pepper and a bit of a woody, barnyard taste. The finish has a pleasant hoppy dryness.

Cloudy honey yellow/orange with nice one finger white creamy head, bit yeast came with my pour. Interesting aroma, one that makes me expect a nuanced flavor, sweet but also bit tart in there, yeast present, lots fruits and bit berries, ripe green apple, bit mango and other tropical fruits, bit white wine. Surprisingly soft palate with soft carbonation also, fruity sweet with long finish, alcohol there but dont bother me, medium body, Belgian feel all the way through, nuanced and lively flavor. Easy to drink but preferably one to enjoy in no hurry, excellent!

Hazy amber liquid with medium to big white head. Aroma of white pepper, bread, flowers, light bubblegum and bread. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of white pepper, bread and flowers. Light to medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice, though a bit sweet for my liking.

On tap at Birratrovo in Como
Another beer chosen from Tim Webbs 100 best Belgian beers and once again a marvelous perfectly balanced and absolutely enjoying beer

(tap 0,3l @ OP (Brno))
Yeasty, spicy, fruity, light sweet, light wheat aroma. Hazy light golden color. Medium white head. Fuity, fresh, medium sweet, light citrusy sour flavor. Medium body. Bitter, citrusy, light warm finish.
An almost tart bready aroma, sweet rounded taste and barny finish but very drinkable for 9.5. Solid beer.
Hazy golden, white head. Medium carbonation. Well balanced beer. Hoppy and yeasty. Dry finish.

Pours good with some copper tint. White head, small even bubbles with very little lacing. Aroma of green banana, spicy yeast, and grapes. Taste is the same with raw, unsweetened vanilla, and mild fruits. Tart, but pleasant. Full mouth and yet smooth. Great beer.
Tap. Medium mouthfeel, with a sweet, honey-like flavor with a notes of light fruit/banana. Sipper, with the alcohol coming across as a nice warming sensation.

750 ml bottle. Pours a foggy pale golden with a thick, resilient white head. Aroma is wild yeast, tart, unripe fruits and orchard fruits. Flavor is vanilla cake, unripe fruit, peaches, nectarines, oldish, dusty. Finish is lemoney, tart, oldish and dusty. Lingering lemon and oldish flavors. Super refreshing. Medium body, average to strong carbonation, very soft and velvety mouthfeel. One solid Belgian ale!
Pours bright yellow with a white head. Aroma is spicy yeast, grass, dust. taste follows nose

Poured from 750ml bottle, pours hazy yellow orange with a thick head that seems to stay around forever, aroma is kind of skunky at first, but that goes away after it warms, quite a bit of barnyard with a little bit of zest and fruit as well, the flavor is fruity on the front end with a nice blend of spices and pepper in the finish, very bubbly and smooth mouthfeel, the alcohol is pretty much no where to be found, pretty impressive, outside of the skunk its pretty awesome, would love to try really fresh without a chance of the light affecting it.
375ml bottle. Yellog/orange body with a huge white head. Yeast, spices (loads of white pepper), barnyard, banana, apricote and honey. Quite complex and fiery.

75 cl. corked bottle, shared and poured in to Trappist glasses. 2012 "Vintage" according to the cork. Slightly hazy golden colour with a copper tint, and a huge, fluffy white head that slowly collapses. Rather complex aroma with yeasts, spices - pepper, citrus, barnyard, some blue cheese, pale malts and sweet fruits. Taste is bitter. Medium to full body, creamy to oily texture and a lively carbonation. Finishes dry and herbal bitter with apples and yeasts. Excellent hybrid between Saison and Tripel. Very enjoyable.

375 ml bottle, light golden brown pour with a 1 1/2 inch white head. Caramel malts, cereal, coriander, squeezed lemon juice leading into a finish that is bitter and balanced nicely. Very nicely done. A classy drink.

A cloudy honey yellow color with a huge rocky head that settles to a big dollop with good lacing. Aroma of light fruit with a hint of bubble gum and some floral hop character. Light fruit flavor with mild initial sweetness then some smooth bitter and a light clove taste. Pepper and mild funk mid taste, finishing with some pepper and light bitter. Mouthfeel is soft with a medium body and high carbonation. Very good saison and drinkable saison with bigger flavors than normal. Had on New Year's Day 2013.

375 bottle from SB cons 2013-12-31 Göteborg this years new years beer
AR; yeasty, citrus, grape fruit, champagne, 
AP: wee hazy coppery, wee frothy cremey wee bubbly of white head
F: yeasty, dry, citrus, barnyard notes, wee soft carbonation, medium bitternees, sour apples,

Bottled. A hazy orange beer with a large and airy white head. Aroma is very spicy, funky yeast and malty notes. Taste is spicy, caramel malt, fruity. Some nice hoppiness in the end. Very dry finish. A great beer
Pours in cloudy, yellow with white foam. Aroma is yeasty, low fruit, more herbal. Taste is sweet upfront, low bitterness. Body is medium, texture dry, high carbonation.

Perfect beer for NYE and rating #100. Pours a beautiful gold with large persistent pillowy head that leaves an incredible lacing. Aroma is very similar to the standard Saison DuPont - lots of barnyard hay funk and earthy notes with some additional spicing detectable. Taste is amazing - cloves, coriander, funky Belgian yeast, strong malt backbone and quite a sweetness in the mid-palate prior to the expected bitter finish. The mouthfeel is smooth & oily, as compared to the crisp & dry of the standard Saison DuPont, and the additional ABV gives a pleasant light warming sensation in the throat and chest. This beer is a real treat. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 bottle, pours hazy and golden, Great head and lots of lacing. I have drank this many times, this one was very skunky. The nose was honey with Belgium yeasts, grassy, and spices. Dry flavors, well balanced sweetness and a bitter like astringent taste. Hay and hops with some honey and apples. Remarkable beer!

Aged 2 years. Clear golden under a big foamy white head. Nose is earthy and sweet grassy, with pilsn malts and toast. The taste is really nice; smooth and golden with some toast and estery goodness, a touch of grass, a touch of hay, some pils malt, and a dry finish. Not amazing, but really well made. Christmas spice throughout, but lightly.
Pours a light amber body with a thick head. Funky smell with tones of yeast. The yeast is also in the taste...
A gold clear bear with a frothy head, and light citrus aroma. Has a slightly bitter aftertaste with a lively zest.

Dupont's winter saison. Pours perfectly into Pfriem tulip. Copper blond appearance, slightly hazy. That perfect dupont head. Extra white color, frothy. Lots of lively bubble action. 

This smells amazing. Heavy black pepper and phenols -- wet bandaid, latex, plastic. Some spicy yeast. Floral sweetness. The pepper is really the star of the show.

Taste is sweeter than I remember. Dry on the tongue to start. Spicy blonde flavor. Sweet malt backbone. A little floral or candied sweetness. Not much funk or bitterness leaves it a bit strong on the finish, not as dry as you'd want from a saison. Any dryness in the finish comes more from the spice. Slight alcohol burn is nice, the 9.5% is well hidden and only flashes it's presence in a good way. A very slight wateriness here or there.

Feels a little thin. Light body for a 9.5% saison is a bit disappointing.

Overall, I could smell this thing for days. I remember the flavor bring better last year, but I'll buy this every year just for the nose.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a bottle. Hazy golden yellow color, huge white frothy head. Sour wild yeast with spice aroma. Sweet clove and spice flavor with a light finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 mL bottle. Shared at tasting on December 15. The pour is a nice fogy gold with a thick pure white head that lingers around, slowly fading down to a finger-thick cap.The lacing left by this thing is absolutely incredible! The aroma is very sour. This is a little outside my comfort realm. A citrusy sour, with a little bit of yeast? The flavor is also very sour, thought the start offered a little sweetness to it. The finish is sour, and dry. Pretty solid.
Très bon produit ! Belle blondeur, arômes très fins et bonne corpulence en bouche avec une finale assez longue pour une blonde. Malts bien présents. Un must

UPDATED: APR 27, 2014 Appearance: Yellow golden, quite hazy. Sediments floating around.
Aroma: Fruit mostly. Citrus.
Taste: Very fruity, slight yeast. Some bitterness.
Info: 375ml bottle, 22/12-2013, 53/100, 43/300M, BB: 30/11-2017
UPDATED: FEB 18, 2015 Sweet, fruity aroma. Well-balanced seasonal ale, sour yet fruity with a nice light malt basis. Nice complexity with many interacting flavors.
Slightly hazy dark yellow pour with a slight white head. Slightly fruity nose. Funky, a bit sweet, slightly bitter in the finish.

Bottle. Hazy deep golden with fluffy white head. Aroma is citrus, apricot, yeast, green apples. Taste is fruity and sweet with slight bitterness. 
Medium to full body, lively carbonation. The finish is long and quite dry.
