Bottle pours cloudy gold with big white head. Nice lacing. Banana, funk, clover, pepper, bread. Moderately bitter. Lightly sweet. A little bit of salt. Crisp, medium body.

Winter Warmer décembre 2013 - Bière couleur de miel, légèrement voilée et nappée dun épais col mousseux tenant fortement au verre. Au nez, Des fleurs, des fruits tropicaux, un peu de cuir et de lalcool. Elle est peu amère, assez acide et peu sucrée. Elle est huileuse, de corps solide, légèrement effervescente et se termine sur de longs arômes et une légère acidité.

10oz pour at PPD. Pours a clear gold with a ring of white head. Legs like scotch. Nose is candy sugar, nail polish, tropical fruit. Flavor is better, sweet, fruity, booze, pineapple, a little medicinal, pear, some bubblegum. Boozy finish.

375ml bottle from Appellation Wines, Dalry. Pours hazy orange-yellow with big frothy white head. Aromas of wheat, hay, lemon, and a spicy yeast note. Taste brings an orange bitterness, pale malt/white sugar sweetness, but finishes on a cleansing bitter note. Warming alcohol creeps up at the end. Lovely.
Väldigt fräsch trippel, lättdrucken i posetiv bemärkelse. En härlig öl som gärna får komma på besök igen.

Tap @ kerstbierfestival Essen. Cloudy yellow pour with no head. Slightly acidic smell. Few malts and yeasts. Bitter sweet taste. Sweet malts long bitter aftertaste. Thin mouthfeel with low carbo. Nice beer but a bit on the thin side for me.
Pours a hazy and light orange with heavy white foam. Has a wheaty and orange aroma. Taste is a nice mix or lemon, orange, wheat, yeast, some spices and a light malt and orange aftertaste.

Tap at Mikkeller Bar, SF. Courtesy of the bartender. Pours a light straw yellow. Nose shows citrus zest, Brett, funk and spiced yeast. Taste is light zest, mild citrus/funk and some farmhouse yeast. Hint of burnt sugar there too. Not overly sweet either. Good carbonation. Great beer and mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours cloudy light amber with low white head. Aroma of fruit, malts, light bretta. Taste is boozy, yeasty sweet with spices. Light body with soft carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2013 75 cl bottle. Hazy to cloudy yellow golden, nice frothy white head, stays for a while, foamy layer with yeast islets remains,good lacing; bread, banana, dough, citrus, floral hops, earthy, bit cheesy, citrus; fresh light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, very complex; full body, smooth oily texture, creamy mouthfeel, average carbonation; bittersweet finish in which bitterness lingers on, bit spicy, hint of sourness. Well-balanced and complex brew.

Bu en bouteille de 37.5cl (déjà bu en 75cl) une bière bien blonde et bien troublée, une mousse avec une bonne et longue teneur. Un nez citronné, En bouche on remarque quelle est bien houblonné, ce qui la rend complexe mais elle est aussi parfaitement malté ce qui indique un bon équilibre.
draft @ winter warmer A: vinous, citrusy, pear app: hazy blond small white head. t/p: med body with acidic and short finish.o: superb. would need to fetch some. highly drinkable.

750 mL bottle from BevMo. Appearance: hazy honey yellow, fine bubbles, huge white frothy head.
Aroma: dough yeast upon opening, touch of light malt, citrus zest. 
Palate: Smooth, fine fizzy bubbles, light alcoholic finish. 
Flavor: initially lightly bitter, light alcohol, small amounts of fresh bread, moderate finish. 
Overall: refreshing, not very complex, great for the price.

750ml from Coop (one of my Christmas beers) Had this big beer with a big steak, lots of oven roasted veggies. Huge frothy head erupts from this golden pour in my st. ambroise chalice. uper carbonation, medium-high alcohol warmth. Typical yeasty whiff on the nose, citrus, orange zest, coriander, all-spicey noble hop zest. Unreal smoothness, mild sour, and zestiness on the palate. Delicieux.
On tap. Great aroma and golden hue appearance. Sweet and grassy. Classic tripel flavor.

Part of a wonderful flight that was put together for me at The Brickstore Pub in Decatur, Ga. Pours up a murky orange color with a nice creamy head. Beautiful lacing. Complex, complex, complex. Really a lot going on here. Velvety smooth malts. Loved it.
Cloudy gold thin riimming offwhite head; aroma is hoppy and slightly fruity and yeasty; Flava is rich sweet grainy malt and hoppy dry; feels medium crisp and dry; finishes dry some slightly tart

Cor dourada turva com espuma de boa formação e persistência. Aroma de doce de frutas e malte, um pouco floral. Sabor com médio amargor, bem balanceado com dulçor frutado. Final seco com médio amargor persistente. Excelente. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle - Golden with a white head. Yeast, lemon and spice in the aroma. Tangy and spicy taste with notes of yeast, lemon rind and coriander.

La couleur est très pâle, avec une mousse assez fine. Le nez est frais, citronné, avec des notes de levure et de malt. La bouche est légère, les 9% ne se sentent pas, avec beaucoup de bulles, mais assez fines. Finale correcte avec une belle amertume. Une saison bien réalisée, un peu au-dessus de la Saison Dupont classique, mais ça manque un peu de fruits.

(75 cl bottle from Toft Vin; BBD: 07/17) Pours a slightly hazy golden with ample, foamy white head. Good retention and beautiful lace. Aroma is hay, saison yeast, a hint of pepper. Theres a hint of bread and a hint of alcohol in there too. Quite astringent in the mouth - probably designed to be stored and rounded out for a few years. Medium carbonation. Quite dry on the palate. Flavour has more alcohol prevalence but the character seems to change as the beer warms. Interesting to dwell on but nowhere near as parfumey pleasing as the Tripel Karmeliet with its scent of green apples. This one is more farmyard saison but in a pleasant and refined way.

One year old, from tap @ Delirium
More alchol in the nose., warm, bitter, sweet, complex, alcoholic.bit punchy, spices, full body, warm. bitter sweet finish with a fruity touch in the finish
8 / 3 / 7 / 4 / 13 

Two year old, from tap @ Delirium
Yellow, hazy, slightly darker than the one year, also a bit more tart. Feels a bit more balanced than the one year. 6 / 3 / 8 / 4 /15

The one year has a more appealing nose, while the two years feels more matured, more rounded, more balanced.

Dufter af let svovl og frugtig belgisk.
Gylden og uklar.
Rig på bobler og frugt. Let belgisk gær. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden, opaltrüb, schnell verflüchtigender schaum, aroma nach hefe, grasig, würzig, prickelnde rezenz, feinbitter, guter malziger hintergrund, würzig

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Levure machable, pommes, sapinage, fines herbes, finale pamplemousse. Belle conception sans plus, buvabilité morne.

Unclear, yellow colour, big frothy head withvery nice lacing, Aroma and taste is moderate malty,acidic, Belgian yeast note and light hoppy (citrus note). Very pleasant dry and bitter finish. Everything is perfectly balanced and surprisingly easy to drink. Perfectly hidden alcohol (9,5% ABV). Must to taste!
Bottle from Open All Hours, Keswick.This is a hazy orange-golden beer with spicy citrus and floral flavours, zesty earthy and floral notes with a warming sherbet and whisky-like finish.

Bottle with mR_fr0g at his place on 12 October. Poured a hazy golden colour with a thin white head. Aroma of Belgian yeast, straw and apples. Grassy flavours with some citrus and bready malt. Finishes with hay, orange peal and cloves. Very tasty.

375ml bottle at Bistro LAutre Oeil. Pours cloudy orange with two fingers of white creamy head, leaving a thick lacing along the glass. Aroma is spicy, floral and fruity, candi sugar, yeast. Taste is sweet, earthy and spicy, everything blends perfectly with a nice fruity alcohol presence. Smooth creamy texture, warm finish. Great.

Bottle at home at Beese Tasting. Hazed golden orange, with a white steadfast white frothy head. Aroma is spicy phenols, classic saison yeast esters. Some pineapple in the nose as well. Flavour is wheaty cereal, spicey, light fruits. Light bitterness. Very nice.

Pierwsze, co rzuciło mi się w oczy po przelaniu do szkła to pływające drożdże w dość dużych ilościach i silnie zmętnienie. Źle? Nic z tych rzeczy, piwo kwaskowe, ale niesamowicie treściwe i smaczne. Główne smaki to drożdże, lekka słodowość i połowa asortymentu Twojej lokalnej zielarni, wszystko doskonale zbalansowane. Wrócę na pewno, także sprawdzić poziom tego zmętnienia. Ale przede wszystkim dla smaku!

Bottle. Cloudy Orage Gold with a thick White head. Musty citric aroma with a yeasty Belgia component. Flavour has a sourish wheaty texture with plenty of aromatic hops and that familiar Belgian yeast flavour. Tasted like a Saison to me. Delicious.

Bottle. Golden orange beer with large frothy head. Aroma is yeast, citrus and some lambic notes. Taste is yeast again, spices, citrus, some bitterness and a nice glug of alcohol warmth. Moderate carbonation. A very good beer. Y
I hedge my score a little because of skunkiness, but this beer tastes about as good as any when its in pristine condition. Appley, melony, semisweet, a bit spicy. Great stuff.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2015 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Huge white foam. Fair carbonation. Gentle melon banana green apples. Some dusty yeasty notes as well. Dry slight tartness. Very delicious saison. Food: Classic Rice taffel.
Hazy yellow/orange with a huge, mosty lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, malty,alchool, honey or more bees wax, hive. Flavor is light sour, yeasty, also a bit bitter.

Bottle 0.375l at Herman Berlin. Pours a hazy orange with white head. Aroma is full of grass and yeast. Taste is yeasty, grassy, slightly sweet and full bodied. Balanced with a good touch of bitterness. Alcohol is somehow present. Very good Saison but pretty strong too.

2010 at toronado. A - pours a hazy golden orange with 1 finger white head. Some nice lacing and good retention. S - up front is nice smooth light saison. Belgian yeast, honey, and a over ripe apples. Floral notes with orange, slight dry spicy and soapy hops. T- follow the nose well. belgian yeasts and dusty sweet overripe apples. the palate has slight citrus, floral notes and honey. end is dry, sweet but not sticky. with dry spice, soapy hops and must. O - a nice mellow well rounded saison. Really quite good 3.6

Pours a deep golden colour with some sediments in it and a fluffy white fading head. Noses predominantly of hop and grass but also has notes of green leaves and dust from a field. Light fizzy with a slick texture and a full body. tastes light sweet and bitter due to the dryness it develops on the palate. Finish is medium long leaving a dry note on the back of the palate for quite some time.

Dorée trouble, pétillance moyenne, col blanc moyen persistant. De très bons malts laissent facilement place à une amertume houblonnée avec une bonne présence de coriandre et autres épices (mais pas trop!), des notes de citron et de poivre et un alcool qui se fait sentir sans que ce soir désagréable. Sans oublier une rondeur et un équilibre tous deux excellents!

Tons of bottles over the last 5 years, this review is from a recent one I tried with Joe. Pours hazy gold with medium to thick head. Aromas and flavor of bread, citrus fruit, herbs, malt, and grass. Good amount of carbonation. Really nice beer.

Pours hazy golden with big cream head. Aroma of grass, fresh cut hay. Much more mouthfeel than I was expecting. Funky, basement flavors an boozy. Now I see why this is the "winter" saison. Remarkable beer.

Bottle from Cotteridge wines. Golden orange beer with large frothy head. Aroma is yeast, citrus and some lambic notes. Taste is yeast again, spices, citrus, some bitterness and a nice glug of alcohol warmth. Some moderate carbonation. A very good beer.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Pours a hazy gold similar to the bottles label, with heavy sedimentation. Saison is my favorite style of beer and this one is up there with the best of them. Very strong for a saison at 9.5 abv and it shows. Bready and spicy with some citrus in there to boot. Bitterness is low and the taste of alcohol and sweetness remains in the aftertaste after the spice has passed. Only criticism is a bit of metallic flavor in the mid taste. Very true to the style.

ivory white head that disappears fast with little lacing. orange-blonde clear colour. aroma is boozy, yeast, sweet, almond and bread. taste is sweet, boozy with a slight bitter and spicy (pepper) aftertaste. quite a lot of carbonation, dry mouthfeel, medium body.  bottle 37.5 cl / best before mar-2018

375ml Champagne bottle from Beers Of Europe. Pours a hazy golden colour with some of the yeast in the glass, has a medium sized white head which stays. A very yeasty, earthy smell with hints of lemon. Taste is again very yeasty with a malt backbone, some bitterness on the back of the tongue. Lots of yeast present. Has a long finish and a medium body with a medium level of carbonation. An excellent beer, best saison Ive had so far, though Ive not had many.

37.5cl bottle @ home, from B&S Drinks Wilsele; pours hazy golden with nice white head; smell is herbal, spicy; taste is also herbal, spicy, some bitterness and alcohol ic warmth in the end; oily texture. Nice!
Very nice saison. Pale gold from a bottle. Very dry, which I like. Bread. Yeast. Earthy spicyness. Nice.
vintage 2006 bottle shared by marcus. pours yellow with flluffy white head. aroma was slightly tart. taste was crisp barnyard, leather, hay, all with a kinda tart finish.

Draft pour - hazy golden amber pour with a medium head and a high level of retention (one serious cap on this brew)...lots of lacing. Aroma is intense - yeast and spice dominate, hint of tart funkiness, apple, pepper and estery - good stuff!! Flavor is pretty solid as well...bready and doughy with ample spice (pepper and clove were notable)...still some funkiness going here with some citrus fruits...very little hop note, but that was just fine. Palate is resinous and oily - the 9.5% is well hidden here. Another excellent beer I had from DuPont this evening - look forward to trying more in the future!
Cloudy pale gold pour with a very thick head. Aroma is strong yeast, a little citrus, bread. Taste was slight fruit over mineral/flint, bready.
Strong saison by the masters from Dupont. Bitter, yeasty, dry and herbal. All together in an aromatic, rich beer.

750 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled 4/30/2012. Pours fairly hazy and cloudy golden amber color with a 3 finger foamy and rocky white head with incredible retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Thick foamy lacing clings around the glass, with plenty of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Amazing appearance. Aromas of big lemon zest, apple, pear, pepper, clove, grape, herbal, floral, grass, bread, light funk, and floral/yeast earthiness. Incredible aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/spicy yeast ester notes with a light malt balance; and good strength. Taste of big lemon zest, apple, pear, pepper, clove, herbal, floral, grass, light funk, bread, and floral/yeast earthiness. Good amount of earthy spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of light fruits, pepper, clove, herbal, floral, grass, light funk, bread, and floral/yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity and balance of fruity/spicy esters with a light malt balance; and zero cloying flavors after the finish. High carbonation and medium bodied; with a very crisp, dry, and prickly mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden for 9.5% with only a slight warming noticed after the finish. Overall this is a world class saison! Incredible balance and complexity of fruity/spicy esters with light malt balance; and extremely crisp to drink for the alcohol level. Absolutely insane.

at blind tigers "christmas in july". belgian yeast easters, a some fruity esters, alcohol. slightly hazy light gold/straw color, with a modest white head. drinks like a soft belgian strong golden ale. its got some reasonable bitterness. drinks light, though its actually a bit more substantial in body than the senses let on. alcohol becomes more perceivable as it warms. clean finish.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2013 75cl bottle at new terrace De Vooruit Ghent.
APPEARANCE: quite a large head, clear blond beer. Stable white head.
NOSE: hoppy, citrus, little alcohol, some wood.
TASTE: malts, quite bitter but very fruity. Dries out a little. Some yeast in aftertaste which makes this more unpleasant for me
8/3/6/3/14
Re-rate - 3 year old sample - aged properly
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, nice stable white head.
NOSE: grains, fruity, hops, aged.
TASTE: grains, some hops.
Some oxidation in general noticeable, but aged nicely.
Super carbed up, had to pour very slowly. Tasted like a standard saison, with nothing on the finish.

Belle bière blonde trouble plutôt pétillante, coiffée dune bonne couche de mousse ; arômes de levures champenoises, de raisins verts et de fruits jaunes. En bouche, sucre cuit, fruits caramélisés, acidulé très discret mais bien présent, elle est savoureuse, puissante, on détecte la fameuse levure saison (un peu de piquant sec en fin de gorgée). Pas aussi complexe que prévue, elle demeure cependant un excellent exemple du savoir-faire belge, un des fleurons de cette brasserie et du pays qui labrite. Cest avec cette bière que je fête mes 6 mois sur RateBeer.

Geel gouden witte kraag
Zeer beperkt aroma maar kan ook komen dat ik met mijn neus boven de bbq hang
Smaken: droog, wijn(achtig), hoppig, bijzonder veel troebele deeltjes onderin de fles
Matig zoet, redelijk bitter, fris mwaah

750 mL bottle. Tonnes of sediment. Head is probably affected by age. 2008 vintage. A big saison, but Id never guess 9.5%. Lots of fruit, maraschino cherry syrup sweetness, just on the edge of cloying. Wouldnt want to age this any longer. Carbonation likely reduced by age as well.

Bière aux qualités strictement exceptionnelles... Un positionnement très particulier
aussi, parce quil sagit dune blonde très forte (9,5 % abv), mais qui nest pas une triple.
Le site la classe comme « saison », mais cest en fait une spéciale forte refermentée en
bouteille. Mon exemplaire est une 37,5 cl du millésime 2011. Elle a donc 1 an et demi,
mais le brasseur la préconise en conservation longue en cave, dans mon cas jusquen
fin 2016.... Présentation très sobre de létiquette sur un fond bleu turquoise...
Bouchon de liège, même pour cette contenance faible de 37,5 cl. Très bien.
Couleur doré foncé brillant.
Clarté au léger voile de levure, qui est aussi présente en particules fines.
Bulles très vives partout dans le verre (et dailleurs forte explosion au débouchage).
Mousse blanche crémeuse qui tient à 5 mm.
Arômes de malt, whisky des lowlands, zeste dorange, pointe de poivre, houblon fleuri.
1ère bouche à la texture structurée, au départ sur le malt, avec un parallèle rigoureux sur
la levure. Arrière-bouche très ferme dune bière qui sait ce quelle veut, jolie nuance de
houblon, complexité du malt.
2ème bouche avec du malt et des épices en même temps, et du très grand art pour léquilibre
avec le houblon.
3ème nez sur les fruits blancs et la levure : superbe.
3ème bouche merveilleuse, à la texture plus soyeuse, puis plus épicée que la 2, avec une
tendance alcool de grain.
Longueur fantastique : équilibre, force, vigueur, profondeur, ampleur, complexité.
Levure un rien citronnée, de classe pure, splendide veine : une vraie levure supérieure.
Alcool solide, adéquat à une bière de ce niveau.
La finale développe encore (si cétait possible) le niveau des saveurs.
Conclusion. Grandeur et splendeur. Une très grande bière pour marquer la Saint Jean...
Les jours vont décroître, on repart vers les bières dhiver !! Et celle-ci, précisément,
est digne dune bière dhiver, originale, en version blonde.

Draught at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Hazy amber liquid with medium to big white head. Aroma of white pepper, bread, flowers, light bubblegum and bread. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of white pepper, bread and flowers. Light to medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice, though a bit sweet for my liking.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2015 Geelgoud bier met dikke fijne schuimkraag. Geuren van hop en gele grapefruit. Ook in de smaak komt duidelijk de grapefruit terug, ook de alcohol is duidelijk aanwezig. Daarnaast een iets trekkend metalig mondjevol. Al met al een zeer interessant bier wel erg hoog in de alcohol dat proef je ook

Easy to drink beer... Love  it... Best for summers on deck overlooking anything from trailor to beach to forest ... 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ home. Interessante profumo acidulo, che in qualche modo ricorda le fermentazioni spontanee. Lascia da subito trasparire una luppolatura molto erbacea e profumata. Il colore è giallo paglierino, la schiuma è poderosa, va versata con molta cautela. Al primo assaggio risulta acidula, ma poi fuoriesce un discreto calore alcolico ben bilanciato dal luppolo. Rotonda sul palato, ha pochissimo corpo, come mi aspetto da una saison e la sensazione è quasi di secchezza. invita alla beva in maniera perfida. una delle migliori Saison.
Feeling this more as a tripel than a saison. Absolutely marvelous beer. I know little. Drunk with Brian so I was.

(tap) Golden-orange-yellow colour with a very persistent foamy white head. Looks very appealing. Yeasty-spicy aroma. Herbal notes, some bubblegum, and (unfortunately), some alcohol. Light to medium sweetness, light bitterness. Full-bodied, smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Very good, though in terms of aroma I probably prefer the regular Saison Dupont.

Pours hazy golden with medium white head
Aromas of sweet bananas, wheat, pale malts, hints of bretta, sour fruits
Very nice round sweet palate that clings of well. Very well balanced

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bomber (from notes).  Split this at a new years party.  Solid saison that held up well with all the food we were eating.

Yellow orange color with huge, huge white head. Aroma of white wine, yeast, lemon zest, camomile, honey, vanilla. Taste is light sweet a bit tart and quite dry at the end. Light to medium body, oily slick texture, lively carbonation. Champagne-like

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2015 Color: nice hazy blond beer with small carbonation and medium white head. Smell : floral, grass and some acid presence, the nose is really pleasant. Taste: strong malt taste really amazing with a good equilibrium with floral and grass taste. Really amazing beer! Aftertaste: nice bitterness not so strong and grass presence.

750ml bottle served in a Triple Karmeliet tulip glass.

A - Pours a cloudy orange with an impressive white head that shows excellent retention.

S - Pilsner malt, lemon, wet hay, spice, coriander, apple, peach, bubblegum, taffy, alcohol, tart grassy hops.

T - Follows the nose, spicy yeast, coriander, apricot, peach, apples, bubblegum, taffy, lemon cuts through the sweet stone fruit, a very mild grassy tartness plays on the back of the throat, pilsner malt keeps the base. Finishes spicy.

M - Medium body, moderate carbonation, fruity semi-dry finish.

Big pilsner malt base, with loads of fruity yeast esters. Hops are grassy and mild, finishes peppery and semi-dry. Very good overall. Pretty high ABV for the style but drinks good.

Serving type: bottle

03-31-2012

Flaska som legat  ca 1,5 år. Gyllengul dimmig öl, med ett stort småbubbligt skum. Doft av jäst, citrus, äpple och andra frukter och lätt syrlighet och källartoner. Detta kommer tilbaka i smaken tillsammans med lädertoner.

Bottle, 

this ale had a hazy orange pour with various orange and yellow hues, the pour made a large white foamy head and is truly effervescent, bubbles flowed continuously in the glass, the lacing was good, 

there were aromas of orange, orange skin, earthy/barnyard/wild flower funkiness, faint malt and lemon fruit, 

it had flavors of light orange, grapefruit and lemon fruit with field flowers, bread and a touch of grassy herbs, 
little fruit sweetness at the start of the drink, and ends dry, there was a lemon juice like pucker at the finish and it gave a little pepper on the palate, 

the mouth feel was around medium or a bit more, this drink did not feel like a Saison, it was heavier, 

drank like the big brother to the Saison Dupont Vieille Provision with more heft on the palate, aroma and flavor was similar in more ways than one to the Saison Dupont, the 9.5% alc. was hidden well, a nice drink but just did not have the feel of a Saison drink.

75cl bottle shared at Probus Wines, Dublin. Pours hazy golden colour with thick white head and plenty of lacing. Lots of pungent, fruity, spicy yeast character on the nose, some citrus, sweet cake dough/white bread, and earthy notes. Taste is full of wonderful fruity, semi-funky yeast notes, bread, wheat, light lemon, earthy notes, herbs, spice. Mouthfeel is full - huge natural carbonation that really lifts the flavours. Incredibly dry finish and not a hint of the alcoholic strength. Lots of pungent yeasty spiciness lingers into the aftertaste. Delicious stuff.

On tap @ Kulminator, Antwerpen, kindly shared by 77ships, cheers man! :-) Hazy yellow body, medium white head. Nose is tart-is saison yeast tones with straw, pale malts and hints of lemon. Taste is very similar, with smooth tones of straw, saison yeast, lemon and hints of hay and citric peel. Semi-full body, creamy mouthfeel. Very fresh and drinkable, though not terribly complex. Nice one.
Appearance straw yellow hazy with a white head aroma citrus taste citrus and slight palate
bottle 37.5cl @home. pours slightly hazy light golden, small white head. belgian yeast, wheat, spices in the aroma. spices, wheat flavor, some sweetness. a bit of alcohol bite.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2017 Bottle from a beer shop in Tallinn. Pours hazy golden with a big frothy white head. The aroma offers rich fruitiness, pale maltiness and yeasty spiciness, especially fresh apple and citrus fruits feature. Taste is crisp, spicy and fruity; classic Belgian farmhouse theme with a perfect balance between different elements. Dry and medium bitter towards the end. Stronger than saisons usually but also richer in taste. Medium to full bodied, average to high in carbonation. Overall an excellent and, due to strength, also original take on the saison style.

0.75l corked bottle from Etre. This is a lovely looking almost glowing light cloudy one, packed with particles floating around in the glass and a medium size off-white top. Smells amazing. Subtle lemony, lots of Saison yeast, wet autumn leafs, strawberries. The subtle lemon suits it perfectly. Soft to average on the carbonation with a really slick mouthfeel. Tastes like autumn this. Lots of just lovely saison flavors, dry grapes, acidic strawberries, wheat, yeast, so many tiny subtle fruity flavors that its hard to tear apart. Shared this bottle, but Id really like to have it for myself. 29.03.2013

Pour is a clear straw/yellow, lots of yeast, and a huge bubbly white head. Slightly grassy nose, little spice, alcohol, citrus and wet hay. Citrusy and grassy taste, floral spice, and a touch of alcohol. Medium bodied, active carbonation and really well balanced. One of my favorite saisons.
Refreshing and dry. Fruity, citrusy and peppery aroma and taste. Good carbination. The best super saison I have tasted so far.

Aroma of non descript berries.  Also slight funk spice and baked bread.  Tastes about as pungently of Belgian yeast as possible.  Also apple cider and bubblegum notes with the slight acidity.  Seriously boozy. Near still carb.  Great briny buttery umnami mouthfeel.
Cloudy orange colour. Floral yeasty aroma. Spicy yeasty taste with farmhouse funkiness.
Draft at Memphis. Pours a cloudy orange with thin off-white head and lace. Nose of hay, coriander, citrus, roasted malt spice. Somewhat sweet, well carbonated with a slight hop bite.

Hazy straw/gold color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of yeast, rich floral, fruit, & spice; Flavor of slight sweet malt, yeast, floral hops, citrus, fruit, some coriander, and pepper; Dry finish; Fairly high carbonation; Overall, a little mellow - but well done.

Bottle. Pale yellow, with sediment in bottle. Nose is quite dry - hay, light oranges, old hops, wheaty pale malts. And a bit of robust maltyness, probably due to the high abv. Body is very nice. Full, a bit of malty alcoholic sweetness, hay, wheat. Dried-up hops, Almost overpowering flavours. This is an imperial saison of sorts; the right, good, saisonny flavours are there, in good proportions, but everything is just a bit more intense. Interesting & worth another try!
750 ml bottle. Pours a hazy yellow hay color with no head. Aromas of skunk, pitted fruit, and dried bananas, all with underlying floral notes. Flavors of yellow fruit and malts. Smooth.

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2014 From tap @ Kulminator Antwerpen. Pours hazy intense light yellow with a decent steady, firm white head.. Nose is very fresh; citrus zest and greenish herbs & spices (cloves & coriander). Medium body with a huge creamy mouthfeel, very crisp and slightly bitter. Taste is mellowy citrus and green hops.
February 2012. From a corked 750 ml. bottle. Pours hazy golden color with a white fizzy head. Aromas of banana, hay, spice, yeast and bread. Good one.
UPDATED: JUL 12, 2014 Golden pour, white head, nose is citrus, grainy, taste is sour, sweet, dry finish.

750ml bottle in a snifter.  Pours cloudy golden with a lacy, white head.  Aroma of spicy yeast, some caramel and pale malts, light fruits and green apple, and floral hops.  Flavor the same with a good amount of everything and a nice blend.  Average texture.  A good saison, but I dont know if its one of the best.
Spring scents welcomes you. Its golden, smooth and tastes like a fresh apple in the summer. Happy New Year, I can drink this all year!!

the best x-mas beer. 
Fruity, bitter but soft.
Dry hopping, very complex tast
If toast always lands butter-side down, and cats always land on their feet, what happen if you strap toast on the back of a cat and drop it?

pop from cork might wake the neighbors.i have never liked (alot) a beer over 7.5% and i can still say this after trying this saison.taste of alcohol is not "well hidden",maybe 1 too many spices,and that sweeter taste as the saison warms is not to my liking!

Pours a massive white head with amber colour. Aroma is yeast and fruit towards apples. Taste is floral, apple, hints of caramel and leather. well balancwd and very dry finish. Lovely beer and a great sipper.
This review is exported from olutopas.info with no comment. Original rating date  18.7.2010

Hazy golden yellow with small white foam head. Aroma is fresh fruity, mango and banana. Taste is difficult to define but going to soft fruits, peach, mango. Good aftertaste. (Utrecht 201303)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2014 Intenso color giallo effervescente con uno spesso cappello di schiuma bianca. Aroma pungente, speziato con sentori di banana, bucce di agrumi, lievito e caramello; gusto dolciastro, mieloso, anchesso speziato e leggermente erbaceo. Corposa, frizzante e piacevolmente strutturata, una Saison aromatica irrobustita dallalcool che fa invidia a molte altre!
Aroma is sweet hay and coriander, appearanc eis hazy golden with thick fluffy head. Taste isspicy, some sweetness and mellow bitterness. Very complex and truly delicious.

Bottle at home. Pours a pale yellow, huge frothy head with great retention. Plenty of diacetyl on the nose. Also smells alcoholic, funky, spicy, banana, apple. Moderate carbonation, soft and creamy palate. Great balance of sweet, sour, bitter flavors, with loads of soft fruit, Dupont funk, herbal flavors, and belgian yeastiness that give it a distinctive banana overtone. No one aspect really pushes into the realm of greatness, but everything comes together nicely to make an above average saison. Lackluster, but solid.
Cloudy yellow coloured beer with a white head and lots of sediment. Fresh yeasty and fruity aroma, flavour is yeasty with a medium body and a bitter aftertaste. Good brew! (Corked Bottle 75cl)

Poured from a corked and caged 750 ml bottle. Pours a hazy gold with a huge white head of foam. Aroma reminds me a lot of a pilsner, but the taste is definitely more saison-like. The taste is fairly herbal and dry and grassy. Its almost sweet, but its not overly so. Soft carbonation with a definitive grassy and herbal finish. Very good overall.
Poured a hazy golden with a frothy white head, aroma of spicey yeast and citrus. Medium body, flavour is a bit sour, some sweet notes over the fruit. A bit sour in the aftertaste.

Draft at Fireworks Alexandria. Poured a relatively clear yellow color with a medium sized white head. Aroma was some funky spice notes with some pepper, yeast notes. Flavor was some spice notes, yeast, and some pepper funk. Pretty enjoyable.

Pours a large, white frothy head that mostly lasts. Body is hazy and sparkling, color is yellow. Aroma contains orange, lemon, dough, banana, cherry, coriander and other spices. Flavor starts off light acidic, to be followed by sweetness and to finish in light astringent bitterness and warming alcohol. Body is medium with creamy texture and soft carbonation. I love it! It's not very complex but very subtle and well balanced.
Bottle.  Golden with white head. Dusty peppery aroma. Taste is biscuity, cereals, peppery and dusty. Bitter and tangy. Lingering cereal taste and bitterness.  I dont like this at all.

Hazy golden, pillowy white head. Aroma: very yeasty, with plenty of spice (coriander), lemon peel, dough, wood. Taste: strong citrus notes, spice, apple, touch of funk. Dry/sour finish. Creamy mouthfeel, high carbonation. Alcohol well hidden.  A lovely, complex beer.

Draught. Pours a very hazy dark gold with a somewhat thick white head. Nose and taste both have just a hint of sour, but not overpoweringly so. Its actually a very light beer thats easy to drink. Much better than I thought.
Hazy orange pour with quickly disappearing eggy head. Nose is very yeasty and citrus. hint of spices and a sweet edge. Creamy rich body. Yeasty + bitter finish. Very warming for a saison.

Bottle. Fresh and sweet odour, maybe a bit plain. Taste is great though, nice balance between the bitter and sweet and quite fruity. Aftertaste is a bit alcoholic, though. Beer is cloudy, dark yellow with a thick head that lasts for quite long.

Draught @ Monks:  This one pours a hazy orangish color.  There was almost no head and no lacing.  The nose is very nice.  Many varied fruits coming through, but no real sweetness.  Actually a hint of sourness to the fruits.  The taste is very good.  Some dryness and bitterness, and a hint of sourness also.  Subtle fruits, hints of spices.  Exceptionally smooth .  Very nice!

One of the better Saison Belgians that I've ever had. Super super super carbonated when first outing, reminds me a lot of the Dogfish 75 minute, and puts a nice golden color with plenty of sediment. Great tastes of pears and bananas, and has a nice finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

One of the nicest saisons I've tasted. Very full feel for a saison. Somewhat like thick French bread. A bit bitter aftertaste but finishes with a tingle on the tongue.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2014 On tap 1 year old at Delirium Hoppy Loft. Mild sweet honey floral aroma. Golden, bit hazy with medium white creamy head. Mild sweet start, not too sweet with honey and melon notes. Later nice remaining bitterness appears on the tongue root.

csakajosor.hu
 Világos aranysárga színe van, opálos belsővel, vastag, fehér habbal, ami elég gyorsan elolvad. Igencsak belga élesztős, citrusos, gyümölcsös, balzsam ecetes és édeskés. Íze is rendkívül friss, gyümölcsös, zöld almás, finoman fanyar, citrusos, száraz pezsgős és csipetnyit alkoholosan édes. Testes ital és pezsgő szerűen élő. Utóíze édeskés és kissé fanyar, száraz. Ez bizony nagyon rendben van, remekül kiegyensúlyozott és nem túl savanyú saison. Sokkal inkább tíz ilyen, mint egy cider!

Poured from a bottle into a tulip, the appearance is beautiful with a nice straw gold and substantial head which lasts through the drink, the aroma is citrus, earthy taste is pepper, citrus, bitter on the back end,no noticeable alcohol until you finish the sip.

Cloudy golden colour, some white head;aroma of yeast and sourish/sweet fruits with some well hidden alcohol; marvellous taste of citric sourness and hoppy(maybe a bit grapefruit) bitterness with spicy flavours and minimal alcoholic sweetness; dry aftertaste; perfect beer on tap at Csakajósör - many thanks to the owner!

Tap at Gingerman.  Pours pretty golden with white head.  Nose of yeast and tropical fruits.  Tastes of citrus, yeast, bubblegum, peppery spices, and fesh grass.  Creamy mouthfeel with some alcohol on finish.

Pours a hazy pale yellow color. Barnyard and earthy aromas, some spice and citrus. The taste is quite spicy, barnyard, yeast, faint sweetness underneath a soft citrus. Medium body and a little oily, slightly above average carbonation though soft structure. Overall a beer that I really enjoy. i have had it on tap before and that is where it really shines.

On tap at Csakajósör, Budapest. Hazy, pale color with big, creamy, white head. Pronounced fruity aroma with herbs and grass. The alcohol appears seriously, but not desurbing. Interesting soury yeast flavour. Light bittersour taste, no sweetness. Light to medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation. Spicy, yeasty finish. Deliciously tart beer with unique yeast flavours. Not at all sweet, but alcoholly. Nice one!

750 ml. bottle. It pours a hazy yellow/orange color with a massive, three finger white head. I dont think I let this rest long enough since theres a lot of sediment floating around. The aroma is really phenomenal. Lots of farmhouse character with lemon, orange sweet and citric, mild mineral and sulfer, little wet hay (not funky) and complex yeast spice. I love the balance of the fruity tart and sweet combined with the yeast. With all the carbonation swirling, it doesnt look like the floaties will settle out any time soon. The flavor is amazingly fruity yet dry with intense yeast spiciness and lots of carbonation which borders on distracting. Im getting a lot of different fruit from oranges, peach, apple, pear with only mild alcohol felt at the very finish. Barely noticeable bitterness in the finish as well. Overall, very well balanced and intense yeast character. I would buy this again.

On tap.
Opalesquent golden colour, medium sized white pillow, which leaves a thin film behind.
Yeasty nose and aroma escorted by honey, bread and citrusses underpainted by alcohol.
Slick, syrupy mouthfeel.
Somewhat peppery and tart finish with herbs and distinct alcohol.
Nice.
Grass, citrus, wheat, and spice in the aroma.  Taste starts sweet and smooth, then finishes with fruity bitterness and spice.  Really good.

Bottle at home. Vintage 2012. Has a hazy straw yellow colour with a big frothy off-white head. A compact aroma of belgian yeast, hay and some alcohol and floral. A rich flavour with a lot of pale malt, belgian yeast, hay and some alcohol and spices. A bit dry in the end. Has a rich and soft mouthfeel, and a light bitterness. The beer feels rich and more like a powerful tripel with a decent balance.

Draught.  Light clear yellow with good initial head. aroma is honey light bread, light Brett, floral, and not quite ripe apples or pears.  Flavor pretty boozy, biscuity, apples , pears and their skins. The bitterness is herbal and pronounced enough to  balance.  The feel is juicy with soft carbonation.  Nice beer.

On tap at Delirium (Brussels, Belgium)
Aroma:Dough, citrus, grass, and some herbal aromas.
Appearance: A slightly hazy light gold with a large white head.
Taste: A little fruity, but quite bitter. Some citrus in the finish.
Palate: Medium bodied, and an average carbonation.
Not my favorite from Brasserie Dupont. I find that this one has a little less character than the other offerings, but its still quite good.

750 ml bottle purchased right at a year ago at Holiday Wine Cellar ($10.99).  Pours a peach amber hue with giant fluffy bright white head that has fantastic retention and leaves rocky formations.  Nice complex aroma of yeast, bready malts, white wine, honeysuckle, fresh flowers, apple, peach, and pepper.  Flavor of rich bready malts, yeast, tart green apple, some citrus and dark fruit, and some spice (pepper and coriander).  The finish is dry and lightly sweet with a detectable amount of hop bitterness.  The high ABV is well concealed.  Would like to see more of these higher-ABV but balanced and complex saisons.  Always look forward to this at the end of the year and I usually have it on draft, but it was good to age a bottle for this rating.  (1173, 767)

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2013 Draught at BXL East.  Lovely saison brewed for the holidays, I absolutely love this beer. Pours golden yellow with huge frothy head.  Terrific lacing.  Lovely doughy aroma with some floral and cirtus notes. Taste is a wonderful balance of yeast and fruit and spice. Complex and perfect.

Bottle. Pours lightly hazy gold with thick, creamy white head; good retention and some lacing. Aroma is heavy spice, dank hops, lemongrass, honey, orange peel, biscuit, and light floral notes. Flavor is sweet, bready malts, nice spice, floral and grassy hops, light dank, and light fruit esters; crisp, dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.
Bottle from Belgianshop. Golden color, full white head. Bitter taste with grass, citrus, barnyard, floral hops, herbs and spices. Dry bitter finish with citrus. Supreme saison.

75 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20090918.
Pours golden color with a medium sized head. Aroma of yeast, citrus fruits, some soapy notes, spices and grass. Flavor of hay, yeast, citrus fruits and mild spices. Refreshing.

Draft at Capones. Have had this before but never rated. Light hay gold pour. Tons of head. Aroma is highly Belgian spice with lots of coriander. Taste is both fruity and nutty. Refreshing. Perfect abv too.

Pours straw with dissipating head. Aroma is Belgian yeast. Taste is spicy and earthy with some citrus notes. Lively carb. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Straw yellow with a smooth short white head that lasts all the way until its gone. Aroma of a sourdough bread starter, peppery yeast and hay. Taste is strong yeast, some soapiness,  some fruitiness and pepper. A bit boozy. Pretty nice!

Hazy orange. Spritzy white head. Wild yeasty aroma with a sharp spiciness.  Sparce white lacing it leaves on the glass. The aroma is weak alcohol and apple juice. The taste, well lets just say the yeast makes the beer. Yum.

Blonde forte superbe, une de mes préférés 
, je recommande vivement cette bière. La à bon v?ux est maintenant disponible toute lannée.

Pours murky blonde with a thin, rapidly diminishing white head. Aroma is dry hay, peppery hops, a bit of honey malt. Taste is lovely, a sweet fruity opening leads to a sharp lemon tang, delicate floral finish. Absolutely stunning, with a delightful gentle carbonation, lovely and prickly on the tongue. Palate is lovely; substantial and syrupy, dry finish with a minor alcohol burn.

Draft at craft ale house. Pours semi clear orange with a big white head and tons of carbonation. The aroma has lemon, orange, coriander, and extra spices. The taste is lightly spicy with a lemon zest sweetness. This is nice but could use more of a carbonation to cut the light alcohol.

Cloudy orange-gold with a creamy, good lacy, lasting off-white head. Smells of spices like cloves and coriander with yeast, sweet malt and some light citrus hops. Perhaps some tropical fruit as well. Medium oily dry body with soft carbonation. Tastes of soft caramel that combines with the spices, lemon citrus and yeast and some alcohol present on the bitter finish. The balance is very impressive as it moves from sweet to a more spicy flavour making it very smooth and easy to drink. Would like to try one a bit older to get that alcohol taste out.

Pours yellow with a clear white head. Delicious citric and yeasty aroma. Taste is sweet and a little bit sour with nice bubbles and a gentle hoppiness. Alcohol is very well hidden. Another great beer from Dupont.
So subtle and so nice. Just  a little bit of everything nice. Like a saison but not too tart, it has some sweetness and a great aftertaste that keeps tingling. Bottle from De Schans

From notes at the Ginger Man in NYC. Pours a cloudy golden yellow with a foamy white head and nice lace. Nice aromas of of belgian yeast. Flavours of citrus fruit, some vegetal notes and grass. Very nice saison.

Bottle from Muckeys. Poured into a stem glass. A cloudy light orange with a huge fluffy white head. I had to wait for head to subside to pour some more in. Aroma of fruit and yeast. Flavor is very smooth, especially for 9.5%. Complex yeast profile. Well balanced. Goes down nicely. Not fizzy. Very well made and enjoyable.

On tap at Tria.  Like a saison but stronger.  Ok, essentially its a tripel with some saison characteristics.  gold orange color with a thin head and soapy lacing.  Lots of Belgian yeast in the palate, a little heavier than it looks - doesn't look like a typical holiday ale but it is as robust as one.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Incredible! Pours light orange with an initial massive foamy head that eventually leaves a nice whit coating. Some lacing. Nose is yeast and fruit. Aromas are cereal, yeast, citrus fruit, hints of candy and some sweet malt. Tastes are light sweet, very light bitter finish. Creamy body with champagne-like carbonation. Truly a masterpiece!

Really liked this one.  Yellow color with a huge head and lots of carbonation.  Aroma was belgian yeast and malt.  Flavor profile was full of typical belgian yeast, bread, and malt with a hint of bitterness.  Very well balanced.  Alcohol was well hidden.
From a 75 cl bottle shared at home.  Pours a cloudy gold with a thick billowing white head.  Crisp aroma with citrus and spice notes.  Flavors of orange zest and bread.  Slight metallic aftertaste.
Wow this is delicious. Sweet with alcohol present. Caramel and thin silky ttexture. Mild dark fruits. Finishes with a tart kick.

Monthly Beerevents tasting @ HeidebrouwerijCloudy blond, nice white head. Aroma and taste are yeast, spices, bretty, farm, banana, funk. Great body and carbonation, just perfect. Great mouth feel. Well-balanced beer.
On tap at Boudewijns. Hazy golden yellow. Citrus, yeast, bitterness. Well-balanced, but somewhat unexiting. Didnt meet expectations.

Pours a hazy golden yellow on tap with frothy white head that leaves good lacing on the way down. Smell of farmhouse funk and belgian yeast, taste follows with bits of lemon, grass, and an alcoholic burn on the way down. Pretty good for what it is.

Tap - pours hazy gold-yellow, minimal white head. Slight aromas of spices, dough and yeasty goodness. Tastes of spice, dough and slight fruity notes. Finishes with bit of pepper. Ok if not memorable or spectacular.
Draught @ Restaurang Treskillingen. Cloudy yellow colour with a thick white head. Aroma of yeast, lemon. Flavour is the same as the aroma, yeast, lemon.
Light on the nose but very nice on the palate with a dry but light. Got that? Great great balance of Belgian yeast flavor and acid, good light body and nice profile.

Pours a rich blondish copper color with a big frothy four plus head that rocks and laces beautifully. On the nose its slightly skunky, peppery spice, honeyed malt and a touch of booze.  On the palate there is a lot of the same. Nice balance with the carbonation and the a full mouthfeel. Notes of orange rind, pine, earthy peppered spices and a sweet malty backbone thats a little sticky. Nice hint fo booze helps cut the sweetness on the finish.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2012 Gold color, white head. Aroma is funk, light fruits (pear and apricot).  Floral. Dry finish. Nice carb, medium body.  Gentle alcohol apparent in finish. 

Had been looking forward to this for awhile. Didnt rock me the way I was expecting, but definitely quite nice. Would be perfect for dinner parties this holiday season. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rating #785, bottle from Ølbutikken, brought by Nabil to Christmas Brew Tasting 2012. Yellow, hazy beer with high head. Aroma is hoppy and citrusy. Flavor of citrus, hops, alcohol and a lot of bitterness in the finish. Medium thick palate. Frankly a quite simple and bit boring beer.

On tap 4 oz. pour at Churchkey in Logan Circle neighbohood, Washington, DC.

Clear, bright mahogany with khaki head and excellent lacing.

Aroma of dark fruit, toffee, dark sweet malt, brown sugar, raisins and spices.

Taste of alcohol burn, rich dark fruit, figs, pepper, cloves, sweet dark roasted malt and toffee.

Very full body and low carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cloudy yellow decent lacing. Very Saison smelling. Tastes like a heavy Saison crossed with champagne.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber, 2011. Pours with a lovely, cloud-like head that lingers. Cloudy, medium copper color with good carbonation. Nose is sweet tropical fruit, funky yeast. Complex palate, with lovely notes of earthy, fruity esters and honey, contrasted with the funk of the yeast. Alcohol is in evidence, but not front and center. To me, much more reminiscent of a fine Tripel than a Saison. An epic drop.

Aroma: The smell is acid, Crème fraîche, green apples, some leathery stable nuances.Appearance: A golden brew, initially clear but with yeast at the bottom of the bottle, an off-white head, compact and leaving some lacing.Taste: Some raw sugar sweetness, ripe fruits, and a strong bitter tang that recedes, leaving yeast and fresh buns as a memory.Palate: A lot of carbonation, like a sparkling wine, a warm feeling.Overall: Not bad, but the surge of bitterness was a bit to dominant for me, made the experience somewhat unbalanced. But can replace champagne when needed - thats positive.Note: bottle Reviewed 2010-05-13.
Bright oaky orange three finger head. Nice lacing. Candied sugar and honey. Bready yeast. Taste is sweet. Oranges and coriander. Very cloyingly sweet. Lots of bright floral notes.
Draft to snifter at Dutchs. Looks solid; a semi-transparent honey with white lacing. Smells and tastes spicy and yeasty. Average on the palate. A decent example of the style.

Bottle.  Hazy golden beer with a big bubbly white head.  Aroma is classic Belgian yeast, citrus, a little funk.  Taste is sweet, fruity with some bitterness and spice.  Finish is dry and spicy.  Not even a hint of alcohol.  Medium bodied, very smooth, silky, moderate carbonation.  Excellent saison.

Bottle at Toronado - San Diego.  Pours a hazed wheat golden with a thin but persistent creamy off-white head.  Nice rich malty accent to the complex spicy, barnyard chatcter of the saison.  Highly carbonated.  Great beer.
This bottle may have bee really old. Will re-rate in the future. light yellow big head. Nose is big funk and spice. Taste is skunk, earth, and hay.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2013 Znakomite piwo, zwłaszcza jeśli chodzi o prezentację. Wspaniale wygląda, świetnie się nalewa, trzeba bardzo ostrożnie bo spore nagazowanie. Gigantyczna piana i super trwała. Aromat biszkoptowo-jabłkowy. W smaku owocowo-biszkoptowe z lekką słodyczą. Finisz rozgrzewający i uderzający do głowy. Polecam zwłaszcza na świąteczną zimową aurę.

(Bottle). This bottle may have been quite old or tainted. It poured with overpowering frothy head. The flavor was mineral and uncharacteristic.  A disappointment.  Bottle was not dated to conform age. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(Draught) cloudy rich gold-orange, few bubbles if any. Nose of spicy Belgian yeast, peppery, gold raisins, light earth, rich and lightly Tart also. Taste is earthy, spicy, stone fruit, Peach, peppercorns. Body and carbonation are medium and appropriate for the style. Could be slightly drier.
One of the best saisons in Belgium.  Tart with a grapefruity aroma, slightly funky, yeasty flavor, and a really nice mouthfeel.  Nice carb.

75 cl bottle.Poured with large white head on top of orange coloured beer.Barnyard aromas easily detected straight away,spices too and also a hint of leather.
In the taste is citrus and apple with yeast also in evidence.Soon after spices start to appear too along with caramel and a hint of other fruits.Both complex and impressive each time i sample it.

On tap. Hazy orange color. Good thin white head, leaves good lace. Nice spicy, estery nose. Very nice smooth, lighter carbonation, bigger body but not viscous, just velvety, really. Nice yeasty estery aroma. Alcohol is well-blended, its detectable, but not intrusive. Mild sweet / savory taste. Very nice.

Pours clear golden with a tiny white fizz ring. Smells light and funky with a touch of white fruits. Taste is lightly funky at first and then has a fruity, pear taste and then a blonder funkier barnyard flavor. Light-bodied with a slick texture and subtle fizzy mouth-carbonation, Dupont Avec les Bons Voeux finishes with a funked fruit note.

2010 bottle poured apricot with a huge white foamy head that lasted forever, minimal lacing, and very active carbonation.  Aroma is big apple and pear upfront followed by notes of honey, caramel, slight funky yeast, and grass.  Taste is more malty than expected with apple and plum evident, hints of citrus, honey, and yeast.  Enjoyable crisp finish with flavors lingering.  Nice saison, but disappointing given the rating history and my high expectations.

Bottle from 16 Tons, Eugene. Pours a slightly cloudy orangeish copper color, with a medium head and slight lacing. Aroma is slightly spicy and funky. Medium body, taste is very big, lots of ester and yeast notes. Really interesting; finish is very complex with hops barely there at the end. Not an everyday beer, but impressive nonetheless.
Mild citrus and grains aroma. Stable thick head. Very balanced sweet and grains aroma. Powdery yet somewhat silky texture.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2014 Draft at Monks. Hazy gold pour with a huge fluffy white head. Lots of amber fruits on the nose. Apricot. Peach fuzz. Honeycomb. Tangerine peel. Candied ginger. Orange seeds. Thyme. Lemongrass. Tons of delicate notes with a sprinkle of brown sugar. Nice medium body. Dry floral finish. Very impressed. Have had in past years but the current 2012 here is spectacular! UPDATE: The 2014 version is at least as spectacular!

Poured darker than I expected with the usual big pillowy saison head, spicy sweet honey nose possibly with a small amount of funk getting in there. Good mouthfeel, alcohol was well hidden under a malty sweet honey body. Surprisingly people who usually dislike more mainstream saisons loved this. I even got told to buy some more by herself. Score! Nice one Dupont.
2011 version on tap at the Kulminator.  Hazy, golden colored pour with medium sized head.  Yeasty, citrusy aroma with a grassy, slightly bitter finish.  Not too bad.
Pours cloudy golden in colour with a whitehead.Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, fruity and yeast, Excellent saison.

On tap at Moeder Fontainas. Slightly nervous anticipation here, knowing it had a high reputation on this site. I neednt have worried. The aroma is glorious, sweet and perfumy. The taste follows this on, very complex with nice malt, the extra dimension of the yeast and a floral bitter hop finish. I dont give many beers a 4+ rating but this one makes it, fantastic.

2009 bottle from Wine Warehouse, Charlottesville. Pours a hazy orange color with a large frothy white head. Decent head retention. Aroma of pale malts, caramel, toasted notes, stone fruits, herbal notes and a bit of spice. The taste is caramel malts, toasted malts, spice, mustard even, some stone fruits, particularly plum. Medium bodied. Nice beer.

Bouteille 375 ml. Une robe ambré quasi opaque avec un collet blanc persistant. Arome: agrumes (citron, pamplemousse) et levures. Au goût, bonne amertume fournie par les agrumes. Bon équilibre. Cette bière est une excellente représentante du style saison, lune des meilleures que jai bues jusquà maintenant!
A good fruity flavor with good bitterness. Dark amber in color with a white head.

Bottle from Stichley Wines; pours a burnt yellow with white frothy head, slight cheese rind in the aroma. Grassy yeasty taste with a slight hint of honey. Small amount of sour funkiness, easy drinking high ABV that doesnt appear in the taste.

Bottle from 2006.  Pours beautifully,  Orangey/ambe with big dense white head.  Aroma is a bit musty but also with some sweet notes as well.  Alcohol present in the flavor but this highlights the light spiced flavor.  Carbonation is low so this coats the tongue comfortably.   A bit of earthiness in this as expected.   I think this is right on for a holiday saison.   Really nice. Wish I had more.

Cork exploded!  Pours a hazy golden/honey color with a huge foamy white head...outstanding retention and lacing.  Aroma has delicate hoppy spice, leather, faint honey.  Flavor follows suit...such delicate balance of flavors...near perfect...just a hint of fruitiness...raisin as it warms.  Mouthfeel is medium and the finish is spicy/fruity/leathery and dry.  Excellent saison.

Bottle 75 cl. Pours cloudy golden in colour with a whitish head. Yeasty and fruity in aroma, lemon and hay with some peppery notes too. Taste is similar to aroma, also some bready malt and earth in flavour comes to mind. Nice.

Cloudy yellow golden pour lots of whispy frothy white head and light sticky lacing ... aroma of fruity yeast, light grassy hops and citrusy (lemon) zest ... taste is lightly spicy and of fruity yeast, lemony zest and a light citrusy grassy hop bite ... mouthfeel makes this brew soft and smooth ... finishes smooth with light lingering bitterness .... a nicely balanced brew very drinkable with no trace of ABV at all

Bottle 375ml
Pours cloudy golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, fruity and yeast, Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long fruity and dry finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle at home from Drink Store, Dublin
Pours hazy light amber with pillowy whit head. Dry herbal hops and nutmeg alongside yeast esters. Prickly carbonation, earthy, bready, peppery, touch of bitterness, sweet malt aromatic spicy finish.
on draft @ bierhuyske. unintresting, borning even.. mediocer taste, looks,...
Fra flaske på ølbar i Brussel, nov-11: hva er vel bedre enn å nyte belgiske klassikere, omsorgsfullt skjenket på en dedikert ølbar?

August 30, 2012 bottle at BVerys tasting. Orangish yellow pour with lots of head.  The cork shot out like a bullet from this bottle.  Fruity and spice in the aroma and taste.  Very carbonated, which I dont usually like, but it worked for me with this one.

Poured from a corked bottle. Hazy, golden color. Smells of citrus, lemons, earthy. Taste is very smooth. Good saison, but not near the top.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
BOTTLE: Brown gold opaque pour. Coriander and other spices on the nose. Taste is malts, spice and coriander. Light sour taste. Great beer.

Skunky green bottle aroma dominates. Smells like a European pilsner.  Gold with floaters and a retained slight head. Aroma is now more funky with the same influence. Taste is fruity pineapple aroma reflects now as wheel with the end of the bottle in giving ample head. This is an amazing Saison I just wish I got it from a store with no windows.  Green bottle farmhouse.

750 mL bottle--2011 on cork.  Pours a cloudy yellow-orange with a large amount of thick white head (several inches) that has good retention.  Aroma is pretty subdued; mostly yeast and coriander but also some earthy spiciness.  Flavor is mostly of spice, yeast, coriander, and some malts; not overly complex but enjoyable for the funky spiciness.  The finish has a hint of some alcohol and some bitterness.  Seemed to enjoy it the more I drank.  Solid and enjoyable beer but not something I would actively seek out.

color oro chiaro velato con enorme schiuma bianca fine e di buona persistenza.aroma dolce di malto ,frutta sotto spirito e lievito.in bocca il grado alcolico si fa sentire subito (forse un po troppo) ma la birra è molto equilibrata.dolce e maltata speziata miele frutta sotto spirito.carbonazione media.retrogusto ancora caldo alcolico .me la ricordavo un po piu luppolata nel finale

Bottle. Pours hazy bright yellow amber color with a fairly large foamy white head that dissipates to a foamy film. Aroma is funky lemon farmhouse with noticeable yeast and sugars. Taste is funk and lemon zest with yeast and some bitter hops and sharp cheese and pepper. Palate is dry and slick. Very nice!

Hazy yellow pour with a huge fluffy white head. Aroma is amazing. Spicy and earthy with some citrus notes and a hint of funk. Peppery and intense. Flavor is similar but toned down. Peppery notes and some light cities. Mouthfeel is smooth and soft. This beer is pretty amazing.

What a saison!!! Pours a bright orangish golden in colour with a huge soapy white head that lowers slowly. The nose is incredible with a fresh, zesty citrus hop and yeast note. A bit of a sour ale like note with a big in your face yeast ester based blammmyy! The taste has a beautiful floral and zesty citrus flavor. Great estery and yeast based fruit and peppery spice. The finish is dry and lingers on with a bit of bitterness and pepper malt spice. Overall, simply fantastic.

Corked and caged bottle. Hazy golden with a sustainable white head, great lacing. Nose is booze, hay, slight barnyard, yeast. Taste is bread, real yeasty, fruit and spices in the hops, fresh mineral water and walnut stays on the palate after the hops.

750ml bottle from beerman6686, thanks 
Appearance: Pours clear golden with a big frothy white head and lots of lacing 
Aroma: Sweet malts, yeasty, citrus and earthy 
Taste: Fruity, yeast, bready with a lemon zest finish, dry 
Very good, this is smooth and tasty

A: The beer is a yellow / orange hue and rather hazy. Barely detectable through the haze, I can see pockets of bubbles rising to the surface. The head is a gargantuan cumulus cloud that consumes the top half of the tulip glass, leaving copious amounts of sticky lacing throughout the glass.

S: Citrus and yeast are the dominant scents, with additional notes of spices, grass, lemon zest, and alcohol.

T: The flavor is very pleasant, with everything balanced quite well. Initially, the beer is so smooth on the palate, its a bit surprising. A touch of heat from the alcohol offers a bit of oomph in the finish, but I dont find it unpleasant. The abv is pushing double digits, after all. Citrus comes through prominently, but the yeast character is far more present in the aroma than in the flavor.

M: Medium-full bodied with an alcohol presence in the finish. The alcoholic presence gains a little speed as I delve deeper into the bottle. Avec Les Bon Voeux has a lingering aftertaste of citrus fruits and grass soaked in alcohol.

D: A terrific saison from a great brewery. Recommended.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-18-2011

White head. Hazy, light yellow color. Aroma cirus, hay. Taste some sour, citrus, bitter. Palate dry, CO2, bitter. Overall my favorite beer for New Year?s eve, IMHO better than champagne.

Tasted on 12/26/11 from a corked and caged 750mL bottle, big thanks to whoever shared this at the tasting.  Pours hazy yellow-orange with a thick white head that leaves thick lacing.  The nose is lightly sweet cereal and bread malt with spicy yeast, and some grassy, green hops aroma.  The flavor is just as expected given the nose, with the malty cereal and bread up front, moving to the spicy yeast with grassy, nicely bitter hops.  The body is medium with average, stinging carbonation, and a long bread, cereal, bitter, and spicy finish.

Poured from a 750ml bottle thanks to Jason. The aroma is of sweet malts, fruitiness, earthy. The flavor is far more complex, filled with fruits, malts,a solid tartness, woody, earthy. Great beer. Thanks Jason.

75cl bottle shared before Tuska Open Air Festival, Helsinki. Poured hazy orange with a frothy, lasting white head. Aroma has yeast, spices, fruits, earth. Flavor has oranges, apricot, spices. Finishes dry. High drinkability.

Bottle sampled at Breugems.  Pours a hazy yellow orange with a white head.  Aroma of light sharp fruit with some caramel.  Flavour is medium sweet, light bitter and a warm alcohol finish.  Medium bodies with soft carbonation.

35cl bottle at breugems brewpub.
Thin white head.  Cloudy blond pour.  Smooth refreshing saison.
Medium head with yellow-orange and cloudy appearance. Aroma of alcohol, sweetness, fruit, spices. Fruity taste with bitterness  yeasty, dry ending but the bitterness remains. Quality saison.

If the Dupont Saison is the standard by which all others are measured, this raises the bar.  Everything you like in their flagship is doubled, or so it seems.  The only place this falls short (if you can even refer to it that way) is that is loses some of the crisp, dry beauty of the classic.  Its almost like an imperial saison but please dont call it that or recommend that as a style.

750ml--> snifter.  Pours cloudy yellow with thick frothy head.  Aroma of faint alcohol,bread, and champagne.  Has a great bready taste with a hint of citrus in the aftertaste.  Tastes pretty much exactly as it smells.  Verry nicely carbonated and balanced palate.  Very nice beer.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2013 aroma: floral, alcohol, caramel, bread, 
apparenza: amber, sparkling, frothy, 
gusto: medium sweetness, 
palato: full body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, 
ECCEZZIONALE! aroma perfetto,floreale con sentori di alcool abbastanza pronunciati ma comunque ben bilanciati alla luppolatura..per quanto riguarda il gusto,dopo un primo assaggio in cui predominava lalcool forse troppo eccessivamente, la bocca si è abituata e quando ho mandato giù lultimo sorso avrei voluto averne 100 in più! è esattamente come piace a me,malto e luppolatura bilanciati con sentori floreali unici e unaroma inconfondibile,schiuma abbondante e cremosa e 9,5 gradi di felicità!promossa a pieni voti!

versione invecchiata un anno,assaggiata alla spina al delirium cafè di bruxelles...non credo di dover aggiungere altro!!!!
The head is medium, the body yellow-orange and cloudy. It smells sweet-sour, fruity-citrus. The taste is sweet a bit sour, fruity, yeasty CO². Interesting flavour, good! 11/12/10/10/10/11

On tap at whole foods; big juicy nose very aromatic. Cloudy yellow small head. Taste is very fruity and nice, good body and clean finish. Good beer! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours pale golden straw. Small head retains well. Citrus on the nose. Floral bitter hop flavor. Mild carbonation. Delicious. Served on bottle at nuetnigenough in Brussels.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From notes: Poured hazy straw color with a huge, pillowy white head.  Aroma was strongly earthy with yeast funk and mild lemon.  Body light, medium thickness.  Slight dryness to the finish.  Flavors are light- grassy and earthy yeast with a touch of lemon in the finish.  A nice change from other holiday releases.  Very drinkable.

750 ml caged and corked bottle, 2011 printed on the cork.  Served in a Unibroue tulip, the beer pours a cloudy gold color with a couple inch frothy off-white head.  Head retention is excellent, and theres a decent amount of lacing.  Aroma is fruity and yeasty, it smells like apricots, lemon peel, hay, peppery spice and some banana.  Taste is similar to the aroma, the brew tastes like hay, peppery spice, lemon and orange peel, pears, earth and some bready malt.  Theres more bitterness in this brew than I was expecting.  Mouthfeel/body is medium, its a bit slick and creamy, and is very well carbonated.  The 9.5% ABV isnt very noticeable at all.  I liked this brew, Id recommend this one to others.  $11.49 a bottle.
En botella.Color cobre con muy buena espuma,sin filtrar.Aromas a lupulo,levadura.....Buena y contundente
fruity banana nose. nice prickly carbonation and incredible rich zesty taste make this a very awesome and easy to drink brewsky.  great example as it is very complex. awesome, awesome.
Riktigt fin tripel. Avnjöts under Köpenhamns ölfestival 2012. Jag dricker den gärna igen.
37.5cl  bottle. Pours hazy pale golden with a white head. Good carbonation. Citrus sourness,yeasty aroma, lot of coriander. Smooth, fruity and astrigent nice finish. Good
Aroma of grains and banana. Yellow colour with frothy white head. Taste is grains, grapes. Very lively palate. A great saison.

Refrigerated 75 cl green bottle poured into a trappist glass.  Pours hazy pale golden with bright white head.  Some big bubble lacing, light body, suspended yeast, well carbonated, and citrus aroma.  Taste is estery ( mostly citrus), yeast, hint of skunk (lessens as it warms), and light bitter dry finish.  Great saison, alcohol well covered, but still expected a little more.

750ml bottle. Yeast, some fruity aromas. Pours hazy pale golden, whit thick and nice white head, quite presistent. Medium body, average carbonation. Tastes malty, some alcohol hints, and fruity. Quite dry, with average dry astrigent finish.

Appearance: hazy light pale straw
Aroma: white grape, not much else
Taste: high alcohol balances well with the malt and hops
Palate: Medium body, medium carbonation
Smell is lemon and belgian yeast; flavor is of lemon peel, bitter orange. Bitterness, acidity and just barely there alcohol are in great balance. Very drinkable.
LE top du top. Excellent équilibre entre lamertume et le houblon. Longueur en bouche extraordinaire. Arômes à tomber par terre
Dupont make good farmhouse beers. This is a good example. Nice yeasty aroma with a refreshing flavour. Enough said

37,5 cl bottle, pours dark golden with a nice big white head, aroma of fruit, grain and yeast, taste is fruit, malt and yeast, light drinkable with a smooth mouthfeel, alcohol well hidden, lovely overall beer.

Dec 2010: Each year (towards the end) the brewery starts to rack this beer into casks, normally it all goes into 0.75cl bottles.

Pilsner malt, made from twin-stemmed spring barley and hopped with Styrian and Kent Goldings.

Reviewed at the 16th Essen Christmas beer festival 2010.

Blond in colour, slight haze, good head.

Coriander, citrus sourness and a yeasty aroma make up the smells I got.

Semi-sour initial taste, then some sweetness before a dry bitterness as the palate settles and the mouth empties.

Very easy to drink (too easy!) and something Ill be having again, and again.

Man I love a good saison. There seem to be so few cats capable. This is the bees knees.
Aroma, pears, green apple, vanilla trace funkbarnhay. Yeah thats right all one word.
Taste is sweet on the tongue tart in the middle.
palate is so dry its like if evaporates from my tongue leaving me wanting another sip immediately.
Appearance is cloudy yellow witha  head like a damned fine merengue.
overall. Ive had a few better saisons but only a few. I would drink this like a fish drinks... uhhhh. what does a fish drink? damn fine ocean stew.
Slightly skunky bottle but it was a fantastic beer. Nicely floral with some ncie fruit notes.

Bottle at La Tireuse
Golden color, ok foam
Full body and high complexity
Very enjoyable

Bottle. Blonde with a big head.Slightly bitter with a subtle flavour that took time to grow on me. I had to check the bottle to see how strong it was. A deceptively strong beer that was so easy to drink.

Bottle 375 ml [2011]. Appearance: Pours clear golden with a huge frothy white head. Aroma: Spices, citrus, belgian yeast, malt, fruits (raisin?). Taste: Citrus, spices, alcohol, malt, orange peel. Long lasting aftertaste. Overall: Refreshing, complex and strong alcohol presence.

Bottle 375ml.
Pours crystal clear golden with huge frothy white head. Incredible lacing. Aroma is of citrus, spices and fruits. Taste is of citrus, malt, alchool. Bitter finish. Full bodied, well balanced. I would say a tad too heavy on the alchool (though kinda hidden) for a "saison".

Draft at Teresas Next Door. Pours golden with an inch of white foam. Big pineapple and mulled spice notes on the nose. Some floral hoppiness on the tongue but also a slight white wine vibe. Finishes clean. DuPont owns this style like Weihenstephaner owns Hefe.

25 mar 2012, tap. Yellow and hazy. Aroma is alcohol of a triple with faintest said on yeast. Med body and moderately fizzy. Sharp alcohol bite, sweet malt of a triple. The saison really gets dominated but it adds faint contributions occasionally.

Typical looking dupont saison  more of a hoppy aroma though. Flavor is very heavy on candy and pears and apircot flavors.  I know this is a good saison but its too sweet and not dry enough for my liking
Birra particolare, corre lungo il filo dellagrumato acidulo, note speziate ed erbacee. intrigante, bevibile, anche troppo visti i 9,5°.

This probably near the lightest colored 9.5% abv beer I have seen. Great lacing from the nice white head.  The aroma is excellent. Notes some barnyard dustiness mix with some citrus and a bit of spice.  The flavor is the best of any Saison I have ever had. I get a bit of candied fruit/pineapple, mild spice, and a bit of tartness. Really really good.

29/11/2011 375ml bottle. Dorata intensa, con riflessi arancia, abbastanza limpida, bel cappello di schiuma morbida, pannosa, bianca, molto persistente. Spettacolare aroma di una complessità difficile da descrivere. Malto, lieviti, spezie, una nota fruttata, miele. In bocca è complessa, dolciastra, maltata, con finale leggermente amarognolo. Molto morbida, ha una struttura notevole ma si lascia bere come poche altre birre. I nove gradi e mezzo non si sentono. Saison da applausi, capolavoro inarrivabile.

One of the greatest saisons, actually greatest beers Ive tried. Barnyard and yeast on the nose. Cloudy gold with a fluffy white head. Layers and waves of citrus and grains are relentless on the palate. Long peachy finish.

One of my favorites since ages, so I might be a bit biased, but Ive found that even in these times of extreme beers this still stands out.
Edition 2011. Beautiful golden color, slightly hazy. White head with retention till the end and some lace. Aromas: Sweet & sour fruit, citrus, grassy. Flavor is lightly sweet, medium bitter, with a little acidity. Medium bodied. Spicy & peppery finish, medium bitter. Simply wonderful.
UPDATED: MAR 21, 2012 Emana odore di cuoio manco fosse una borsetta.  Citrica con un sentore di mentuccia, abbastanza speziata. Buona
Fresh got an aged also to rerate. Goodness coloured beer with a kic foamy head. Good hoppy, light spiced beer. Decent.

Appearance:  cloudy, creamy orange-gold, with a big fluffy white head.   Aroma:   spiced barnyard funk, with lots of slightly musty fruit.  Taste: honey, pears, crushed black peppercorns, toasted white bread.   Finish: crisp, tangy, bready, slightly sweet.   Notes: Great saison.  Flavors much like the traditional Saison Dupont, but richer and spicier.
Unbelievable. Had the III in bottle, slightly aged. Easily the best saison Ive had to date. Complex, yet incredibly subtle. Not as bright or Spicy as many saisons Ive had.

Hazy, burnt gold with big, foamy, fine-bubbled, white head / Musty, medicinal, nose of fermented tree fruit, grass, and herb / Medium body, fat and oily, resinous, with some acidity and mostly dry, good balance, and lightly bitter finish / Elegant, potent, cooked, flavors of straw, pear, passion fruit, soap, honey, resin, black pepper, and coriander / Flavors could be brighter?, possibly my bias, but an excellent brew.

Poured into a tulip.  Theres a lot of carbonation in this one.  I needed several pours to get a full glass.

4.0 A:  Lightly hazed golden wheat color.  Three fingers of frothy/foamy white head.  Retention is good and a lot of the foam sticks to the glass.

4.5 S:  Smells a good bit like autumn.  Lots of barnyard funk, rich with pollen, hay, and livestock.  Underneath there is pepper, clove, and corriander spiciness.  A garden of flowers in this while being moderately herbal.  Very complex and well integrated. 

3.0 T:  The taste is good, but not nearly as impressive as the nose.  Surprisingly strong oregano-like bitterness.  Not nearly as flowery as the nose, but about as herbal.  Corriander still stands out, but less pepper and clove.  Hay is back as is quite strong.  Dry even for a saison.  Bitterness lingers into the aftertaste.

3.0 M:  Lighter body.  Carbonation is a bit too abundant.  Mildly creamy.

3.0 D:  If this tasted like the nose, I would certainly be impressed.  Its still a good beer, but it isnt the standout I was expecting.

Pivovarsky Klub, Prága. Opálos világító arany színe van, közepes méretű fehér habja pedig tömör és nagyon kitartó. Illata malátás és gyümölcsös, méghozzá egyszerre savanykásan és édesen, alma és körte, illetve citrusfélék egyszerre bontakoznak ki, melyekhez pikáns fűszeresség társul. Ízében erősebb a malátás íz, utóíze pedig már egészen kenyeres is, továbbá kevés virágméz is érződik, egyébként az illatából ismerős gyümölcsös-fűszeres ízek vannak előtérben, a komló csak éppen feltűnik, összetéveszthetetlenül belga ale. Pezsgősen szénsavas, testes és kellemesen száraz, valamint a komolyabb mennyiségű alkohol is szépen rejtve van. Nagyon finom szezonális különlegesség, minden korty élmény volt.
In una serata fredda non è niente male, riscalda al punto giusto questa birra senza dubbio ben fatta....da riprovare con più calma

Bottle at CP&K. It pours cloudy light orange, with a large, long-lasting white head. The nose is full of tangy fruit - orange, kiwi, white grape, melon and pear, as well as farmyard and spice. The taste is farmyard, spice, tart orange, citrus peel, tangerine, mango, bread and some alcohol warmth, with a long-dry finish. Medium body, moderate carbonation and foamy mouth-feel. Well balanced and well made.

On draft at Sharp Edge Brasserie. Poured hazy gold with some splotches of white lace. Sweet nose.  Flavor of pears, sweet candi sugar, yeast.  Somewhat of a spicy, peppery dry finish. Some subtle warming alcohol present. Bomb ass shit!
bière forte et douce riche en houblon, bonne bière de destruction massive parfaite pour les hiver vigoureux

A great Christmas ale from Dupont Brewery (God bless you).
The colour is a golden yellow with a generous and persistent white head. 
Flavouring is complex with honey, candied fruits and spices.
Taste is charming defined by honey again, fruits in alcohol and pepper. 
Aftertaste is warm and fruity.
The beer anyway is dry and encourages to have a second sip.

Pour is golden and transparent. Big head. Nose is citrus and spice. Also smell high phenols. Flavor sweet with enough bitter to carry through to the finish. Mouthfeel is smooth, creamy and aftertaste is wonderful. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
