Pours a thin fizzy pale gold. Nose and taste are of hay, tart fruits maybe lemon, grass. Very dry and crisp with a tart finish. A solid beer, but I prefer the regular Saison by Du Pont to this holiday version. That being said Im glad I tried this and if I could get more into the tartness I might have enjoyed this beer more. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
The best beer!!! Non ce nessunaltra birra che la eguaglia! Gusto aroma e presentazione ai massimi livelli!!!

I am drinking this as I am typing. Instantly after un-corking and pouring you cant help but notice the aroma rising up to your nose. The aroma is slightly prickly with a big blend of peach, apple, hops and a very light rum note too. The sight of the beer after pouring is stunning! A thick set white head with beautiful retention, soft and smooth looking. Sitting underneath the foamy head is a lovely golden-brown brew with a classic unfiltered murkiness. The taste of this beer is the real showpiece, its full of floral hops, Belgian yeast, malt and that classic Dupont edge that makes their brews so unique. The beer then slows into a pleasant lasting aftertaste of apples, pears and floral summery hops. Also the alcohol is well masked in the Bons Voeux which makes it very surprising. Great carbonation and feel on the tongue and mouth as a whole.
Absolutely astounding beer which I have enjoyed a good few bottles of in the past and I hope to continue drinking this brilliant brew from Dupont. Highly recommended!

Bottle 37.5 cl @ Karhisma Birroteca (Piedimonte Matese - Caserta, Italy) and on tap @ Ma che siete venuti a fa (Rome, Italy). Heavy intense orange/golden, just like the abundant and frothy foam that of an ice cream. Something yellow and beige in the color. Full aroma of grapes, spices, peach, apricot, hay...! Body medium to full, highly carbonated where spice, country and rural flavors dominates the scene. Thats the saison spirit, close your eyes and imagine a tractor intent on crop rotation. Wheels and rumors as well, of course. Alcohol is very well hidden, great elegance, slow and thin finish that grown and last long on tongue surface like a white wine. I think Id rather have the tap version, much drinkable, in which body strikes literaly due to much more cohesion; maybe tap deserve 4.0 or 4.1 (+0.1 taste/palate).
Very very fruity aroma and taste. Pears, mint. Low acidity. Body is thin but you dont feel alcohol at all. This is actually really fresh. Great look.

Orange hay color with lots of lace and a big long-lasting head.  Wheat, caramel, and light spice are intermingled with an alcohol-warming, bubbly carbonation bittering.  A solid, well-crafted brew from start to finish.
On draft at Issac;s. Simply fantastic, Hazy bronze pour with aromas of sour fruit, belgian spice and bread. A mild alcohol, bread rich taste that finishes mildy sour. A good blend. Very Good.
A: yeast, orange, hops, spices A: pale orange/dark yellow T: fine, intense, orange, hops and yests. P: mb: O: 19/20
Da qualche parte lessi il commento definitivo sulla bons voeux che sposo in pieno: "la solita birra fatta da alieni con capacità superiori a noi umani".
This is a top class beer! Packed with spicy aroma and tastes of apples, citrus and belgian yeast. It hides the alcohol really well.

This poured a slightly cloudy golden yellow color with a white head. Aroma was lots of grass and skunk, some light spices and yeast.  Flavor was light funk, spices, lots of grassy/herbal hops, and some fruity notes as well. Very nice saison.

Tulil.Looks hazy  tall head and bright gold color. Smells of tangering peel white sugar.The taste is yeasty and very grasy, this may be wierd but this beer to me taste like a color crayons. Overall,the mouthfeel is fantasti and nice carbonation
Golden color with a fluffy white head. Smells like dust , hay, honey, and some sour.....something. Great flavor, and just the right amount of alcohol. Yum.

2011 bottle - Pours hazy amber with a light tan head. Lightly skunked on the nose, with floral hops and herbal notes. White pepper? Cardamom? Mint? All sorts of stuff hanging out there on the nose. Tastes of dry crackery malt--pretty astringent--thats a little sweeter than the nose. Apricots, herbal hops, light spicing, and that really aggressive astringency. Nicely carbonated and resinous. very disappointed in this one. I love the regular Dupont Saison, and this is supposed to be better--but this one is just so harsh.
bottle, vintage 2010, from Bierkompass. Hazy golden colour, mid-sized, persistent white head. Fruity nose. Grainy malt flavours, spicy, floral hints, pleasantly hoppy. Smooth palate.

Quasi non sembra una birra natalizia. Schiuma compatta e persistente, colore velato e leggermente torbido. Aroma fine ed equilibrato. Birra dal sapore non troppo ricercato e dalla facile beva nonostante la gradazione elevata.

750mL bottle at a beer gathering.  Pours a lightly hazy gold with a huge cap of bright white head.  Aroma is lightly fruity and sweet, very subtle.  Flavor is sharply acidic, much like white grape juice (bordering on becoming white wine)...very crisp, clean, and sharp at the finish.  Very active carbonation.

Buona birra stagionale, di gusto simile ad una tripel. Allaspetto compare una abbondante schiuma bianca che persiste per quasi tutta la durata della bevuta. Lelevato tenore alcolico è nascosto davvero molto bene. Ma nulla di eccezionale.
birra color oro tendente allarancio, robusta, complessa e al contempo beverina, una birra davvero molto equilibrata, principalmente si sente un gusto dolce che si avvicina leggermente al miele

37.5 cl bottle, Sheffield, UK via Beer Ritz Leeds. 2009 Vintage according to cork. Bright gold, spotty active head. Musty caramel yeast and hop aroma. Sweet honey and clove emerging as it warms, some nuttiness and lemon zest as well. Almost pure cloves on the first sip, more honey and vanilla, then a long earthy finish. Great, massive flavour but not overpowering.

bottle-2006 vintage-wow!  pours lightly hazy orange with lots of carbonation with a small fizzy white head.  nose is dusty, barnyard, funk, lemon esters, paint thiner, moldy basement, earthy/dirty yeast, and some white grapes. flavors are more along the lines of a lightly funky trippel that has been aged-fruit, dusty esters, earthy yeast, with some lite bitterness and very lite alcohol.  body is lush with moderate carbonation.  This is one wild beer.  lots of funk that has developed into a very dusty beer.  with that said, this beer is definately not past prime, even being 5 yrs old. I bet its pretty great fresh as well.  This is the highest rated beer of this style, but maybe its my biased palate but im really into american renditions of this style.  With that said, i can see where this is the highest rated beer of this style.  a splash of spice comes long into the finish which continues with the dusty/funky notes.  a very good saison, but not my favorate.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2013 Bottle recommended by Nate in Craft Beer Co. Pours hazy amber with huge white head. Nose is earthy, yeasty, bready. Theres a white wine grapiness and yeastiness. Like Saison Dupont it has sugary meringue flavour but more restrained and bigger earthiness. Also has a white wine dryness.

Re-rate 30/8/13 - tasting a 750cl bottle at home. Such a fine, refined beer. Colour is rich and golden, big fluffy white head, nose is aromatic, rich malt grainy, sweet, farmyard, funky, crisp saison yeast. But theres a richness here that goes beyond a saison. Alcoholic, fruity, grainy, like a tripel. Updated from a 3.9 to a 4.1.

Re-rate 20/12/13. Everything I try this beer I  reminded of the fact that Brasserie  Dupont are master brewers and that I am very likely underrating it. This time Im getting orange peel , apricot, toffee in the nose, and spice, orange peel, apricot, stewed peach burnt sugar, toffee on the taste. Fantastic beer. 4.1 to 4.4. Hugely underrated beer.
750 ml bottle pours a cloudy yellow color with a nice white head.  Aromas of bready malt, light citurs, spice.  Medium bodied, with several layers, alcohol is well hidden.  Excellent.

2.011 bottle served in a large tulip. Glorious light hazy golden yellow with a huge white head atop champagne bubbles. Excellent retention and fluffy lacing. Big yeasty, citrusy, and grassy hop aroma. Prickly carbonated attack and a mildly sweet flavor. Light body, yeasty sticky texture, and a long dry finish. This is spectacular stuff!
(Bottle 19 /12-2011) very large white head, slightly unclear yellow, yeast aroma, medium co2, smooth spicy taste. BB date September 2015.

Pours hazy light amber with visible streams of effervescence, rocky head, pretty lacing, and great retention.  Aroma is lemon peel, spices, light barnyard hay, orange peel, banana and bubblegum come out as it warms.  Taste is orange peel, fresh cut granny smith apples, some bready grain, lemon peel, hay , caramel, warming throat sensations, spicy, very clean overall.  Body is medium, super explodingly frothy, effervescent, spicy warming finish.  Overall, this is a fantastic saison that betrays none of the 9.5%abv, perfect for colder weather but still reminds you of the dog days of summer.

375ml bottle. Hazy yellow with a little white hide. Nose : Little aromas : bread malts, citrus and some other dried exotic fruit notes. Yeast and typical pale ale spices. Sip : oily to creamy with a decent carbonation. Little sour clove with little bitter hops. Background with spices and fruits. Aftertaste is sour. Overall : The alcohol is really well hidden. Wow ! Its still a refreshing beer !

750 ml bottle bought @ Bierkompass.de and consumed on December 15. Pours golden with a big fizzy white head that dissipates rather quickly leaving some trace on the glass. Smell is rather sweet with farmyard notes, hay, peaches, plums, coriander and allspice. Taste is bitter and sweet with allspice, cloves, black pepper, coriander, orange zest, lemon zest, grass, hay, plums, mild strawberriesand some funk. Finish is dry and bitter.

On tap at Blue Monk 
Aroma earthy with hint of citrus, alcohol, yeasty , hint of dust and citrus.
 Appearance  hazed amber look with medium top. White lace with good density. 4- 
Flavor and Palate : Traditional approach. Earthy notes. Sweet fruity touches followed by dryness of alcohol. Finish with orange peel. Solid but one of best?

Bottle at Appellation Wines we wish you a hoppy Christmas tasting. Pours a slightly hazy, light golden colour with a thick white head that dies down a little. Aroma is just faintly smoky with beautiful musty honey, oranges, rosemary, herbs and grassy notes. Similar flavours. Quite grassy with alcohol fairly upfront. Quite a dry finish with a Greek yoghurt type sourness. Lovely.

Draught taste.  Covering lacing is fast under no or fast-dissolving head over a pilsner body.  Aroma is tart, sour fruit including citrus, corriander and other spice, and bubblegum -> all a bomb in your face, though there are some bready notes.  Taste is only mildly sweet with a creamy palate and soft, long, sweet finish.  Overall delicious and not vinuous.
Extremely winey.  Pours a nice smooth yellow with head, but looks and tastes  more like a wine than a beer.

Poured a hazy yellow-orange color with a large white stable head.  Aroma is fruity with spices and lemons.  Some slight tartness and yeast aromas as well.  Taste is fruity with oranges and lemons.  Very nice yeast flavors mix well with the slightly floral hops.  Alcohol is very well hidden.  The spices add a good amount of complexity.  Overall a very nice saison.

(75 cl)  Une longue crinière impeccablement blanche.  Une robe blonde traversée par de fines particules.  Une dentelle qui rappelle les plus belles pièces de Bruges.  Un nez de délicates fleurs de houblons avec des fruits moelleux.   Des parfums subtils de blé et dépices avec des vapeurs bleues de Franchimont.  Des saveurs qui partent de la mer du Nord, tout près dOstende, et qui viennent séchouer dans la campagne de Tourpes, parmi les mille délices du terroir de la Wallonie.  Une bouche confortable - justement piquée par des bulles vivantes - au caractère velouté.  Une finale savoureuse qui porte lespoir de léternel recommencement.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2015 A personal favorite, this rating is for the 2011 vintage. Pours hazy and golden, with good head retention and persistent lacing. This is good beer and you know it from the first sight. It smells like wet hay, definitively what you would call a farmhouse aroma. The taste is quite spicy with no discernible alcohol. I keep coming back so I can see why it was an exclusive brew for their best clients at first.  Its highly recommended to seek this beer and I personally get a case at least once a year, its really that good!

Vintages Ive had so far: 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013.
Golden colour with a very lively white head and bubbly carbonation. Malt, wheat spicy flavour. Skunk malt lager aroma. Full of flavour yet has a metallic spicy finish.

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2012 Re-rating - cant believe my last rating, this beer is hugely tasty, but hugely balanced.  
Previous rating 27/11/11 7+4+6+3+13=3.3
375ml bottle. Pours a hazy golden-orange with a nice sized head. The nose has a tangy orange note with perhaps apricots. The taste has a big tangy orange pith note with a dried grass undercurrent on the end. The palate has a big but very tight and locked in structure, the texture is very tangy and rich and there is a long dry bitter finish. Overall, this is very intriguing, though there is perhaps a lack of balance compared to this brewerys normal beer.

Draught at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Cloudy blond/orange colour with white frothy head which soon fades. Aroma is sweet, malty, toffee, caramel, bit boozy, and a bit vanilla creamy. Taste is beautifully smooth, vanilla, sweet with a slight bitterness. One of the greats. An absolute beauty.

Bottle 750ml from Parkhill cellars. Exceptional, yeast-driven. Aromas of caramel, cheese, apple, and orange. Taste is sweet and sour, with bitter notes, and long length. Palate is creamy, and full bodied. Orange, with a frothy head.
Dense, creamy head with ample carbonation.  A wonderfully rich, complex saison with great length.

Pours a cloudy golden orange with some floaties.  Smell is lemon zest, musty funk, skunkiness, some breadiness, the hops come through nicely and a tinge of alcohol.  Taste has a spicy funk to it with some lingering sweetness.  Breadiness and citrus also characters.  Complex but smooth.  Spicy but sweet.  Really nice and only better as it gets to that room temp.

Pour out of bottle is hazy yellowish orange, big foamy yet slightly lacing white head.  Carbed high, but fairly standard for the style.  Aroma brings notes of apricot, pear, some dusty basement, hints of sour lemon, spice, touch of biscuit, earthy notes in there as well.  Really nice aroma.  Taste is a mix of pear, biscuit, some funky earth and damp basement, some slight touch of lemon but the tartness is fairly absent in the taste.  Still a nicely done brew.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2013 Extreme carbonation! Fomay head over a hayish brownish colour. Rather opaque with clouds of yeast.
The smell is peppery alcoholic with alcoholic sweetness somewhat like dried peaches or orange peel with some leather. 
Bready and yeasty. It has an unexpected solid taste, almost like a tripel. Creamy silky with an alcoholic twang with hints of dried peaches and citricness.
A delicious and very subtle beer.

Whole Foods, P St, DC 750ml ($10): Pours a clouded yellow orange with a prodigious white head. Aroma is farmhouse all over the place. It reminds me of combining the aromatic intensity of 2-3 saisons pretty much. In a sense, it is a bit too intense, almost skunky. However, the spice and hops are there is all their character and force. The taste is exactly what anyone with an inkling of knowledge of this style would expect, except more so. The spiciness is intense and it lingers. The mouthfeel is pleasant, but sharp (almost like eating aged provolone). Sweetness is relegated to the furthest depths of this beer. A good, standard, but unique over-powered saison.
2008 bottle. Dark orange body with a white head. Nice yeasty flavour with cereal, brown sugar, caramel, orange. Very nice refreshing palate. Great dry bittersweet flavour with spices, cereal, banana.

Fresh citrus. Hazy golden with a large light brown slow head. Typical saison sour with a bit of salt and slight sweetness. Medium body, almost creamy texture. Lively carbonation and long sour/bitter aftertaste. Not a bit saison fan, but its a nice beer in between.

Pour golden yellow with a big white head with great lace. Aroma peppery, spice, grassy notes, fruity, hay. Taste pepper, grass, fruity, spice, malt sweetness, peaches, nice bitterness, hay. MF medium body with light carb slightly dry. Overall a tasty saison nice spicy grassy notes wouldnt seek out to buy again but would drink if tap or shared.

White medium lasting head. Cloudy honey colour. Aroma is malty, fruity (green banana, apricots) with light yeasty, spicy and orange peel notes. Flavor is malty too with fruity (peach and ripe pear) tones, ending in a moderately bitter, hoppy finish. Medium to full bodied.

750ml corked Bottle.  Appearance is hazy, orangish-yellow color with lots of foamy, off-white head.  Aroma is malty, sweet, citrus, and yeast.  Taste is fruity and floral with strong citrus notes, on top of grain flavors.  Also a nice Belgian yeast presence.  Palate is medium-bodied, full mouth texture, lively carbonation, and a semi-dry finish.  Definitely a top-tier Belgian brew.

On tap at CafeeKe in Madrid. Murky pale golden with white head of good persistence and lacing. Aroma is malty, spicy, banana, citrus, floral hops and yeasty. Flavour is fruity, citrus, moderate sweet at the beginning with a final slightly bittery and dry. Carbonation is medium. Body is medium high.
Poured cloudy orange with a very fluffy white head that lasted.  Smelled of bread orange yeast and skunk.  Taste very light clean and pure. Amazing

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2012 Pours a hazy deep gold with a big fluffy eggshell colored head. Nose is very yeasty, barnyard, lemon zest and graininess. Flavor is herbal yeast, sweet grain, apples and a slight spice to it. Nice carbonation and a dry finish. Very tasty!

Tap @ Fairbar. Pours hazy dark yellow with a white head, beautifull. Aroma of yeast, fruit, peach, oranges, sweets, honey, straw / hay. Taste is yeast, peach, apples, straw, grapefruit, spices, sweets / honey. Medium body, soft carbonation, no sign of alcohol at all. Nice refreshing and easy drinking beer. 031111

37.5 cL bottle from ABS Drinks in Winksele poured into a Karmeliet glass at home.  A healthy bubbly head over a largely opaque orange beer.  A yeasy, acidic aroma, with a bit of corned beef.  Sweet and sour with yeasty depth, pretty good and ends slightly bitter.  Good and enjoyable change from the norm, but not Karmeliet Tripel.

On tap. Had the 09, 10 and 11. notes from the 10. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet orange, peach, green apples, yeasty, leather, light banana, some barnyard, straw and citrusy notes. Taste is hops, peach, dryness, apples, citrusy, some sugary belgian sweetness is coming through and just a weak note of the alcohol.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2011 on tap a tasting of vintages 09 and 11. Appearance. cloudy yellow, with a frothy white head. aroma: light acidic, green apples, pear, gooseberries, wheat, yeast, light banana, light cloves, white bread, weak plum, dry and fizzy mouthfeel, lovely tartness, dustiness,  taste of raisins, pear, yeast, peppery, spiced, dry, light banana, glue, but in a good way, apples, light boozy, By far I prefer the ¨09 vintage. the ¨11 version has more banana, cloves, more yeast, not as tart and acidic, has more wheat, is crisp, more fruit, some pepper and some sweetness. they are both very complex and refreshing. very true to the style.
light sour fruit aroma,amber, hazy, white foam, lightly sour, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, soft carbonation, sour finish.

Great beer, thanks to HenrikS.  Light orange coloured and unclear. Has a great hoppy aroma, herbs, grass, moderate malty notes too, but its the grassy hoppy notes thats great. Flavor starts mderate sweet and finish heavy bitter. More grass, hay. Dry, creamy texture.
On tap at Zenos. Hazy gold/orange with quarter inch white head. Aroma is funk. Flavor is straw, spices, tart, and funk. Very nice saison.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2012 Cuvee 1995. Lost some of its saison character with age, but still a very nice brew.
Golden colour, disappearing white head. Aroma of madeira, raisins, somewhat sweet. Flavour somewhat sweet, light malts, some cellar. Body became rather thin with age.
(From 75cL bottle @ DRBM, courtesy of Potjebier 8-4-6-3-15)

Update (1-8-2012): Fresh bottle -2011-
Clear light orange golden colour, white head. Aroma of malts, bread, apricot, pear, citrus, quite spicy and floral. Light earth tones. Light bitter flavour, citrus peel, sweet malts, very fruity. Fresh. Fruity finish, apricot and pear, some candied fruit. Spicy. Well hidden ABV.
One of the great beers.
(From 75 cL bottle @ home 9-4-8-5-18)

Bouteille de 750ml. Bouchon de liège. Dorée avec une épaisse mousse blanche. Le nez est bien avec du houblon et des fleurs blanches. La bouche est dans le même registre, fleurs blanches, houblon, elle pique la langue. Cette bière a une superbe amertume en fin de bouche qui rend ce produit digeste. Lalcool est bien dissimulé.

375 ml bottle.
Cloudy pale straw, white hd.
Spicy, yeasty aroma, wheat, malt, hops, citrus, 
Dry, med bod, med bit, livekly CO2.
Spicy taste, hops, yeast, malt, dried fruits.
Finishes a bit too alcoholic. (2011-10-09)

En 9,5% Saison som stilmässigt drar åt trippel hållet. Tre år gammal men fortfarande två år kvar till bäst före datumets utgång. Gyllenfärgad klar vätska med bottensats. Ingen stor doft, lite jäst och söta äpplen. Smaken är desto kraftigare. De 9,5% ger kraft utan att alkoholen känns alls. Stor munkänslan, bra balans och mycket smak av jäst, torkade äpplen, fruktkaka med citrusskal, eldigt kryddig, lätt syrlig och allt i perfekt harmoni. Jättegod!

75 cl bottle vintage 2009 @ home, BBE 09/2014.
Aroma is strong and pleasant with wheat, spices and yeast. Actually very typical saison aroma without any flaws. Flavour has wheat, yeast and spices. Also some alcohol in the finish. Foamy, but smooth palate. Adding the yeast makes this rather stale. One of the best saisons Ive had.

750ml bottle from Beers of the World, Winton Plaza.  Looks like Heaven in a glass when poured.  Huge, rocky white head.  Cloudy, hazy orange in the glass.  Notes of citrus, barnyard and yeast in the nose.  Tastes amazing.  A little funky, spicy, barnyard.  Fucking awesome.  World class.
Poured cloudy and yellow.  Had a great Head.  Nice taste you would expect from a great Belgium.  Great mouthfeel, very easy to drink!

375ml bottle from lAutre Oeil. Golden, somewhat hazy, foamy and thick white head. Pretty , really. (4)
Aroma is flowers, apple, cereals, bread and some spices.
Taste is somewhat peppery, really malty with some doses of sweet candies, mint and citrus (and a lot of yeast). Terrific floral/herbal bitterness and plenty of tartness makes it the ideal sun guzzler or winter warmer... Seriously, Awesome.

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2013 Bouteille de 37,5cl. Couleur dorée pale, mousse honnète, laisse une collerette. Bon goût de céréale, puissante aromatiquement, magnifique amertume. Belle carbonnation, belle longueur en bouche, les 9,5% sont incroyablement bien masqués. Une superbe bière, à tous niveaux! Trouvée à Vanuxeem - Ploegstaert.

750 ml bottle from Premier Wine and Spirits (Halifax).  Pours a modestly cloudy yellow gold with fairly large, puffy white head and lots of floaties.  Aroma is citrus, apple, spices and flowers.  Taste is fruity and funky with lemon zest, fresh apple, pepper/spice and floral hops.  Fine carbonation; ABV very hidden.  Dangerously quaffable.
Bottle, pours a nice heady golden colour. little bit hazy. smell is spicy and yeasty. but it didnt have a terribly good blend of the mix but it was a good offering. But it was a bit disappointing.

On tap @ Kulminator so I had a tasting size. Slightly cloudy yellow with a significant white head. Aroma is lemon, yoghurt. Slightly creamy on the palate, taste is grain and malts with a touch of citrus.

Pillow and creamy head that holds for a while and has an orange -yellow cloudy colour. Aromas are filled with beligian esters, bread and toast, some lemon or citrus fruit and some floral hoppy notes. However I do get a  funk of sorts that I cant quite place. It is a full flavoured beer with lots of creamy yeasty/yummy notes that finishes slightly bitter and a hint of hops. I do get an upleasant metallic taste but overall a very good brew!
Bottle at Delerium Cafe in Brussels. Poured hazy yellow with medium head that retained. Flavour is mostly saison yeast with light grain and citrus.
Medium head that holds. Soury smell. Taste is watery, malty with some hops in the aftertaste.

DØE Festival, Valby, DK.
Tap, 270511.
Yellow with white head. Aroma of yeast and spices. Flavor with mix of fruit and malt

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2011 (750ml ,Corked) This  resides in a Trappist glass  a bold blond base with pillowy creamy head.. A  fragrant nose  dances in the air,  citrus fruit zest, flowers,peppers, green tart apples, herbal hops , earth, rich powerful malts ... the 9.5% booze festers in my mind and the unity with all these customary farmhouse notes is very cool .  Elegant drinking , its got a softness upfront , but the complex refreshment leads towards dry peppery texture,fruit zest(orange ,green apple) citrusy elements.  Herbal hops...maybe honeysuckle...a malt richness eatten by the Dupont yeast ,but its got a plesant rich tang.  Notes of iron, earth, mint and spice resonate . A flavoursome, complex and classy ale.
Bottle @ home. Yellow / orange color, large white head. Decent smell, nice taste, good carbonation and medium body. Better then expected, feared it would be winey but its more like a tripel.

750 ml bottle. Slightly hazy golden yellow with a long lasting, thick, dense, foamy, pure white head. Aroma of dusty oaky barnyard, lemon, sugar and herbal noble hops. The flavor is dry earthy yeast, light hop bitterness and a mild cracker malt presence. Light body with ample carbonation and a clean, dry mouth feel. This is an excellent Saison, very drinkable, the alcohol is barely noticeable and there is lots of funky yeast, hop and malt flavor. Great beer.

750ml bottle. Hazy golden pour with a big almost white head that leaves lots of lace. Big spicy notes with some bready character on the nose. Theres also a good level of almost-tropical fruit and a hint of funkiness. Wild complexity on the palate with layers of spice, fruit, funk and biscuit that seem to roll over each other. Finishes long and spicy.

750mL corked bottle.  poured carefully into goblet with lots of white, long lasting head, hazy light orange color, loads of carbonation and hops, leading to bitter aftertaste, but good yeast and spice notes up front.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2013 750 ml bottle. BBE 10/2015.
Pours a hazy yellow colour with a large, foamy head with good retention. Aroma of sweet tropical fruits, citrus and perfume. Flavour of sweet tropical fruits, some pale malts, citrus and alcohol. Smooth mouthfeel with a slightly burning, fruity, dry finish. Too much alcohol here.
Draught @ Delirium Cafe, Brussels in March 2013. 1 year old vintage.
Very fruity, almost white wine -like vinous notes on the nose. Flavour of mellow honey-like sweetness, some herbal notes, white wine and grass. Much better than from a bottle.

750ml bottle, shared
2010 bottle - Pours yellowish orange with a large foamy head. Aroma has notes of alcohol, spices, fruits and yeast. Taste is fruity with notes of malt, alcohol and spices. Spicy, perfumy finish. Not as refreshing as most saisons, alcohol burns a bit too much. A bit unbalanced.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2013 pours hazy blonde with lots of sediment, a thin white head and lots of lacing.  tart, sugary aroma.  taste is bitter citrus, floral notes, yeast and honey.  finish is bittersweet.
Hazy yellow with a medium white head. Sour and fruity.  Hops, asour and stable. Medium to full body with a bitter aftertaste.

Sampler at CBF 2011-06-28. Murky, yellow-golden with a creamy, off-white head leaving excellent lacing. Fresh, spicy Belgian yeast, banana and fruits on the nose. Acidic fresh, bitter flavors with spicy and light erathy notes. Medium to full body. Dry finish. Gentle carbonation.

Pours clear orange amber with a thick foamy white head leaving some lacing. Aroma is quite complex of fruits, malts, hops, sour, yeast and sweet. Flavor is so good, lean, well balanced, slightly acidy, very malty, fruity, sweet but still dry, bitter hoppy. Just great. Finishes once again well balanced with good malty, acidy and bitter dry almost tart aftertaste. The 9.5 ABV is not present in flavor nor aroma, but I can feel it.

Murky-yellow pour with a small white head. Nose is dominated by orange peel and breadiness with a little bit of floral hops. Flavor is very sweet and lets the citrus notes really shine, with a good bit of herbs, spice, and "funk" on the backside. Alcohol is quite well hidden. Finish is long and sticky. Excellent saison.

Tap @ Parkway. Clear, light gold pour with a fine coating of white head which persists ad leaves a heavy lace. Typical Belgian farmhouse ale nose - kinda funky. Medium-heavy body with minimal fine carbonation. Bananas, yeast, lemon, pepper - this one is going so many places I dont where to turn! ABV is there, but not as in your face as one would expect from a 9.5% ale. Nice balance of sweet, bitter and umami, close to perfect for a saison. This one will be high on the list when I finally get my hol in Belgium! Bettered by the best American saisons purely as a function of distance traveled.

Herb-hefiger Geruch mit zitronensäuerlichen Nuancen. Säuerlich-zitroniger Start. Mittig staubig-holzig und trocken, zugeordnet aber auch angenehm gewürzige Züge. Bitter-trocken mit einer gewissen Schärfe und leicht alkoholisch abfließend. Rundum gut.Test vom 2.7.2010, Gebinde: Glasflasche
UPDATED: DEC 28, 2011 750ml bottle. Cloudy gold, fizzy head, hoppy bitterness and acidic seltzer mouthfeel. Perfect balance.
Cloudy with a little head, Nose with citrus, dry hay and light coriander, some length and medium body. Taste is dry fruit, cirtus, grapefruit, delicious but dry! A fine Saison!

Tap.  Billowing white cappuccino-like foam on a clearer golden yellow body. Yeasty, sweet, light fruits, and a hint of alcohol in the aroma. Nicely yeasty, touch of vanilla, lots of fruit, but a touch too sweet for me.  Medium, silky body.
Cloudy yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity and yeasty. Flavor is quite sweet and light acidic. Light dry finish with some alcohol. 260511

Bottle from Mane Liquor @ Dupont tasting. Pours a dark, hazy straw colour with a fine, medium sized white head. Citrus - mainly lemon and grass/piney aromas are the first things to jump out at me. Slight brett pronounces itself. An earthy flavour backs this beer the entire time I drink it, a dryness adds to that. Slight sweetness in there with a touch of spices as well. Very good saison

Hellmalziger Antrunk mit leichter Hefigkeit, etwas alkoholisch. Ein wenig erinnert das Bier an ein Wit, vom Level der Würzigkeit sowie den Kräuteraromen. Mild erfrischend, in Teilen bitter. Zum Ende wirkt eher der Hopfen, auch dieser erinnert an ein Wit. Der leichte Alkoholtouch passt hier. 12/9/8/9//9

This saison pours a hazy shade of straw with a caramel darkness to it. Huge white head that sticks around for a while and leaves a nice lacing along the sides of the glass. Bubbles rest on the bottom of my glass and release every so often to add to the creaminess floating atop this nice looking beverage. A lemony grassy aroma immediately greets my schnoz as I poke it into the glass. A slight funky brett smell is also present. And hints of alcohol present itself as well.

A sweet dryness is welcoming me to drink as much as I want from the glass. I think I will. There is also a slight earthy flavor mixed in with malt and wheat. A bit of a graininess as well. Very dry beer. This thing must have bottomed out on the fermentation. But there is such a slight sweetness that it makes you think it might not be that dry. Oh, but it is that dry. A very present alcohol lets you know it is there with each quaff. And the dryness is overpowered by a slight bitterness in the back end. Overall a very welcome saison after the mishandled other example I had years ago. 

This beer has renewed my hope that saisons might be a drinkable beer. The beautiful pour along with the lacing and color of this beer is very pleasing to look at. The aroma with the mixture of sour and sweet with an ever-present alcohol is not too hard on the nose. A very pleasant drinking experience that would be well suited to the waning hours of a warm spring day.
Zesty like a weisenbock, very good, alcohol well hidden, very citrusy, Crisp, naner notes

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2012 Great snow white and soapy head over a slightly hazy yellowbrown body. Rich aroma with fresh hoppy grassy notes, mild lemon, cereal and light sugary sweetness. Medium strong but apparent carbonation and spices. Yet another amazing saison from these Belgians. A bit less fruity and more alcoholic but again impressive amount of flavour and drinkability. (75cl bottle) (Rating re-indexed)

pours dark golden, slight haze, with a decent white head, retention and lacing are good. aroma and taste are herbal dry hops, yeast, warming alcohol, grassy lemony, loads of citrus, grapefruit, and also very fruity - grapes, grappa, white port. tartness. strong peppery finish, lively carbonation that softens. hint of sweetness but dry bittering finish.

bouteille 37,5cl
Dorée brumeuse, col blanc épais;
Une bière complexe et haute en alcool pour une saison. Goût est évolutif au fil des ans tout comme sa dégustation qui changera selon la t° de consommation ambiante.
Un nez superbement fleuri faisant place aux houblons, levure typique belge de saison et un bouquet fruité. Le tout est très frais et rappelle un peu les fourrages avec son côté herbeux.
Le palais est quant à lui aussi exceptionnel. Houblon type floral, citronné avec une levure belge qui rajoute un aspect épicé. Légèrement amer et fruitée tenant vers le citron.
Tout comme larôme, ceci est une bière fraiche rappelant la ferme/grange. Le malt quant à lui ressort plus que sur des saisons de plus bas niveau dalcool. Le fini reste sec et les 9.5% donnent à cette dernière un côté réchauffant en bouche.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2013 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */: cloudy bright yellow with a big fluffy head, nice lacing, tasted of sweet yeast, sweet spices, fruit (dominant banana), very minor bitter ending, some trippel-like qualities, minor funk, no alcohol noticeable, had a decent body, slightly creamy, bit dry in a nice way, very smooth, outstanding some tripel qualities /// I have been drinking this regularly on tap @ Kulminator  2011 Vintage, incredible rich flavour, one hell of a beer // increased score from 4.4 to 4.8 /// oddly never had this one bottled actually /// upping to 4.9 because I cannot stop drinking this one, still havent tried it fresh or from a bottle for that matter //// cant stop drinking this one, fresh, aged whatever, this is always perfect. Still need to try a bottle -> 5 now

Orange yellow beer with a big and white head. Aroma is interesting, yeast, sweet fruityness and herbal spicyness. Medium bodied, easy and fresh to drink. Taste is quite dry, herbs, sourness, some fruiytness and bitterness. Quite dry, enjoyable and interesting beer.

750 ml bottle poured into a tulip glass.  The beer has aromas of barnyard, skunk and grass.  The appearance is a nice yellow with a white head.  The taste is funky and spicy with notable hop presence.  The palate is light to medium body with lively carbonation and a crisp clean finish.  Overall, this is a great Saison that is a must try.

Versa arancio pallido con abbondante schiuma bianca molto persistente. Aroma di cuoio,pane bianco,agrumi e spezie.In bocca è dolcemente agrumata con retrogusto di cereali,un gusto davvero complesso.
Una grandissima birra!

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2011 On tap at Monks.  Pour is cloudy straw yellow pour with a decent amount of thick head, which sticks around for a while and laces well. Yeast up front, touch of barnyard with some banana, clove, coriander. Taste is immediately  a slight bitter and citrusy hope note, followed by some hay malt and the yeast flavors, as well as some clove.  Lightly bitter, astringent finish with a hint of the alcohol.

On tap at the Brick Store. The pour is a cloudy yellow with a huge fluffy white head. The aroma is lemons, vanilla, wheat and herbs. The flavor is tangy and sweet, with only a little bitterness. The palate is heavy, smooth and astringent. Overall, a very decent saison.
On tap.  Hazy yellowish color with a thick white head.  Citrusy taste.  A nice saison.  Very smooth.

Hazy yellow pour with a nice thick white head. The head lasts forever and laces beautifully. Bananas up front for me, only a hint of funk, and some spices as well. Very good smelling beer. Cloves, bananas, spices, and a bit of funk. A bit bitter and hoppy up front. Honestly reminds me of a tripel, and has a nice bitter finish. Only a hint of the alcohol. Light and bubbly, very refreshing. Very high. Alcohol is masked very well and the taste is delicious.

Draft @ ginger man. This blows the original out of the water. Mells of pine, lemon and hops, tastes of grass, orange and bitters. A great and different approach on a saison with a full body and light gold color. Very enjoyable
Hazy yellow beer with a large lasting white fluffy head. Aroma is caramelised green apples with a grassy edge, taste is dry, clove with a slight sour edge to it.

Bottle.

A - Crisp golden honey with a large, light, foamy, bubbly, fluffy, soapy, white head. Great retention with a definite stickiness. Nice thick, bubbly lace left.

S - Very strong and complex aroma. Strong hay/straw aroma, not strong in the funk, but it has some that gives it a nice barnyard like aroma. Some orchard fruit in the aroma as well along with a hint of spice. Best description would be a barnyard with only a slight funk.

T - Stronger bitter, spice, and funk than the nose suggested. Starts out with a bitter, grassy hop flavor. This quickly goes to the hay/straw flavor with some funk and a lot more spice, especially pepper. Toward the finish, some tart orchard fruit makes an appearance. Slight alcohol warming. Tartness comes out stronger on the finish and lingers.

M - Medium body with plenty of carbonation. Very zesty feel with a drying finish.

D - Very easy to drink, especially given the ABV. Definitely has a tart and bitter taste that might slow down drinking just a little bit. Crisp, zesty feel is great for the saison and compliments the flavor.

Notes: Really nice saison. I think the overly strong tart and bitterness combined with the high ABV provide the slight downfall for this beer. It is incredibly refreshing, zesty, and lively beer to drink. Really good saison that has a slight funky flavor. Nice mix of complex flavors.
Che vi devo dire, che questa è una saison???? No, no, questa non è una saison, questa è la saisonnnnnnnnnnn. Meravigliosa, delicata, splendida, nonostante i 9,5 gradi che non si sentono...
Bottle at work. Hazy yellow colour with a medium white head. Aroma and flavour of spice, yeast, malt, fruit and caramel.

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2011 Tap. Wow this is terrific. Murky light orange pour with a monster foamy white head. Aroma of clove and grass. Very smooth mouthfeel. Some bitterness. Taste is pure saison - grass, spice, and fruity esters. Yummy.

What a wonderful beer! Fruity apples, grassy yeast and funky bread all over the place. And a fab soft mouthfeel that washes your mouth with lively carbonation and perfectly balanced tones of mild acidity and bubblegum.

Bottle: pours a deep, cloudy golden, frothy white two finger head. distinctive Belgian yeast, banana, bubblegum, citrus,wheat, heavy clove, pepper, coriander
Taste- sweet malt, slight bitterness, medium mouth feel with an oiliness. really drinkable which is scary for the ABV. Awesome
Nose is sweet corn, wheat, little sour apple and broad dough in the end, feel is quite broad, carb is medium, taste is sweets, some hay, weak bittersweet hops.

I usually drink this beer on bottle even though the first time was on tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà. Fruity, hopped, spicy, very clear blond color, persistent froth, not too much carbonated. Well balanced with an initial sweet malt feeling.

On tap tonight at the Sharp Edge

A- Body is a very hazy golden yellow with uniform translucency. Served with a nice 1-2 finger creamy white head and plenty of lacing is left all the way down the glass.

S- Nose is very mild and offers a lot of floral hops and a mild peppery spice. Not really much else as it is kept soft overall.

T- Initial taste has a good amount of spices and a floral hop overtone with a quite mild bready yeast backbone. The spices intensify for the finish and the floral hops bitterness gets moderate to strong and lingers for awhile along with a mild alcohol astringency.

M- Very good overall mild to moderate carbonation and a nice moderate to full light weight bready body.

D- This is a good saison overall- the ABV is well hidden. It has an overall soft, slightly spicy character. I really like this one-but it doesnt rank among my personal top Saisons.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 12-31-2010 00:54:13

750ml bottle. Cork dated 2008. Consumed 01/01/2011. Poured a gold/straw with a light haze and a medium size head. Aroma: very floral and fruity, orange peel, barnyard, yeast, mild spice. Taste carried out the aroma but with some notes of bitterness at the end. Nice depth, excellent balance. I poured this a little too cold; as it warmed the taste really expanded and was very nice. Overall a very good Saison.

750 ml bottle from Bieropholie, shared with Phil, served cool in a wine glass. BB 08/2013. 01JA11. 
App.:  Deep golden with lots of yeast flecks and a decent rocky white head.
  
Aroma:  Faint, playful esters, some nice malt notes, yeast, maybe some light coriander and citrus, restrained but pleasant.
  
Palate:  Medium-ish body, sparse effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Quite fruity, old apple juice, some nice caramel and biscuit malts, coriander, honey, quite pleasant; dry with decent bitterness.

Nice.

Hazy golden with a large rocky white head. Light tartness with orange peel and then a blend of spices. Some fruity esters and its all on a cerealy ground flavour. Lots of subtle flavours that will need some time and attention to really reveal themselves.

What a great beer.  My favorite to have on New Years eve.  Pours a dusky yellow, orange.  Barnyard funky aroma that leads into a pungent first note then some fruit follows. All of it effervescent and so easy to drink.

Poured from a 750 ml bottle a hazy golden beer with a nice frothy white head that leaves nice lacing around the glass. Aroma of banana, citrus, bread and malt. Flavor is full bodied and very very good. A very good taste left lingeringon the palate. A truely remarkable Belgium beer...would definitely buy again. Happy New Years!!!!

This one is absolutely brilliant... murky yellow liquid, light head... aroma is huge with malts hops, fruit, some spices, alchohol... taste is brilliant to sweet sour and bitter in its finish, insane malty intensity, apple,, spicey and hops also.... nice body and a long warming finish... one of the best non-dark beers ive tasted so far... im drinking this one on old years eve so i might be a bit prejudiced

On tap at shadys.  Pours light gold with white head.  Aroma and flavor of more banana and less tart than the typical saison.  I had no idea it was 9.5% abv at the time.  Additional yeastiness.  Yum, very good, but less distinctive than the provision.

On tap at the Bavarian Lodge in Lisle, IL. Theres a lot of subtleties and clearly some high quality craftsmanship going on here, as expected. Starting with the pour, its really as pretty as it gets with a nice thick, white cloud-like head, scattered lacing, a cloudy appearance and an orange fruit color. Like the Vieille Provision, the subtle aroma continues to grow and impress as I drink. Notes of fruity esters, peach, pineapple, bready Belgian yeast, a unique set of spices, olives, and orange peel. The alcohol is impressively hidden with the mouthfeel being slightly oily, slightly creamy, and lightly carbonated all at once. Fruity esters and light, crumbly caramel cookies begin in the flavor. Then, some tropical citrus, olives, and mixed spices that flows into the pleasantly lingering finish. A very nice, high class experience.

Pours hazy golden with a large lasting head.
Aroma shows typical Belgian doughy yeast with related spicy phenols and a little lemon. Very clean, not much noticeable malt.
Similar flavours, with lemon, citrus and some alcohol. Finishes quite dry.
Nice high carbonation and light body - very refreshing.

The taste really comes out after some sips, take a sip and let it set in and it grows more robust and begs for another. This will leave you wanting more. Taste is indicitave of Christmas beers, not too much spice, but overall rich and carmely flavor with a hint of clove or spice. Smell is good, not real strong. Color is right on, and the bread, caramel, spice and cereal come into play after 20 seconds it is truly enjoyable to drink.

Bottle; Pour is a Hazy Golden - Frothy White head with excellent retention and lacing. Nice carbonation - Aromas are spicy, yeasty, fruity and just inviting. Farmhouse qualities are naturally present; lemon grass, orange peel, white pepper, and coriander all seem to fuse perfectly. The spices linger on the tongue in a quite interesting fashion, lengthening the flavor profile. Its sweet, spicy, bitter all at once. Terrific!
On tap at Redlight, Redlight. Great creamy, mountainous head, first SIP is spicy, extremely easy drinking, quite nice.

Comes out of the tap a hazy, barely translucent light gold with a thick, fine-bubbled white head that leaves some good lacing. Yeasty and fruity aroma is not strong but still invites a taste. Flavor is yeasty and fruity with malt and sweet undertones and a strong but not overwhelming alcohol kick. Strongly fizzy texture leaves behind a nice tingle, as well as subtle sweetness and a bit of an alcohol nip.
zestu head and spicy taste that lasts.. good beer for this time of the yeat and pretty strong im glad i tried this

75cl bottle. Beautiful head, tiny bubbles. Spices and herbs in the nose, also some yeast (bread). Medium body, very light/mild carbonation. Some hints of champagne in the taste, soft but quite noticeable hoppy bitterness, herbs. 
Very nice beer, hard to compare to other styles.

On tap at Stone Brewing.  Im really glad I got to try this one finally.  I need to go back when I can appropriately rate it, as my notes were limited.  Hazy yellow pour with big zesty head.  Nose and taste are lemon yeasty.  Tartness with spice throughout.  Yummy beer.

On tap at Rons in Exton, PA. It pours cloudy lemon and light orange with a small lacey head. The smell of a true sweet saison with that trademark yeast in the nose. The body is just right on the thickness and a spicy yeasty delicous flavor settles in on the palate. The ending lingers with a light saison funk.

750. Pours a murky golden with a foamy white head. A yeasty aroma with some fruit, maybe green apples an citrus. Great crisp mouthfeel with a nice grapefruit flavor. Theres a great spice to this that develops and lasts. Almost a hint of cinnamon, nicely warmibg in the finish. Ive not huge into saisons but I really enjoyed this beer.

Spicy, grapefruit aroma.  Light amber-honey color.  Very clean-tasting, rather dry with nicely "tamed" lemon and other citrus notes.  Finishes with a pleasing bitterness and honey.  A very good saison thats surprisingly clean and without any Belgian "wildness," though I wish it had some more fruit on the palate.
Bottle.  Funky yeast aroma.  Golden body, tall dissipating head, nice thin lacing, great carbonation.  Flavor is filled with yeast, subtle citrus, hop and bubble gum.  Dry finish.
On tap at Bottleworks, pours golden with a white head. Aroma of yeast, hops and bready malts. Flavour of barnyard funk, and strong bitter hops that lingers. Very well-crafted.

On tap at Stone.  Hazy golden yellow.  Aroma is light yeast, citrus rind, and some light, dry spice (type unknown).  Creamy and smooth feel.  Taste is mellow citrus, spice, and a pronounced yeast character rounding out the finish.  Drinks like 5%.  Quite tasty.

Pours a nice straw color with a good white head and some lacing. Smell is quite funky and with some citrus notes thrown in as well. Taste is quite similar. Quite spicy and hoppy for the style. Fairly dry mouthfeel, and somewhat light. Good carbonation. The funk persists throughout. A nice twist with excellent drinkability.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 09-18-2010

bottle. spicy nose- pepper and clove. pours hazy golden. big white frothy head. the yeastiness is pronounced with subtle spice,citrus and sour. very easy to drink- i had no idea it approached anything close to 10 percent abv. wonderful.

On tap @ Rattle N Hum.
Light gold with a bit of haze and a little white head. Citrusy clove aroma, light wheat notes, some yeast. Hint of sourness, spice and yeast notes come out more on the palate. Very smooth and easy drinking, especially given the high alcohol content.
Funk and clove nose. Cloudy golden, thick head. Fair amount of funk flavor. Alcohol noticeable. Not complex, a little too volatile, but  somewhat enjoyable.
Bottle.Pours cloudy yellow with a white head.Aroma of yeast, citrus, caramel and  fruitiness.Flavor is sweet sugar and yeast with some caramel and spice.Medium body, average carbonation.
kryddor, gräs, citrus, jord och en hel del kola. Påminde lite om en bock, dock en trevlig saison.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2013 Bottle @ home. Pours a very hazy yellow-orange appearance with a really nice, creamy white head. Theres almost a ginger-like spiciness in the nose along with a fair amount of black pepper notes. Bread is also noticeable in the aroma along with a fair amount of citrusness, but not as much as the Saison Dupont. In addition to a fairly citrusy/lemon zesty flavor, there is a fairly dry, straw grainy taste going on. Some acidity exists from the carbonation leading to it being pretty easy to drink despite the high alcohol content, but theres an even more extensive bitter, floral hoppiness to the beer. This is really a nice beer to share at the holidays.

Thanks kmweaver for sharing this 750ml that pours hazy gold with lacing. Pepper notes arise in aroma based on pils maltiness. Malt and sweet lemon flavors carefully balanced by alcohol and peppery notes. Very Dupont in yeast flavor (of course) with medium body.

Had this beer on tap at Monks in Philly. Surprised by how mellow and drinkable this beer was. I was expecting a bit more punch with it being made by Dupont and being a Holiday Ale. A hazy full bodied blonde with a touch of sourness in the mid-palette. Very enjoyable

750 mL bottle at 1410 World Bier Haus in Calgary, served in a Trappist glass. Pours turbid golden with a tall, frothy white head. The head mostly remains and leaves a small amount of fine white lace. The nose is big and grassy, with notes of grain, honey, leafy hops, pepper, apple and hints of dust and mold. The flavour is dry throughout with apple and pepper notes. The finish is long and dry with a slightly acidic character. There are also notes of mold and pepper in the finish. It is medium in body with a dry texture and soft carbonation. Overall, this is a nice complex, strong dry ale with notes of apple and pepper. Though the expiry date on the bottle was June 2015, this one tasted a bit old. Altogther, it was very nice. 2010-11-10

Bottle at Where the Wild Beers Are. Pour looked bright golden just like the picture on this page (a rarity to me, for whatever reason). Aroma is classic saison: peppery and bubblegum. Flavor is a bit simplistic of bubblegum (without the excess sugar residuals) and a touch of white pepper. Some lemon zest in the finish to go with the bubblegum. A bit one-dimensional but overall enjoyable.

Hazy golden coloured body with a thick dense slightly off white head. Aroma of hay, grass, light spices and a bunch of malt. Medium-bodied; Potent grass and spicey flavours complement the effervescent malt and yeast flavours that are very noticeable as well. Aftertaste is quite dry with some light hoppy notes and a strong bit of spice too. Overall, a very nice saison and definitely nice to sample! I sampled this one-year old bottle, purchased at Beer Mania in Bruxelles, Belgium, sampled there as well.

750 ml. 2009 aged 1 year. Purchased in Ghent, Belgium.
Pours a hazy golden color, with a white medium-low frothy head. Medium-high effervescence. The smell is wonderful and lives up to what I expect from a Belgian style. Notes of caramel, floral, citrus, mildly hoppy, coppery, and sour/sweet. The taste is not what I expected and somewhat bland in comparison to the aroma but tasty nonetheless. It is quite effervescent and tingly on the tongue. It is sweet but not overpoweringly so. Decent bitterness for a Belgian beer. And a little bit sour. Somewhat of a sweet coppery metallic taste. Very enjoyable beer.

750 shared at a beer tasting. Clear and light gold with a big foamy white head and strong carbonation. The nose is spicy, citrusy, and floral. Flavor is very dry, with (again) citrus and spices - a nice tangy orange/tangerine tone. The champagne-like carbonation suits this one very well. Very nice and dry, even for a saison at 9.5%.

Big, frothy head. Orange, hazy beer. Bits and things floating in the tulip glass I am holding. Yeasty, citrus fruit aroma. Tart. Flavour is yeast and grape juice. Some alcohol can be found too. Dry and sour.

2009 vintage. On tap. Aged for over 10 months in the Bavarian Lodge, Lisle, IL cellar.

Aroma:A little Belgian yeast tang, otherwise mild.

Appearance:Cloudy and light yellow in color. Nice fine bubbles in the head, good lacing.

Taste:I get a mouthfull of spices in the first sip. Clove, coriander, black pepper, Belgian yeast. It has a dry finish.

Palate:Light to medium body, creamy with just a little astringency.

Overall:This is a fantastic Saison, nicely spiced, very complex.

Bottle, Open All Hours, Keswick. There is herbs and lemon initially, but so many other taste sensations are packed into this superb beer. A spirit-like dryness permeates the roof of the mouth, gooseberry and melon come in and I do get a hint of sourness. A touch of floweriness in the finish. Complex, loads of flavour and character, a great find.

This the perfect Saison...  I cant believe the abv.  Tastes more like a table beer.  Tap @ Saraveza...  Poured a yellow, hazy, hey tone with a white head.  Lots of esters, pepper spices, lemon zest.  Dry, thirst quenching, mild tartness similar to a dry wine.

Sprigiona il suo meraviglioso profumo appena stappata.
Bellissima nel bicchiere. Il lievito spadroneggia sia al naso che in bocca. Ben luppolata e con un piacevole calore alcolico.

Bottle 37cl. A cloudy yellow amber beer with good head. Smell is near a belgian triple and hopy. Aroma is fruity, with typical belgian yeast presence, no very malty, finish is very bitter-hopy near to Orval and dry. Not bad but less complex than expected, alcohol is quite present.

A: snifter. nice pale yellow color with some sediment in there. solid white head. good retention and good lacing.

S: nice lemon aroma. some sweet tones mixed with some sour notes. almost like a fair lemonade.

T: sweeter malts than expected. some lemon and sweet orange flavors. some sours, but light. very nice tasting saison.

M: very smooth and mellow for 9.5%, heavier than expected. high carbonation.

D: I love saisons, this is good, but not top notch for me. very enjoyable though, well worth a try.

(bottle) pours a hazy golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of heavy wheat and barnyard, with light citrus fruits, dry spices, grass and yeast. flavour has additional notes of banana and grain, with green grass, a hint of alcohol and a dry citric finish. medium-bodied with lively carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a veru hazy golden orange with very rocky white coloured head. Plenty of lacing as it falls away. Aromas are dominated by the yeast. Heaps of spice and funk coming through. Some cirtus, apricots and just a hint of light caramel but the yeast if definately the stand out. Fantastic. Flavours are not as complex as the nose but brilliant never the less. Some fruity tartness followed by a bitter somehwat dry finish. Big full mouthfeel as expected. Great beer.

(Bottle, 0.75 l, at Olutkellari Helsinki) Poured pale golde and slightly hazy. Head was medium sized and white. Aroma was fruity and mildly sour. Palate was medium bodied and bit warming with medium carbonation. Flavours were malts, fruitiness, spices, sourness, sweetness, raisin and bitterness. Aftertaste was bitter and mildly sour.

Bottle. Murky orange pour, small off-white head. Aroma has a lot of brett-funkiness, barnyard, yeasty sourness, tart and fruits. Some peach and citrus as well. Taste isnt as sour as one might anticipate, but has some nice malty and flowery/yeasty characteristics. Some slight hints of vanilla as well. Medium carbonation, fairly big body, long duration, some bitterness, but not much. More reminiscent of a Tripel.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2013 Appearance : beautiful amber, full of carbonation, nice thick head which stays quite a while. Aroma : fresh hops, yeast, grass, lemon, smells very similar to American IPAs. Taste : slightly floral, citrus, well-balanced sweetness. Overall impression : great saison!

RE-RATE : rated it a bit lower due to the variation between batches. Sometimes its just meh.
Beautifully crafted from the fruity aromas to the spiced aftertaste. Cant wait for next holiday season. Check the full review http://beerhatesme.blogspot.com/2010/01/avec-les-b

UPDATED: APR 1, 2012 Light amber pour with a small white head. Lots of sediments in this one. Aroma has a somewhat bretty character up front, flowery tripel-yeast, nice caramel notes, a bit of alcohol, and a good amount of spices. Taste has belgian tripel yeast sweetness, a lot of spices, som alcohol, and a bit of brett. This beer seems to be a belgian triple with testicles. It has the same qualities as the triple, it just has a bit of brett and spices that the tripel doesnt have. Wouldve liked more freshness and sourness in this one. 7-3-7-4-15
Re-rate Pretty much what I said upstairs, I just like it more now. And its a pretty beautiful beer. Clear amber with a lovely dense, light white head. A true stunner to look at. and pretty tasty, too.
Autumn Golden pour with a beautiful head. Aroma wafts up yeast and light funk, with a bit of pear and honey. Spicy, lemony, grassy, dry champagne finish. Lovely

Serving: 750 ml. bottle from State Line Liquors. 
Aroma: The nose is a nice mix of yeast, floral notes, hay, grass, and a bit of barnyard. 
Appearance: It pours a hazy gold with a foamy white head. 
Taste: Its slightly phenolic with a bit of candy sugar, spring florals, hay, and grass.  There is lots of farmhouse depth that emerges as the beer warms slightly.  Aggressive hopping for the style.
Palate: Light in body with lots of soft carbonation leading to a nice floral finish. 
Overall: This is a tribute to the saison style with a nice hoppiness to it.
Score: 7.4.8.4.16

A fine way to greet New Year. Personally I prefer to drink my weight in whisky, place my underpants on my head and run naked down the street shouting slanderous remarks about the government. But this would be nice, too. Gold with an immense, lacing head. Almost lambic in aroma - sour-sweet fruits, lemon candy, coriander. Oily palate. Oodles of fruity esters on the tongue. Light spices, acids and alcohol. I liked this a lot and it compared surprisingly favourably to the Captain Lawrence Cuvee de Castleton that preceded it at a group tasting. (Bottle at the RB Sydney 2009 gathering)

Tap at Kulminator.
Hazy golden with a small white head. Coriander and herbal aroma. Flavor of sweet honney, flowers and alchohol sharpness in a nice balanced way with a dry finish.

75 cl bottle. Very thick white head. Pours hazy and orange. Nose is rather funky, with citrus, spices and yeast. Taste is sweet with a hint of pleasant sourness, wheaty flavours run through but overall very complex. Velvety and slick mouthfeel. Alcohol is very well hidden for 9.5 ABV. Top notch this brew!

Bottled. Pours hazy and golden with a 2 fingers high, lasting white head. Fair lacings. Nose of grass, yeast and notes of fruits. Medium sweet flavour with citrus, apple, grass and notes of spices and yeast. Medium bodied. Ends up more dry and slightly bitter. A nice brew indeed.

7th March 2010. Cloudy amber beer. Small white head. Throws some sediment. Soft palate - very soft. Creamy malt with a whisper of orange. Just a very light soft creamy beer. Very good for being just that.

375ml bottle.  Pours hazy ornage with a large white head.  Not much on the nose, some yeast, lemon and spice.  Starts with some lemon, then spice and finishes with a hop bite and alcohol.  Good level of carbonation.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 A: Lovely hay-yellow body. Opaque. Massive white head. Solid retention and beautiful sheet like lacing.

S: Bursting with a complex nose of wheat, hop bitterness, lemon, grass, and farmhouse funk.

T: More of the same. Complex and assertive flavor profile, while still restrained enough to allow all the flavors to shine. In addition to the characteristics from the nose, the clove and spice comes out and makes it self known.

M: Good carbonation levels, and nice refreshing bite.

O: In its tier of top notch saisons, it slips just a tad on the drinkability level.

Une bière de noël au départ , aujourdhui disponible toute lannée ! 
Testé en bouteille et au fût 

Beaucoup de résidus , une forte odeur dalcool , le subtile parfum des levures de chez Dupont , un gout malté , pour au final être une bière au combien festive !!

Pours a fairly deep and cloudy yellow with a hefty, bubbly white head. Nose is belgian yeast, barnard, and a bit of citrus, alcohol and hops.  Theres a fair amount of bread in the flavor, along with some hop clear bite.  This is heavier and not as crisp, light or refreshing as the mainstay saison made by Brasserie Dupont, which I think I still prefer.  That said, its still fantastic in its own right, and certainly not far off the mark from the best of the best.

Pours a hazy straw yellow color with with a nice white head.  Aroma of malts, hops, citrus fruits and spices.  Flavors of malts and hops, apples, grapes, lemons, hints of vanilla, yeast and spices.  Good carbonation, nice mild sweetness and bitterness, creamy. Great balance and very refreshing.

I think this is the best saison I have had.  I would say its like the regular saison dupont, but with more body and fruit flavor.  Still has that great light bubbly consistency and chalky aftertaste with floral and grass hints.  Huge white, light head.  Very drinkable and smooth.  The additions here are a more syrupy body that has a lot of peach and honey to it.

Buy it if you see it.

37,5cl bottle. Pours a golden-amber color Big creamy white head. The first smell brings champagne notes. Floral notes and barnyard funkiness in the nose. Hints of green apple too. It tastes great: a perfect balance between funkiness, green appple tartness and sugary sweetness. A light touch of alcohol too. Medium-full bodied with good carbonation. Overall, an extremely refreshing and tasty beer.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2010 This was called Vielle Biere Surlie Non-filtre.  I think it is the same stuff, and it appears to be the top rated saison.  Big, fluffy head on a cloudy, dark gold pour.  Pretty hoppy for the style - a good amount of orange and wheat malt too.  Plenty of pithy hop tingle, and a touch of flowers in the finely textured finish.  Very fine brew, and just might be worthy of its high rating (it used to be #1 but as of this writing it has dropped to #3).

Pours a hazy orange with white long lasting head.  Aroma is spices, some florals, yeast and earthyness.  Taste is tart with a sweet spicey finish.  Alcohol is well hidden.  Extremely smooth.

.

$11.49. 750 ml. First thing I smelled when I opened this was skunk. Pours a nice glowing golden-orange with a huge expanding head. The aroma is skunky but not too overpowering with some citric qualities. The taste is real easy with some yeast, pepper, citrus and it prickles your tongue. Seems like a clean beer besides it being skunked. The #1 rated saison? Seriously?
Fu un tempo una birra di Natale. Colore giallo intenso, moltissimi residui, ottimo profumo, si sente molto (forse troppo) lalcol ma il corpo è maltoso e ben bilanciato. Buona

Malty, not much hop.

Thick, sweet, can tell it is hiding alcohol.

Dont know when id like to drink it.

Tap at mikkeller bar.

Poured golden yellow with an off-white, lacing foam that never disappears. Coriander, honey, herbs, apricot, melon, cantalop in the acidic aroma. Dense, heavy body with lively carbonation. Interesting, active presence. Watch out, this beer is alive.

Pours a soft golden color with a full thick white head and lovely lacing.  Smells of rich malts, a strong spicy citrus note and a faint bit of earth and dirt.  Big flavors for a saison like a large amount of malts, a nice bit of hoppiness that leaves a zing on the tongue.  A rathe oiky mouthfell, fairly big bodied, full flavored.
This is what a beer should look like.  Cloudy, light orange with a Gia t fluffy head.  Some pineapple, pepper, and a little funky barn.  Big but dry and refreshing, finishes with hoppy sourness.

0,5 l bottle courtesy of Balazs, thanks!
Poured cloudy golden with a nice off white, stable and creamy head that melting to a small lacing one. Herbals, coriander, fruity and spicy aroma. It might be  cantalop or peach. Medium bodied one with a powerful, strong spicy character, coriander and some vanilla, honey and herbal hops. Alcohol well hidden but warms me up. Spicy aftertaste.

First of all, I think this bottle was infected or something. Would not stop gushing foam for several minutes, will rate again if the next bottle is different. Aroma definitely hinted that something was happening to the yeast, and flavor was way too sour for what this was supposed to be. Again, will re-rate with a different bottle.

Bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. moderate malty and heavy hoppy and yeasty aroma. Citrus and hay notes. Moderate bitter nice fruity flavor. Long moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate. excellent saison.

I had this on tap at Hopleaf into a tulip...The beer is a nice gold slight orange, good head and retention...The aroma and taste are super nice, what a saison is. Floral hops, so fresh with a little funk. The taste is bitter but sour, easy to drink..

Aroma is dusty, winy, lots of yeastiness.  Smells of candied fruit, alcohol, and sweet malt.
Taste is sweet, slightly carbonated, spicy, alcohol.
Finish is sweet and slightly bitter, and just wow....
Great beer.

04 vintage consumed 1552010

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2011 head: normal
colour: hazy blond
smell: hops,bitter,pineapple,citricpeel
taste: bitter,alcohol,hops,yeast
very very good beer !

Pours a nice hazy blonde with a big head and good lace. The aroma is a bit soapy but this is made up for by the nice lemony and hoppy notes along with a nice fruitiness. The flavor is very dry and spicy with some good citrus rind, mineral. and hoppy notes. There is certainly some of the alcohol character in there as well. Its very good but doesnt have the sort of finesse that many other Dupont products do, perhaps I need to try it again.

Had this beer on tap, two weeks ago in bar "Multatuli" in Gent. They always have one Dupont beer on tap. I was lucky it was this one!
Pours a light orange cloudy beer. A little fine laced white head. Very little carbon. Smell is very hoppy, even like canabis. A bit flat texture due to the little carbon, but this was probably because of the tap installation. Very balances taste. Mostly bitter, but also very spicy, koriander and citrus. Very long lasting dry aftertaste.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2010 Bright, lightly hazed yellow, huge and very thick white, fluffy head with excellent lacing. Milder aroma than I expected. Tropical fruits, yeasty, some sourness vaguely resembling cherry. The taste is cheezy and moldy - neither is overpowering but they are the dominant features. Light citrus - maybe lemon, dry grass, pepper, dry and a bit tart feeling here, yeast and a bit of candy. I cant really taste the alcohol but there is some burn happening. Easy drinking but pretty much a boring 750ml of 9.5% beer that Ill probably pay for in the morning after also drinking USAlive prior to this. Even after consuming that much of this beer I am only left with a vague lasting impression. Good soft flavour. Very easy drinking for 9.5%. Cork says 2008.

A:  Barnyard funkiness, slight dry fruits, bready
App:  light golden hazey color, nice lacing, with a good amount of fluffy white head
T:  floral, banana, bread, hay, dry citrus, herbal
P:  Nice palate coating without being over the top

Golden ale with a small white head. Lots of aroma; yeast, dried fruits, raisins, sherry, ginger, citrus, Very complex, appealing sweet&sour notes. This is great stuff. Fresh and fruity, creamy maltiness comes along balanced with bitter hops. Strong dry finish. A Classic.
750mL bottle.  Enjoyed on a fine spring day on the beach (still had it in stock at my store).  Wonderful saison with citrus, funky Belgian yeast, and more going on.  Delicious!
bottle, upside down label pours a clear golden orange with tons of egg white foam and thick lace, aroma is funky lemon with a flavor of sour chalky lemon, very smooth with a bitter finish

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2012 750ml 2008 bottle, 14C. Pours gold with an enormous white head that hangs around. Smells of rich fruit, lots of funky yeast, herbs and spices. Luscious mouthfeel. Alcohol becomes more obvious as it warms and you drink more of it. Quite scrumpy-like as well as tripelish. Lots of sweet/ sour complexity with some bitterness right at the end (and a long way past). A little sediment got into the second glass and was rather welcome - it fattened out the flavours and softened the alcohol. I liked it more as it warmed, though still a lot less than their normal Saison. [3.8] 
2009 bottle. Hazy gold with a large white head thats fairly well retained. Aroma: bready and cheesy yeast; fruity and boozy with orange zest and punchy pepper and cloves. Rich, tripelish mouthfeel with moderate but lingering spicy bitterness. Not very ciderish this time - more orange and caramel, maybe some pears. Think I would rate the last bottle higher now and will try an older one next time.Older turned out to be a bad idea, just turned lumpen. A 2012 bottle is lighter and spicier - a very good beer, but Id still take the normal saison over it every time.
Bottle, slight cloudy yellow orange, medium soapy head. Aroma of hops, citrus, malt and fruit. Flavour is quite strange, some bitterness, quite sweet, some sourness. Fruity and weird, but nice.

Bottle, thanks for sharing dEnk! Pours a hazy golden color with a creamy white head. Aroma of sharp spicy Belgian hops and fruits. Flavor is spicy bitter, sweet and quite strange. Nice taste evolution in the mouth going from one extreme to the other in a matter of seconds. Creamy texture, lively carbonation. Unique brew.

Bottle.

Slightly cloudy golden. Spices, grass, citrus, earth, yeast and caramel. Very balanced with a nice mouthfeel.

Poured a hazy golden color with some sediment and a fizzy white head.  Bits of lacing.  The aroma was spice, grass and light citrus.  The flavor was earth, grass, spice and a hint of citrus.  Thin and dry and refreshing.  Almost 10% abv wasnt really ever noticed.
Pours a golden orange with a small white head. Aromas of citrus/ginger. Flavor was outstanding compared to the nose.

GABF 09.Pours a cloudy, crisp, and lively lemon yellow with a nice white head.  Aroma is zesty lemon peel and mild grassy hops.  Flavor is watery lemon corn meal.  Average mouthfeel.  Meh, Ill pass next time.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Amazing Saison.  It masks the high alcohal content well.  Aroma of banana and tropical fruit.  Beautiful color, almost like an unfiltered cider.  Taste of banana, citrus, earthy, and a little barnyard.  Great beer.

750mL bottle.  Pours a hazy light gold with some suspended sediment and a fluffy white head, settling to a thin covering.  Earthy, floral, fruity and spicy aroma.  The flavour is spicy with some sweetness, bitterness and citric acidity.  Light to medium bodied with average carbonation, very creamy on the palate with a drying, yeasty, starchy and bitter finish.

Pours a golden orange with a lasting quarter-inch head and some lace, slightly cloudy. Delicious fruity & light caramel aroma - yum! Extremely well-balanced malty sweetness, light note of bananas & cloves, starchy, muted slightly grassy hops, light creamy body with more than modest carbonation. Balanced, well-executed and quaffable. Yum! Thanks to Boutip for the trade!

Bottle (in NZ). All those funky Belgium Saison aromas. In the mouth, big spice and pepper with plenty of carbonation. Citrus and grass comes through a bit more after a few swallows and your palate adjusts. A big beer deserving your full attention.
bread, grass, barnyard, skunky, golden, hazy, frothy, rocky head, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, paper napkin, medium body, slick feel, lively, fizzy, fizzy,

Pours a golden orange haze with a thin foam head.  Floral bouquet with hops and spice on the nose.  Has some characteristics of Chouffe.  Sweet cabonated taste with bitters and grass on the back end, slight hint of lemon zest.  Very taste.  Has your typical saison feel with more body, thicker mouthfeel.  Great saison.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2014 4/19/2013:
2011 Bottle- I think this brew gets better every time I have it.  Crazy good. Crazy. I bought 2/3 bottles the shop had and I think Im gonna drive 30 miles tomorrow morning to get the last one. Worth the extra $4 in gas. 
11/16/2012:
2011 Bottle. Beautiful cloudy orange with gigantic fluffy white head. Aroma is so floral sweet and strong. The flavor is the best. Smooth. Citrusy. Grassy. 

3/13/2010: 
Nice looking, light orange color and a little cloudy. The head was large at first and settled shortly after. Aroma is very strong, as soon as the cork popped I could smell it. Great flavor- great!

another one that i think is the best beer ive ever had. that sounds funny, but thats the great thing about beer, is that when your palate starts to change, you can have a new beer that is unbelievable. soft, tangy, light but with enough alcohol that you know your drinking a nice beer. im actually not sure what the difference is with this and an abbey tripel, very similar tastes. delicious.
Hazy yellow colour with a very big head. Aroma is malty with spicies and perhaps some hops. The flavor is similar and with a dry finish.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2013 Bottle: 
Nice white head in top of a hazy dark yellow colored beer.
Very nice fruity fresh smell with a hints of hops, alcohol, flowers and yeast.
Taste is a very well balanced and fresh mix of fruits, spices, hops, malts, sweets, fruits and yeast. Flowers coming through after a while.
Lovrly balanced with a medium to full body.
Great saison!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
A: The pour is a hazy light golden color with a fluffy white head which sticks around for most of the enjoyment process.

S: There are plenty of the typical saison aromas of spice, yeast, lemon, and perhaps even a touch of farmhouse character.

T: I did not find the normal pepper character to be quite as noticeable here, which to me, is a plus. A fair amount of coriander, lemon, citrus peel, and a mild funk.

M: The body is medium with a full and creamy carbonation.

D: A nice beer, and surprisingly strong at 9.5% ABV. The flavors were good, but a little less refreshing than your typical saison.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2011 75cl bottle 2009. Hazy gold color with a very big creamy head that is very steady and leaves some beatifull lacing. Aroma is very malty with spices and some refreshing hops. Taste is malty with spices and some hops creating a nice dry bitter aftertaste. Medium body with a very soft creamy mouthfeel. Taste is very balanced, thirst-quenching and the drinkablity is superb. The alcohol is very well hidden. A magnificent winter brew!
One of the best saison ales that i have come in contact with especially being a summer seasonal. Bold and flavorful yet not overpowering.

Has smells of malt, caramel, butterscotch and just a shade earthy.  It tastes slightly sweet with heavier bitter/sour overtones.  It has a medium bodied slightly creamy texture with a bitter finish.  Overall I gotta say I like it.  Very drinkable.

THOUGHTS: Sort of like a way more complex Duvel. Hid alcohol incredibly well. It was a very well made beer of the highest quality, but not really my cup of tea (or beer). Very complex. Intense aroma. It went surprisingly well with a microwaved pretzel and squeeze cheese.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a medium to dark yellow with a huge, rocky, ever so slightly off-white head that slowly diminished and left beyond excellent lacing. There were also tiny particles in the body of an average duration. The aroma was light to moderate candy sugar; moderate floral hops; moderate to heavy doughy sweaty, leathery , cheesy, earthy, funky and spicy yeast; slight meaty yeast; apricot, peaches and oranges. The funk grew as it warmed. The initial flavor was acidic and lightly sweet; while the finish was sweet, acidic, slightly sour and fairly bitter. There was citrus, oranges, tangerine, sour fruit, yeast, candy sugar, cracker, apricot, spicy yeast, peach, peach pit, a bit of pepper, citrus rind, floral hops, light bread that was lightly toasted, musty and dusty yeast, slight funk, and citrus hops toward the end. The light to medium body was very dry with very fizzy carbonation and a dry and lightly metallic finish.

Bottle. Pours a dark golden cor with a huge bright white foamy head. Lots of thick lacing sporadically left on the glass. Nose is honey and athick grainy scent.
